loans.name: Dania Maria

texts.es:
La joven Dania es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es una chiclera y venta de golosinas, desde hace 10 años.
Doña Dania su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. Necesita el préstamo en esta ocasión para la compra de confites, bombones, galletas, churros, etc. que es uno de sus negocios y así surtir su negocio, el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos.
Doña Dania Con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes a diario y con esta ayuda poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. 
Espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre  del  2014
texts.en:
Dania is a very hard-working and responsible person who lives in southern Honduras with her family. Her business is a candy and gum stand. She has had the business for 10 years. Dania's business is located in her home. She needs a loan today to buy candy, cookies, pastries, etc. for her business and in this way stock her business, which provides her a large part of her income. Dania hopes to increase her sales and the increased stock would help because she doesn't have enough products to cover the orders her customers are asking for daily. This will be able to help her improve the quality of life for her family and increase the income in her home. She hopes in the short term to grow her business and with this be able to continue supporting her family. She also hopes that her children complete their education so that they can have greater opportunities in life.
Choluteca, Honduras – November 2014

loans.use: to buy candy, cookies, pastries, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Makara

texts.en:
Makara, 34, is originally from Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. He has two dependent children who are currently enrolled in school. To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crops to the local dealers. So far, it is almost 20 years for him of being a farmer. Apart from being involved with the agriculture sector, he is also a construction project contractor. The total income that he can generate from his two main jobs is USD 4.00 per day, on average.

During this time, there is no verity of construction materials for him to compete with other contractors. Therefore, he is applying for a Kiva loan to buy a cement-mixing machine. He is thankful to all the lenders for their financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a cement-mixing machine

loans.name: Merineza

texts.en:
Merineza is 30 years old and married with three children.
She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell.
Merineza has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell nipa roofing business for nine years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear products.
She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 62 years old and married with one child who is in school. Ofelia works very hard to provide for her family.
She runs a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell.
Ofelia has been in this business for five years.
In the future, Ofelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 55 years old and married with nine children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Mary Ann has a manufacturing bags business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her bag-making.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her bag-making.

loans.name: Aguida

texts.en:
Aguida is 67 years old and married with five children. Aguida works very hard to provide for them.

Aguida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, cooking oil, soft-drinks, noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell. Aguida has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cooking oil, soft-drinks, noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, etc.

Aguida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional food and household items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 56 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy a stock of coffee, milk, canned goods, egg, etc.

Ma. Fe has borrowed and repaid loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from farming vegetables. She aspires to save enough to buy more farmlands.

loans.use: to buy a stock of coffee, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia works hard to support her family. Amalia is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.
Amalia requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.
Amalia has been in this business for 35 years now.
In the future, Amalia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 50 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  
Elsie has a dry goods business in the Philippines. Elsie requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items to sell like bags, body lotion, and other ready-to-wear clothing.
Elsie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like bags, body lotion, and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Rhea Mae

texts.en:
Rhea Mae is 33 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school.
She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rhea Mae is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.
Rhea Mae has been raising pigs for nine years and also earns additional income from farming rice and ready-to-wear.
She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Reina Cecilia

texts.es: Reina de 39 años de edad se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace varios años, le ha ido muy bien su trabajo ya que realiza las prendas al gusto de los clientes, ella vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, nuevamente esta solicitando otro crédito para poder comprar los materiales necesarios como: telas, botones, hilos, elásticos, agujas, etc. todo por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Reina, 39, has operated a tailoring business for several years.  She says that the business is successful because she listens to her customers and delivers what they ask for.  Reina lives with her husband and two children in a house that they own.  She is applying for a new loan that she will use to buy bulk supplies of the inputs she needs--fabric, buttons, thread, needles, etc.--to maintain and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, thread, and needles in bulk.

loans.name: Nhóm 12 Bắc Thọ, Ngư Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Toàn operates a food stall/restaurant selling seafood. She is requesting a loan to purchase seafood to resell.
Toàn is 36 years old, and she is married with four children.
Toàn is the group leader of the Nhóm 12 Bắc Thọ, Ngư Lộc solidarity group, which consists of five members. 
In 2012, Toàn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Toàn has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Toàn has been involved in this business for four years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.
In the future, Toàn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase seafood to resell.

loans.name: Rony Humberto

texts.es: Rony de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el se dedica desde hace 1a años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y yuca, cuando ya está su cosecha la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Rony, 32, lives with his wife and son in a house that they own.  He has operated a farming business for a year and grows maize and yucca.  He will sell his crop to local buyers, many of whom are past customers.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy supplies--seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, etc.--and improve his fields so that he can carry on his business.  Rony, pictured standing in his fields, says that the business is his only source of income and that your help will allow him to grow and improve it.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Hương

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương has a retail business selling dry food.
Hương is 28 years old, and she is married with two children.
She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.
This is Hương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hương has been involved in this business for eight years.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a clean water system and hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.
In the future, Hương hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is a 46-year-old, married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She has a general store business in the Philippines. Mary Jean has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like canned goods, shampoo, spices etc.

She has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Mary Jean would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, shampoo, spices, etc.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 50 years old and has three children. Violeta is married and has two children who are in school.
She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Violeta requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.
Violeta has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
In the future, Violeta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Bebian

texts.en:
Bebian is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Bebian is 40 years old and has four children who are in school.

Bebian has a business direct-selling Avon products in the Philippines. Bebian requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional products like lipsticks, deodorant, body spray, lotion, shampoo, etc. to sell. Bebian has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future, Bebian would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional personal products to sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 37 years old and married with four children.
She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like soap, coffee, milk, and canned goods.
Dolores has borrowed and paid 34 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years. 
She successfully repaid her previous loans, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.
Dolores aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like soap, coffee, milk, and canned goods.

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es: Todas las mañanas Don Félix se levanta para ofrecer el servicio de soldadura a sus clientes habitantes de diversos municipios de Estelí. Tiene 53 años de edad está casado y tiene a tres personas a su cargo. Don Félix siempre ha querido mejorar las condiciones de su familia, es por eso que solicita el crédito para cancelar el derecho a aguas negras en su hogar. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta construir su baño y que su hogar de esta manera brinde unas condiciones más higiénicas.
texts.en: Felix gets up every morning to offer welding services to his customers who come from different municipalities in Estelí. He is 53 years old, married and with three dependents. Felix has always wanted to improve his family's living conditions, so he is asking for a loan to pay for the cost of connecting his home to the sewage line. Among his plans for the future, he would like to build a bathroom and to live in more hygienic conditions.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of connecting to the sewage line

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
La señora Emilia es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de ropa clasificada y tortillas, desde hace 12 años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive y diversos lugares aledaños. 
Doña Emilia necesita el préstamo para la compra de más productos como blusas, vestidos, faldas, camisas, pantalones, calzonetas, etc. y materia prima para seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos. Con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes a diario.
Doña Emilia espera que esta inversión le permita poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios.


Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2014
texts.en:
Emilia's a very hardworking and responsible person.  She lives with her family in a community in the south of Honduras.  For 12 years her business has been selling used clothing and tortillas.  She runs her business in her house, in the town where she lives, and in various nearby places.

Emilia needs the loan to buy more products such as blouses, dresses, skirts, shirts, pants, underwear, etc., as well as ingredients to keep on doing her job, which gives her a big part of her income.  She hopes her sales will increase with the loan and that it will very useful to her, because she doesn't have the products she needs to cover her customers' requests on a daily basis.

Emilia hopes this investment will allow her to be able to improve her family's quality of life with the increase in household income.  She hopes her business will grow in the short term so she can keep on supporting her family.  She also hopes her children will get the education they need.

Choluteca, Honduras, October 2014

loans.use: to buy blouses, dresses, skirts, shirts, pants, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Nhóm 30 Thắng Tây, Ngư Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Duyên has a service business repairing bicycles. She is requesting a loan to purchase instruments to maintain the moto-bike repair shop.
Duyên is 40 years old and she is married with 5 children.
Duyên is the group leader of the Nhóm 30 Thắng Tây, Ngư Lộc solidarity group, which consists of four members. 
In 2009, Duyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Duyên has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Duyên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.
In the future, Duyên hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase instruments to maintain the moto-bike repair shop.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es: Guadalupe 52 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, vive con su esposo y su hija en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 15 años, ubicado en el mercado municipal  que está cerca de su lugar de residencia, Guadalupe solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más frutas y verduras por mayor, para tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Guadalupe, 52, is a responsible, hard-working woman, fully committed to her small business.  She lives with her husband and daughter in a house that they own.  Guadalupe has operated a fruits and vegetables sales business for 15 years.  She has a spot in the local market, not far from her house.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy wholesale supplies of fruits and vegetables that she will resell for a profit.  The investment will help her to grow her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her fruits & vegetables sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes wholesale

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina tiene 40 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su hijo y su compañero de vida, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 8 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Martina is 40-years old and lives in her own home with her son and her husband.  She has had a small store, that she runs out of her home, for eight years.  She has a lot of customers because of her good prices her friendly manner at the time of the sale.  She is requesting a loan so she can purchase more soups, eggs, staple grains, beverages, sweets, sweet bread. etc. so she can improve her income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more soups, eggs, staple grains, beverages, sweets, sweet breads etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to execute a plan of studies at the Institute.

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Feliza works hard to support her family.
She has a farm and a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies for her farm and business.
She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.
Feliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ma. Regina

texts.en:
Ma. Regina is 39 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Ma. Regina works very hard to provide for them.
Ma. Regina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.
Ma. Regina has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soft drinks, canned goods, and other groceries. 
In the future Ma. Regina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 50 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Catalina is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Catalina has been in pig fattening for 20 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling coconut meat.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 49 años de edad viven casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su pick up desde hace 12 años, tiene muchos clientes que lo prefieren por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Manuel, 49, lives with his wife and three children in a house that they own.  He has operated a taxi business for 12 years and has many regular customers. His customers prefer his service, he says, because he is a responsible driver.  His income from the business covers the family's expenses.  Manuel is applying for a loan that he will use to service his vehicle and buy new tires.  The business is his only source of income and his only means of making a better life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to support his taxi business.

loans.name: Gloria De Jesus

texts.es: Gloria de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, la clienta es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, todo con el único deseo de salir adelante y de esta manera brindarle una vida mejor a su familia. Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual está ubicada en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 27 años, Gloria solicita un préstamo para poder comprar  más frutas y verduras por mayor, ya que de esta manera podrá darles una vida mejor a su familia
texts.en: Gloria, 48, lives with her husband and son in a house that they own.  She is a hard-working woman, fully committed to her small business.  The business, she says, is her means of supporting her family and getting ahead in the world.  Gloria has operated a fruits and vegetables sales business for 27 years.  She has a spot in the market, not far from her house.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy wholesale supplies of fruits and vegetables.  The investment will help her to grow her business and carry on supporting her family.

loans.use: to stock her fruits & vegetables sales business.

loans.name: Uchrakhbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Uchrakhbayar, 26 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a manager at a restaurant since 2013. His wife studies at university and works as a part-time waitress, at a cafe. Their daughters are seen to, by his mother.

His family is currently living in a rental apartment without any furniture. So he is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy a wardrobe, chairs, and table. The furniture will decorate his home and increase his enthusiasm for hard work. Also, his family will live in a more comfortable place, at least eating dinner at a table.

loans.use: to buy a wardrobe, chairs, and a dinner table.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy footwear and handbags to increase her revenue and improve her family's way of life.

loans.name: Sreymach

texts.en:
Sreymach, 35 years old, is originally from Kampong Speu Province. Sreymach has two dependent children who are enrolled in the local school. She is an experienced and active farmer. By operating a farming business on a small rice field, she can earn around USD 2.50 a day to support her family's daily expenses. 

To accelerate her farming operation, she would like to use a plowing machine to help her in the farming process. Because there is a shortage of money, she would like to get a Kiva loan to buy a plowing machine. With the support from this loan, she hopes that she can operate her farm better and faster. She is thankful to all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy a plowing machine

loans.name: Nath

texts.en:
Nath, 33 years old, is originally from Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. She is a mother of three dependent children who are enrolled in school. To make a living, she has opened a small grocery store that is located near her house. This business allows her to earn USD 5.00 a day, on average. So far, she has been in this field of business for one year. Beside this, she owns a small cassava farmland which she manages and operates, farming seasonally. 

In this farming season, she is going to use natural fertilizers in her farmland. Because there is a shortage of money, she would like to get a Kiva loan via KHL to buy fertilizers to use in her farming process. With the support from this loan, she hopes that it can make her cassava growing better and produce more crops for her. She also thanks all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Junay

texts.en:
Junay is 56 years old and a widow with seven children, one of whom is in school. Junay works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase stock of household goods to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, etc.

Junay has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Junay would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock of household goods to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, etc

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 24 years old and married. She has four children, three of whom are in school. Liezel works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy items to sell at her store, like shampoo, soap, eggs, noodles, spices, etc. She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Liezel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell at her store, like shampoo, soap, eggs, noodles, and spices

loans.name: Gena

texts.en:
Gena is 42 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are in school. Gena works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items like chips, bread, soft drinks, coffee, etc.

Gena has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Gena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like chips, bread, soft drinks, coffee, etc

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. Imelda is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like cooking oil, milk, sugar, etc.

Imelda has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Imelda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like cooking oil, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 51 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.

Lorna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like soft drinks, canned goods, diapers and school supplies.

Lorna has borrowed and repaid 29 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lorna aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items like soft drinks, canned goods, diapers and school supplies.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 50 years old and married with children.

Lolita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, spices, etc.

Lolita has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Lolita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, spices, etc

loans.name: Myagmar

texts.en:
Mr. Myagmar, 29 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

He and his wife have been transporting people since 2012 using a microbus. He drives the microbus while his wife collects the fees. Their daughter stays at kindergarten.

He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to insulate his home by buying fiberglass and foam in preparation for the harsh winter. The insulation will surely have an effect on the ger's energy preservation. Also his family will burn less coal for heating, releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to insulate his traditional Mongolian ger.

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BADEYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Fiyele, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de grain d’arachide, de condiments, de savon, de chèvre et de baigne. Les femmes du groupe BADEYA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente KADIATOU, personne au milieu dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de grain d’arachide. Elle compte acheter 2 sacs de grain d’arachide sur place. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à Wakoro à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour couvrir les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The Badeya group is made up of married women who are on average 34 years old with an average of 3 children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Fiyele, in the Dioïla district, Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of Mali.)

The women came to know each other through family, neighbors, and friendship. They are in the business of selling groundnuts, spices, soap, goats, and toiletries. The women of the Badeya group are on their second group loan.

In order to meet the growing need of their customers, the women turned to Soro Yiriwaso.

Kadiatou, the person pictured in the middle of the seated row in the photo, cannot read. She is currently a seller of groundnut seeds. She plans to purchase 2 bags of groundnut seeds in her area. 

Kadiatou will make her sales at retail for cash in Wakoro to a customer base made up of both men and women. She plans to earn a monthly income of 35,000 francs CFA, which she will use to cover her family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase groundnut seeds

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
Khun, who is 47 years old, is residing in the Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. She has four children in total; one is married and three are single.

To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crops to the local dealers. So far, she has been in this career for nearly thirty years. She can make a net profit of USD $3.00 per day, on average.

Currently, she would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of traveling.

She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Juana Valentina

texts.es:
La señora Juana es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es una pulpería, desde hace 15 años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. 
Doña Juana necesita el préstamo para la compra de más productos como arroz, azúcar, café, pan, queso, harina, huevos, aceite, etc. para seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos. Con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes.
Doña Juana también espera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar y un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre del  2014
texts.en:
Juana is a hardworking and responsible person. She lives in a community in south Honduras with her family. She's owned a grocery store for 15 years, that she operates out of home in a special room.
Juana needs a loan to buy more products like rice, sugar, coffee, bread, cheese, flour, eggs, oil, etc. to continue doing her job, which provides a large part of her income. With the loan, she expects sales to increase, which will be of great help, as many times, she doesn't have the necessary products to cover orders placed by her customers.
Juana also expects to improve the quality of life of her family by increasing her household income. She would like to grow her business in the near future to continue supporting her family, and make sure her children can go to school and have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras - November 2014

loans.use: to buy more products like rice, sugar, coffee, bread, cheese, flour, eggs, oil, etc. for her grocery store

loans.name: Belle Dame Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BELLE DAME est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Tomba, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de chèvre, de volaille, de la galette et d’articles divers. Les femmes du groupe BELLE DAME sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente MAGNE, deuxième personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des debout analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de chèvres. Elle compte acheter des chèvres sur place.
La vente se fait en espèce à Wakoro à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour couvrir les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The Belle Dame group is made up of married women, who are on average 35 years old with an average of 5 children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Tomba in the Dioïla district of the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of Mali.) 

The women came to know each other through family, neighbors, and friendship. They are in the business of selling cereals, goats, poultry, biscuits, and assorted products. The women of Belle Dame are on their fifth group loan.

In order to meet the needs of their growing customer base, the women turned to Soro Yiriwaso.

Magne is the second person from left to right in the standing row of the photo. She cannot read, and is currently in the business of selling goats. She plans to purchase goats in her area.

Magne makes her sales for cash in Wakoro to a customer base made up of both men and women. She plans to earn a monthly income of 60,000 francs CFA, which she will use to cover her family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase goats

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Tingolé, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales, de savon et du bois de chauffe.
Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente MAGNE, première personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement restauratrice. Elle compte acheter  du riz, du poisson frais et des condiments chez les grossistes à Fana.
La vente des plats se fait en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 12 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of married women who are on average 40 years old with an average of 4 children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Tingolé in the Dioïla district of the region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of Mali.) 

The women came to know each other through family, neighbors, and friends. They are in the restaurant business, as well as selling cereals, soap, and firewood. 

The women of Benkadi are on their fifth group loan. In order to meet the great demand of their customers, they turned to Soro Yiriwaso. 

Magne is the first person from left to right in the seated row of the photo. She cannot read, and is currently in the restaurant business. She plans to purchase rice, fresh fish, and spices from wholesalers in Fana.

Magne will sell her prepared foods for cash at a market to a customer base made up of both men and women. She plans to earn a monthly income of 12,000 francs CFA, which she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase restaurant supplies

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: Maria de 65 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, María vive junto a su grupo familiar en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 20 años, ubicado en el mercado municipal  que está cerca de su lugar de residencia, María solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más frutas y verduras por mayor, para tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria, 65, is a hard-working, responsible woman, fully committed to her small business.  She lives with her family in a house that they own.  Maria has operated a fruits and vegetables sales business for 20 years.  She has a spot in a local market, near her house.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy wholesale supplies of fruits and vegetables.  The investment will help her to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her fruits & vegetables sales business.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La señora Erika es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de cosmeticos, desde hace 3 años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive y lugares cercanos.
Doña Erika recorre ofreciendo su producto y necesita el préstamo para la compra de lociones, perfumes, cremas, etc. para seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual le ayuda mucho ya que las ganancias son de mucha utilidad en el hogar.
Doña Erika espera que sus ventas aumenten y lograr mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar, desea seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2014
texts.en:
Erika is a hardworking and responsible person. She lives in a community in south Honduras with her family. She's been selling cosmetics for 3 years, out of her home and to nearby places.
Erika offers her products door to door and she needs a loan to buy lotions, perfumes, creams, etc. to continue doing her job, which helps a lot because her profits are an important source of income.
Erika is hoping her sales will increase to she can have a better quality of life, as well as her family's, so her children can go to school and have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras - October 2014

loans.use: to buy lotions, perfumes, creams, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Liliam Zulema

texts.es:
La señora Liliam es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de ropa clasificada y golosinas, desde hace 6 años.
Doña Liliam su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación necesita el préstamo para la compra de más productos como blusas, vestidos, faldas, camisas, pantalones, etc. y poder seguir realizando su actividad, el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos.
 Doña Liliam tiene producto encardo y espera que para estas fiestas navideñas poder obtener más ganancias que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida. Con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2014
texts.en:
Liliam is a hardworking and responsible person. She lives in a community in south Honduras with her family. She began selling assorted apparel and and candy six years ago.
Liliam runs her business out of her home, and she needs a loan to buy more products like blouses, dresses, skirts, shirts, pants, etc. to keep up with demand, which is a large part of her income.
Liliam has pre-ordered items to cover and she hopes more will come with the holiday season, so she can increase her income and improve her quality of life. She is hoping her sales will increase to she can continue supporting her family, so her children can go to school and have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras - October 2014

loans.use: to buy more products like blouses, dresses, skirts, shirts, pants, etc. for her business

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is 35 years old and lives in the city of Dipolog. He is married and has one child. Roger owns and operates a business motorcycle to transport local community members for a living. He has been doing this for five years. 

He has requested a loan to purchase motorcycle parts. Roger is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Roger hopes to save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle parts

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a 57-year-old widow who lives with her only child.  Jenny's dream of improving the quality of life for her child's future led her to find ways to augment their living by having her sewing services improve. It is her only source of income. 
Jenny makes curtains, repairs damaged cloths as requested, and even makes dresses, work she has done for some 20 years.  She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit for buying another sewing machine. She wants this for expansion of her business.

Her dream is to acquire a store with its own roof to improve sales.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en:
Desideria is 45 years old and has five children. Desideria is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Desideria is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Desideria requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business. Desideria has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Desideria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Hernan Alberto

texts.es:
Dos pequeños niños de 9 y 11 años de edad son la inspiración, fuerza, y motivo para levantarse cada día del señor Hernán quien con su Legumbrera busca la manera de mantener a su familia en unas condiciones dignas y en su negocio ha logrado crear un trabajo y su sueño es crecer para apoyar a más personas y darle siempre a su familia lo mejor que este a su alcance,
A pesar de la fuerte competencia en el sector el señor Hernán sueña con poder abrir nuevos locales comerciales generando empleo a personas que de verdad lo necesitan y ver como su idea de negocio le da utilidad para iniciar a pagar la cuota de su casa propia que es su gran objetivo.
Solicita un crédito para comprar surtido en frutas y verduras y principalmente para comprar una báscula digital formalizando cada vez más su negocio.
texts.en:
Hernán operates a fruits and vegetables sales business and says that his two children, 11- and 9-years old, respectively, are motivation enough for him to carry on the business.  He wants to ensure that his family has a decent standard of living and he hopes to grow his business so that he can provide them with everything possible.
Hernán says that competition is ferocious among fruits and vegetables vendors but he hopes, nonetheless, to open other shops.  Growing his business would not only allow him to save for a house, but also to provide employment for local people, something that is sorely needed here.
Hernán is applying for a loan that he will use to buy a digital scale and stock his business with supplies of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy a digital scale and stock his fruits & vegetables sales business.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita is 54 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Alita is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies. Alita has been farming rice for 15 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elvira is 48 years old and has three children who are in school.

Elvira has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Elvira requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. Elvira has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Norlita

texts.en:
Norlita is 54 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, coffee, sugar, spices, etc.

Norlita has been in this business for 18 years.

In the future, Norlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, coffee, sugar, spices, etc

loans.name: Shiela Mae

texts.en:
Shiela Mae is 21 years old and married.  She has one child.  With her child in school, Shiela Mae works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a dried coconut meat business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Shiela Mae has been in this business for two years.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Bujidmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Bujidmaa, 42 years old, lives with her husband in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as janitor since 2012. Her husband isa  sentry at the same place. They live in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy insulation materials such as fiberglass and foam in order to insulate her home. After insulation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating, releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to insulate her Mongolian traditional ger

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 18 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 3 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y su madre en casa propia, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young woman, whose face has been blurred because she is 18 years old and lives in a high-risk area, has owned a small store for the past 3 years, located in her residence. She sells a variety of products such as candies, soft drinks, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, jelly, sugar, etc. and she has a lot of customers because of her good prices.

The young woman lives in her own home with her husband and her mother. She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise on wholesale. This is her only source of income and this will allow her to have greater earnings and a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candies, soft drinks, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, jelly, sugar, etc., on wholesale.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Bababougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments, de tubercules, de poisson fumé et d’articles divers. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente MARIAM, deuxième personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’articles divers. Elle compte acheter des boucles d’oreilles, des bracelets et des colliers chez les grossistes à Dioïla.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 12 000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour couvrir les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of married women who are on average 42 years old with an average of 5 children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Bababougou in the district of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of Mali.) 

The women came to know each other through family, neighbors, and friends. They are in the restaurant business, as well as selling spices, tubers, smoked fish, and various items. The women of Benkadi are on their second group loan. 

In order to meet the great demand of their customers, the women turned to Soro Yiriwaso. 

Mariam is the second person from left to right in the standing row of the photo. She cannot read, and is currently in the business of selling assorted products. She plans to purchase earrings, bracelets, and necklaces from wholesalers in Dioïla. 

Mariam makes her sales at retail for cash from her home and at a market to a customer base made up of both men and women. She plans to earn a monthly income of 12,000 francs CFA, which she will use to cover her family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase various items

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Tingolé, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments et du  charbon de bois.
Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente MARIAM, deuxième personne de la gauche vers la droite est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter 2 sacs de sel, des cartons de cube Maggi et du grain d’arachide chez les grossistes à Fana.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of married women who are on average 43 years old with an average of 6 children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Tingolé in the Dioïla district, region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of Mali.) 

The women came to know each other through family, neighbors ,and friends. They are in the business of selling cereals, spices, and firewood. 

The women of Danaya are on their fifth group loan. In order to meet the great demand of their customers, they turned to Soro Yiriwaso. 

Mariam is the second person from left to right in the photo. She cannot read, and is currently a seller of spices.

Mariam plans to purchase 2 bags of salt, boxes of Maggi seasoning cubes, and groundnut seeds from wholesalers in Fana. She will make her sales at retail for cash from her home and in a market to a customer base made up of both men and women. 

Mariam plans to earn a monthly income of 35,000 francs CFA, which she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase spices

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKAFO est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Fiyele, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de l’habillement, de la galette et de gâteau. Les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente KOROTIM, première personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des debout analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de galette à base de farine. Elle compte acheter du sachet plastique, de l’huile, du sucre et de la farine de blé chez les grossistes à Wacoro puis le transforme en galette.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de  9.000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour couvrir les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The Djekafo group is made up of married women, who are on average 33 years old with an average of 3 children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Fiyele in the district of Dioïla of the Koulikoro (the second administrative region of Mali.) 

The women came to know each other through family, neighbors, and friends. They are in the business of selling cereals, clothing, biscuits, and cakes.

The women of Djekafo are on their second group loan. In order to meet the great need of their customers, they turned to Soro Yiriwaso.

Korotim is the first person from right to left in the standing row. She cannot read, and is currently a seller of wheat biscuits. 

Korotim plans on purchasing plastic bags, oil, sugar, and wheat flour from wholesalers in Wacoro, which she will then use to make biscuits. She sells the biscuits at retail for cash at a market to a customer base made up of both men and women. 

Korotim plans on earning a monthly income of 9,000 francs CFA, which will be used to cover her family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour to make biscuits

loans.name: Santos Esther

texts.es:
Doña Santos es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a sus hijos y su esposo en una comunidad en la zona sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas el cual es muy conocido en su comunidad lo que hace que la demanda de su producto sea mucha. 
Doña Santos necesita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima como maíz, leña y cal para seguir elaborando sus tortillas y contar con este ingreso el cual es muy importante para su hogar.  Espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.
Doña Santos espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia a tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre  2014
texts.en:
Santos is a hardworking and responsible woman. She lives in a community in south Honduras with her husband and children. She makes and sells tortillas that are very popular in her community, so there's huge demand for them.
Santos needs a loan to buy raw materials such as corn, wood and lime to further make more tortillas, as her profits are an important source of income in her household.
Santos is hoping her business will continue to grow to become the best known in the community so she can support her family and offer them better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras - October 2014

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as corn, wood and lime to further make more tortillas for her business

loans.name: Russel

texts.en: Russel has been working on her farm and selling grocery goods in her retail store to make a living. Aside from this, she has a piggery, raising pigs to sell. She has successfully repaid  her previous loan, used for buying grocery goods to sell. She is hoping for an improvement to her business.  She took a new loan to expand her piggery structure for expansion to her business, wanting to improve the business so as to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to expand her piggery structure for expansion to her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a fruits & vegetables sales business.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 47 years old and has one child. Emelda is married and has one child who is in school.

Emelda is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Emelda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Emelda has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Emelda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Leogarda

texts.en:
Leogarda is 59 years old and married with eight children, one of whom in school.

Leogarda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc. She has borrowed and paid off 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 36 years.

Leogarda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Lenane

texts.en:
Lenane is 48 years old and has five children.  Lenane is married and has one child who is in school.  She is in the agricultural business farming and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Lenane requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a new variety of seeds of different vegetables to plant.

Lenane has been farming and selling vegetables for 25 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of seeds of different vegetables

loans.name: Bartola Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Santo Domingo de los Colorados es una ciudad de la región costa conocida en el país por ser una zona muy productiva y comercial. Justamente en este punto existe mucho intercambio comercial por ser el puerto terrestre que une la sierra y la costa. Aquí vive Bartola, una señora de 47 años, separada, viven con un hijo.
Bartola a pesar de no tener un esposo a lado ella ha salido adelante sola, ha trabajado mucho por darles la educación a sus hijos, trabaja todos los días vendiendo en una pequeña tienda que tiene en su domicilio, se levanta desde muy temprano a atender a la clientela hasta horas de la tarde, siempre tratando de dar un buen servicio.
Bartola es una clienta fiel a la institución, hace años atrás acudió a ella por la oportunidad que brindan al ayudar al microempresario a través de créditos; ahora es su segundo crédito, con el podrá comprar más mercadería para la tienda ya que desea incrementarla. 
Agradece a todos quienes forman Fundación Alternativa y en especial a Kiva porque con los créditos entregados ayudan a muchas personas que necesitan prosperar en sus pequeñas empresas.
texts.en:
Santo Domingo de los Colorados is a city in the coastal region, known in the country for being a very productive and commercial area. Precisely in this place there is a lot of commercial exchange, since it is the land port that unites the mountains and the coast. This is where Bartola lives. She is a 47-year-old, separated woman who lives with a son. Although she does not have a husband by her side, Bartola has gotten ahead on her own. She has worked hard to give an education to her children. She works every day selling in a small store that she has in her home. She gets up very early to help her customers until the afternoon, always trying to provide good service.

Bartola is a faithful customer of the institution. Years ago, it came to her because of the opportunity that loans can provide to help small business owners. Now, this is her second loan. With the loan she will be able to buy more merchandise for the store, as she wants to expand it. She is thankful to everyone who is part of Fundación Alternativa, and especially to Kiva because the loans they deliver help a lot of people who need to prosper in their small businesses.

loans.use: to stock her convenience store and, with this growth, to prosper as a small business owner and get ahead.

loans.name: Kotakegne Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOTAKEGNE est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 48 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Tingolé, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales, de condiments, du charbon de bois et du savon.
Les femmes du groupe KOTAKEGNE sont à leurs troisièmes prêts solidaires.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente FATOUMATA, première personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse condiments. Elle compte acheter du sel, du cube Maggi, de la feuille de baobab sèche et de la poudre de combo chez les grossistes à Fana.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 17 500Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Kotakegne group is made up of married women who are on average 48 years old with an average of 6 children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Tingolé in the Dioïla district of the region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of Mali.)

The women came to know each other through family, neighbors, and friends. They are in the restaurant business and also in the business of selling cereals, spices, firewood, and soap.

The women of Kotakegne are on their third group loan. In order to meet the great demand of their customers, they turned to Soro Yiriwaso.

Fatoumata is the first person from left to right in the seated row of the photo. She cannot read, and is currently a seller of spices.

Fatoumata plans to purchase salt, Maggi seasoning cubes, dried baobab leaves, and combo powder from wholesalers in Fana. She makes her sales at retail for cash from her home to a customer base made up of both men and women.

Fatoumata plans to earn a monthly income of 17,500 francs CFA, which she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase spices

loans.name: Jovel

texts.es: Jovel de 65 años de edad se dedica desde hace 30 años a la agricultura principalmente al cultivo de arroz bajo riego,comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en casa propia, Jovel está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jovel is 65 years old and for the past 30 years has made a living in agriculture, primarily by farming rice under irrigation. He markets his products in the various markets near his house. He lives in his own home with his wife and their four children. 

Jovel is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc. and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph. This will allow him to continue his work and have greater income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Ramon Ernesto

texts.es: Ramón de 46 años de edad tiene un negocio de venta de hotdog desde hace 12 años tiene muy buena clientela pues vende su comida a un buen precio vende de forma ambulante en su carretón por los diferentes mercados, también posee un molino de nixtamal en su casa de habitación, el solicita nuevamente otro crédito pero esta vez para comprar todo lo necesario para elaborar sus alimentos como: pan, tomates, cebollas, mayonesa, mortadelas, entre otros ingredientes y poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en su casa con los gastos que se le puedan presentar.
texts.en: Ramon, who is 46 years old, has had a business of selling hotdogs for 12 years. He has a very good customer base, since he sells his food at a good price. He sells as a street vendor with his cart at the various markets. He also has a mill for nixtamal (processed corn) in his home. He is applying again for another loan, but this time it is to buy all the necessary items to make his food, such as bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, and mortadella, among other ingredients, so that he can have better earnings and continue helping with the expenses that can arise in his household.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, and mortadella, among other ingredients.

loans.name: Daysi Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora Daysi es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es una pulpería, desde hace 10 años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive.
Doña Daysi necesita el préstamo para la compra arroz, azúcar, café, pan, leche, huevos, frijoles, refrescos, aguas, etc. para seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos, con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes.
Doña Daysi desea poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida de la familia y la de su familia con el aumento de los ingresos y en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y poder salir adelante con sus hijos.

Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre  del  2014
texts.en:
Daysi is a hardworking and responsible woman. She lives in a community in south Honduras with her family. She's owned a grocery store for 10 years out of her home in a special room.
Daysi needs a loan to buy rice, sugar, coffee, bread, milk, eggs, beans, soft drinks, water, etc. to continue doing her job, which is an important source of income for her. She is hoping to increase her sales with this loan, as she sometimes doesn't have many of the products her customers need.  
Daysi wants to improve her family's quality of life by increasing her profits and she also wants to improve her business so she and her kids and get ahead.

Choluteca, Honduras - October 2014

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, coffee, bread, milk, eggs, beans, soft drinks, water, etc. for her business

loans.name: Ana Mirtha

texts.es:
La señora Mirtha  es muy conocida en la comunidad donde  reside vive  junto a su esposo e hijos esto al sur del país cuenta con el apoyo de su familia en lo que es el mantenimiento de su negocio.
Doña Mirtha cada día se traslada a distintos lugares cercanos a donde vive a lo que es comprar animales para revenderlos y obtener más ganancias, necesita  el préstamo para invertir en la compra de  gallinas ya que tiene mucha demanda de sus clientes  por sus  buenos precios vende bastante.
Espera con  las ganancias obtenidas pueda así comprar más animales porque se acerca la temporada navideña y  temporada navideña desea que su negocio crezca  y  poder darles a sus hijos un mejor ejemplo y buena calidad de vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre 2014
texts.en:
Mirtha is very well known in the community where she lives. She lives with her husband and children, this in the south of the country. She has the support of her family for maintaining her business.

Every day, Mirtha goes to different places near to where she lives. She buys animals to resell them and obtain more income. She needs the loan to invest in the purchase of hens, since she has a lot of demand from her customers. Because of her good prices, she sells a lot. She hopes with the obtained profits she will therefore be able to buy more animals because the Christmas season is approaching. She wants her business to grow and to be able to give her children a better example and a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy hens for her business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. Gemma is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Gemma requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Gemma has been in this business for five years now.

Gemma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Vinama Group

texts.fr: Sali, membre représentatif est mariée, mère de 3 enfants dont 2 sont scolarisés et 1 travaille. Le mari de Sali fait la mécanique des motocyclistes et elle-même est restauratrice depuis 10 ans. Cette brave dame a 2 employés qu'elle rémunère chaque mois, ce qui veut dire qu'en plus de son bien-être, elle donne la joie à d'autres personnes aussi. Avec ce prêt, elle voudrait acheter les vivres, les condiments et tout ce qui est nécessaire pour son restaurant. En effet, Sali propose un menu diversifié à sa clientèle. Ce prêt sera d'un grand soutien pour Sali car elle voudrait augmenter le volume de son activité et employé plus de personne. Le bénéfice de ce prêt lui permettront de continuer son activité, de payer les soins de ses enfants en cas de maladie et de pourvoir à leurs petits besoins.
texts.en:
Sali, the representative of the group, is married and the mother of 3 children, 2 of whom attend school and 1 of whom works. Sali's husband is a motorcycle mechanic, and Sali herself has been in the restaurant business for 10 years.

This brave woman has 2 employees whom she pays each month, which means that beyond her own personal well-being, Sali also brings joys to others as well.

With this loan, Sali would like to purchase food, spices, and everything that is necessary for her restaurant. As a result, Sali can offer a more diversified menu to her cusotmers.

This loan will be a great support for Sali, as shewould like to increase her business volume and hire more people. The benefit of this loan is that it will allow her to continue to operate her business, pay for her needs and those of her children in case of illness, and to take care of their daily needs.

loans.use: to grow her restaurant business by offering a more varied menu to her customers

loans.name: Juan Esteban

texts.es:
Una juventud, todo un futuro por delante y un gran espíritu para trabajar y creer que puede aportar grandes cosas a su familia son las cualidades y aspiraciones que llevaron al joven Juan a solicitar un crédito para iniciar su propia empresa, pues se quiere convertir en todo un productor agropecuario y enorgullecer a sus pasados quienes desarrollaron exitosamente esta actividad. 
EL dinero lo invertirá en la compra de dos vacas y aspira en 5 años presentarse ante la respetada comunidad de kiva con un nuevo crédito para comprar más vacas su sueño es crecer y nunca parar.
Juan quiere estudiar, ser el soporte de su familia, sosteniendo un negocio en el cual sus parientes han triunfado.
texts.en:
Youth, a whole future ahead, a great spirit for working and a belief that he can provide big things for his family are the qualities and dreams that drove the young Juan to apply for a loan to start his own business. He wants to turn himself into a complete agricultural producer and make his predecessors proud, who developed this activity successfully.

He will invest the money in the purchase of two cows and in five years, aims to present himself before the respected Kiva community with a new loan to buy more cows. His dream is to grow and never stop.

Juan wants to study, be the support of his family, sustaining a business in which his parents have triumphed.

loans.use: to buy two cows to become independent and start his business.

loans.name: He Muong 4 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Than is a young Thai lady who is married and has a child. Currently, she lives with her husband's family and supports the family by working at agricultural production, including growing rice, cassava and corn, and raising chickens. Despite working very hard, she is very happy because she could contribute significantly to her family.

To expand production and ensure the sustainability of income for the family, Mrs. Than has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program to buy piglets and food for the pigs. She hopes that with the support of the Program, including training and counseling about the technique of raising pigs, together with her experience, the investment will go well and generate high income.

Mrs. Than dreams her family will have a more abundant life and her child will study in a good college and then have a good job.

loans.use: to buy piglets and food for the pigs.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SABOUGNOUMA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Tingolé, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments, de tubercules et de l’habillement.
Les femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont à leur onzième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente AMINATA, première personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de tubercules. Elle compte acheter des sacs de pomme de terre chez les grossistes Fana.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000Fcfa, qui sera investi dans l’élevage de caprins.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma group is made up of married women with an average age of 37 years and an average of 5 children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Tingolé in the Dioïla district of the region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of Mali.)

The women came to know each other through family, neighbors, and friends. They are in the business of selling cereals, spices, tubers, and clothing. The women of Sabougnouma are on their eleventh group loan. In order to meet the great demand from their clients, they turned to Soro Yiriwaso.

Aminata is the first person from left to right in the seated row. She cannot read and is currently in the business of selling tubers. She plans on purchasing bags of potatoes from wholesalers in Fana. She will make her sales at retail for cash from her home and in a market, to a customer base made up of both men and women.

Aminata plans to earn a monthly income of 35,000 francs CFA, which will be invested in order to raise goats.

loans.use: to purchase tubers

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOTOGNONTALA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Fiyele, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de l’oignon, de savon et de baigne. Les femmes du groupe KOTOGNONTALA sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire.
