Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente FANTA, personne au milieu dans le rang des debout analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de beignet à base de mil. Elle compte acheter du beurre de karité, du sucre et 1 sac de mil sur place puis le transforme en beignet.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 15 000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour couvrir les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The Kotognontala group is made up of married women who are on average 41 years old with an average of 4 children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Fiyele in the Dioïla district of the region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of Mali.)

The women came to know each other through family, neighbors, and friends. They are in the business of selling cereals, onions, soap, and toiletries.

The women of Kotognontala are on their fifth group loan. In order to meet the great demand of their customers, they turned to Soro Yiriwaso.

Fanta is the person in the middle of the standing row of the photo. She cannot read, and is currently in the business of selling pastries made from millet. She plans to purchase shea butter, sugar, and 1 bag of millet in the area, which she will then use to make her pastries. 

Fanta sells her pastries at retail for cash in a market to a customer base made up of both men and women. She plans on earning a monthly income of 15,000 francs CFA, which she will use to cover the family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Juana De La Cruz

texts.es: Juana de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas y su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en:
Juana is 33. She lives in a house that she owns with her husband and their two daughters. She sells second hand apparel clothing out of her home. She has many customers because she sells quality items at great prices.
She is asking for a loan to purchase more items to increase her sales and obtain better profits.

loans.use: to buy apparel clothing wholesale

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Faustino tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos menores. Vive en casa propia junto a su familia, el caserio cuenta con luz y agua. Faustino es natural de la zona de Chalaco pero ya reside en la zona de Maray desde hace 10 años ya que su esposa es de alli. La comunidad es pequeña los pobladores se dedican a la crianza de ganado menor y a la agricultura. Su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Faustino es la siembra y comercialización de granos entre estas soya y maiz y la crianza de ganado menor. Además de dedicarse a las labores agricolas. El destino del crédito será destinado para las mejoras y acabados de su casa. Esto no le generara ingresos pero le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida pues podrá darle mayor comodidad y seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Faustino is 31 years old. He is in a relationship and has two minor children. He lives in his own house along with his family. The village has electricity and running water. Faustino is a native of the Chalaco zone, but he has already lived in the Maray zone for 10 years, since his wife is from there. The community is small. The residents work in raising small livestock and in agriculture. His community is located in the district and province of Morropón, in the Piura region on the north coast of Peru.

Faustino's work is raising and selling grains, among which are soybeans and corn, and raising small livestock, in addition to doing agricultural work. The purpose of the loan is for improvements and furnishings for his house. This will not generate income for him, but it will allow him a better quality of life, since he will be able to give better comfort and security to his family.

loans.use: to make improvements and furnish his house.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Juan es un hombre trabajador reside junto a su esposa e hijos en una comunidad al sur del país cuenta con el apoyo de su familia en lo que es el mantenimiento de su negocio. Cada día se traslada a distintos lugares cercanos a su comunidad a lo que es comprar animales para revenderlos y obtener más ganancias.
Don Juan necesita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de reses y cerdos ya que tiene mucha demanda de sus clientes porque estos le prefieren  por sus  buenos precios.
Don Juan espera que con las ganancias obtenidas pueda así comprarse un medio de transporte para poder trasladar sus animales en una forma más segura y accesible y poder darles a sus hijos un mejor futuro y buena calidad de vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre 2014
texts.en:
Juan is a hardworking man. He lives in south Honduras with his wife and children and he has their full support in his business. He travels to different locations every day to buy and sell animals for a profit.
Juan needs this loan to invest in the purchase of cattle and pigs. His products are on high demand because he offers great prices.
Juan hopes to buy a vehicle with his profits so he can move his animals more safely and to make them more accessible to his customers. 
He wants to be able to provide his children with a better future and a good quality of life. 

Choluteca, Honduras - October 2014

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of cattle and pigs.

loans.name: Cecilia Elena

texts.es: Cecilia de 28 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la variedad de productos, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Cecilia, 28, is a single mother. She lives in her own house with her two children. She has a small store located in the place of her home for several years. She's had many customers because of the good prices and the variety of the products. She is applying for a loan to be able to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soda, snacks, sweet breads, etc and therefore have more income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soda, snacks, sweet breads, etc.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio tiene 60 años de edad, es conviviente, vive con su esposa, en casa propia, en una comunidad pequeña en el anexo Culpon del distrito de Nueva Arica, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. y goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos.

Sergio se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales como patos y pavos, desde hace más de 15 años de antiguedad en el negocio, en su propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de alimento de engorde balanceado para sus animales. De esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sergio is 60-years old. He is married and lives with his wife in his own home. They live in a small community that is an anex to Culpon in the Nueva Arica District of Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region on the northern cost of Perú. Sergio enjoys favorable personal and work references from his neighbors.

Sergio has made his living for the last fifteen years raising and selling animals, such as ducks and turkeys, from his home. Sergio is requesting the loan to purchase animal feed to fatten his animals. This way he will be able to grow his business, which will allow him to improve his income in a short period of time, increase his profit and therefore improve his own quality of life and his family's as well.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed to fatten his animals.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros de manera ambulante desde hace 3 años, posee muchos clientes por la calidad de la ropa, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella solicita un crédito a INTEGRAL para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para tener mas variedad y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young woman whose face has been blurred is 22 years old and lives in a high risk area. She has been engaged in selling men’s and women’s clothing on foot for three years.  She has many customers because of the quality of her clothing.  She lives in her own home with her lifetime companion and her son.  She is requesting a loan from Integral to purchase more wholesale clothing to have more variety, and thus, better income.

loans.use: to purchase more wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Hayde Del Carmen

texts.es: Hayde de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, desde hace varios años que ella se dedica a la venta de jugos, gaseosas, refrescos, agua, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes ya establecidos especialmente sus vecinos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos para surtir su negocio y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Hayde, 45, lives in her own home with her four children.  For several years, she has been engaged in selling juices, soda, soft drinks, water, and other beverages.  Her business is located in her home, and she already has many customers, especially her neighbors.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more products to stock her business and thus, be able to have better income.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale juices, soda, soft drinks, water, and other beverages.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia has been helping her husband working on their farm to make a living. She also raises pigs to sell to earn more income for the family. Her previous loan was used for her pigs. She has their banana farm and needs financial assistance to improve it. She took a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy new banana replanting materials and organic fertilizer to improve her farm. She always finds ways to augment their living and is thankful to GDMPC for leading small entrepreneurs toward success. Virginia wants to improve her business as well as their living situation in the near future.

loans.use: to buy new banana replanting materials and organic fertilizer to improve her farm.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina tiene 64 años de edad, es viuda desde hace 10 años, vive en casa propia de material rustico vive con un hijo que la acompaña, el cual la apoya en su bodega no cuenta con ningún hijo bajo su poder. Justina es nacida en este distrito de Pucará. Justina vive en la parte rural de este distrito contando con servicios de agua y luz. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Justina es la venta de artículos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, etc) con una antigüedad del negocio de 6 años, el cual le genera ingresos para su subsistencia. El destino del crédito será para invertir en su negocio surtiendo con nuevos productos como bebidas gaseosas, y otros con ello generar mayores ingresos y así poder captar un número mayor de clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Justina is 64 years old, and she has been a widow for 10 years. She lives in her own home made of rustic material, with a son that accompanies her. He supports her in her store and has no dependent children. Justina was born in the Pucará district. She lives in the rural part of the district, and has running water  and electricity. Her community is basically dedicated to agriculture, cattle raising and trading, and it is located in the Pucará district of the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region in the norther mountain range of Peru.

Justina has a business selling basic staples (rice, sugar, etc.), and she has been in business for 6 years. The business generates an income for her living. The use of the loan will be to invest in her business and supply it with new products such as carbonated beverages and other items. With these, she will generate larger revenues and thus be able to attract a larger number of customers. This will allow her to improve her revenues in the short term, increase her profits, and ultimately improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy new products to supply her store.

loans.name: Vanesa Madelen

texts.es:
Vanesa es una joven de 21 años, soltera y sin hijos .Vive desde muy corta edad en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas ciudad muy comercial de Ecuador, también conocida como la ciudad de puerto de oportunidades ya que es la conexión de la sierra y la costa, la misma es de un clima cálido húmedo. 
Desde muy joven comenzó a trabajar en este negocio, ya que lo aprendió de su madre quien también se dedica a esto. Por las tardes ella acude al camal municipal donde compra las pieles de las reses que faenan, luego de ello, Vanesa les esparce sal y las vende a una clienta de Ambato, con ella elaboran artículos de cuero. A pesar de este sacrificado trabajo Vanesa siempre ha sido muy dedicada a sus estudios, actualmente cursa el quinto semestre en enfermería en una renombrada Universidad de la ciudad, por ser buena alumna siempre le han ayudado con una beca estudiantil, por ello siempre pone empeño a su trabajo y a sus estudios.
Se enteró que en Fundación Alternativa podría plasmar su sueño en realidad gracias al apoyo de Kiva, ya que muchas veces en otras instituciones le cerraron las puertas, es por ello que solicita un crédito para poder capitalizarse e invertir más en las pieles, de esta manera podrán mejorar sus ingresos y así podrá cumplir muy pronto su sueño de graduarse.
texts.en:
Vanesa is a young woman of 21. She is single and without children. She has lived since she was very young in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, a very commercial Ecuadorian city that is also known as a port city of opportunities, since it is the connection between the mountains and the coast. It has a warm, humid climate.

She began to work in this business when she was very young, since she learned it from her mother, who also does this work. In the afternoons she goes to the municipal slaughterhouse, where she buys the skins of the cattle that are slaughtered. After that, Vanesa sprinkles salt on them and sells them to a customer from Ambato. With her, they make articles of leather. In spite of this hard work, Vanesa has always been very dedicated to her studies. She is now in the fifth semester in nursing in a renowned university in the city. Because she is a good student, they have always helped her with a scholarship. Thus she always puts effort into her work and her studies.

She found out that through Fundación Alternativa she would be able to make her dream a reality thanks to the support of Kiva, since many times in other institutions they close the doors to her. It is for this reason that she is applying for a loan to be able to capitalize [their business] and invest more in the skins. In this way they will be able to improve their income and thus she will very soon be able to accomplish her dream of graduating.

loans.use: to buy more skins and capitalize her business, so that in this way they can improve their income and she will accomplish her dream of graduating as a nurse.

loans.name: Cristina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cristina del Carmen tiene 33 años, es soltera, vive en casa familiar con su madre. Ella es una persona con buenas referencias personales y laborales. De familia muy unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia. Ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Cristina del Carmen se dedica a brindar el servicio de copias, tipeos y venta de articulos para computadoras y celulares. Desde hace aproximadamenete más de 5 años. Cristina del Carmen necesita del préstamo para comprar accesorios para computadoras y celulares, para poder darle un valor agregado a su servicio y con esto captar un número mayor de clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Cristina del Carmen, 33, is single and lives in the family home with her mother.  She is a person with good personal and work references and is from a very united family.  She lives in a community engaged in trade, farming, and raising livestock, which is located in Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayequ region, on Peru’s northern coast.  

Cristina del Carmen has been engaged in providing copy and typing services, and selling computer and cell phone accessories for over five years.  Cristina del Carmen needs the loan to purchase computer and cell phone accessories to be able to give added value to her service and, in this way, attract a greater number of customers.  This will allow her to improve her income in a short time, increase profits and, therefore, improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase computer and cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Brenda Patricia

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace 3 años, su negocio está ubicado en una zona muy transitada por eso posee muchos clientes, la joven vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de zapatos por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young woman, whose face has been pixelated because she is 24 years old and lives in a zone of high risk, has been selling shoes for three years. Her business is located in a zone with a lot of traffic, and for this reason she has many customers. The young woman lives with her life companion and their two children. With the sales that she makes, she manages to pay the expenses that arise for her. She is applying for a loan to purchase shoes wholesale in order to be able to have better income.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 69 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge, no tiene hijos bajo responsabilidad, él está dedicado al cultivo de café, vive en una comunidad rural contando con luz y agua en el distrito de Cañarís, provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Francisco se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con terreno agricola, en la cual posee fincas de cafe variedad catimor, las cuales se encuentran en buen estado, cuenta con bastante experiecia en el rubro, Francisco además presenta muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. El destino del crédito es para la compra de abonos y mantenimiento de su finca de cafe, invirtiendo en su negocio y podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptale para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisco is 69 years old. He lives with his wife. He has no children under his responsibility. He raises coffee. He lives in a rural community with electricity and water service in the district of Cañaris, in the province of Ferreñafe, in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. His community basically works in agriculture, livestock raising, and commerce.

Francisco works in agriculture. He has agricultural land, where he has coffee plantings of the Catimor variety, which are in good condition. He has quite a bit of experience in this work. In addition, Francisco presents good personal and work references. The purpose of the loan is to purchase compost and maintain his coffee plantation. By investing in his business, he will be able to acquire acceptable income so that he can improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost and maintain his coffee plantation

loans.name: Samach

texts.en:
Samach, who is 36 years old, resides in Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. She has two children who are enrolled in school. To make a living and support her family she works as a garment factory worker. So far she has been in this career for one year.

Her daily salary is USD 3, on average. Currently, she would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
As the married parent of three children, Maria Fe works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. 

Maria Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF). Maria Fe is borrowing 11,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to  purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Delis

texts.es:
Delis tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene un hijo dependiente, Delis vive con su cónyuge e hijo en el Caserío Yapana. Delis realiza las labores de destilación de aguardiente. Aprovechando las extensiones de caña que posee. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Callacyuc, provincia y región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Delis esta dedicado a la destilación de aguardiente, desde hace más de 5 años, él requiere del presente crédito para realizar los pagos de peones en los deshierbos de caña, cuyo producto lo utiliza para la destilación de aguardiente. Además de realizar implementación de sus equipos de destilación. Delis posee conocimientos en el negocio.
texts.en: Delis, 24, is in a common-law marriage, and has two dependent children.  He lives in Yapana village with his spouse and son.  Delis is engaged in distilling branding, making the most of his sugarcane acreage.  His community, which is engaged mainly in trade, farming, and raising livestock, is located in the Callacyuc district, province and region of Cajamarca, on Peru’s northern coast.  Delishas been engaged in distilling brandy for over five years.  He requires this loan to pay laborers to weed the sugarcane, which he uses for distilling brandy, as well as to implement his distillation equipment.  Delis has knowledge in the business.

loans.use: to pay laborers to weed the sugarcane, which he uses for distilling brandy.

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Otgonjargal, 25 years old, lives with her parents and two siblings in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling clothes since 2010. Her father works as an electrician at a power plant, and her mother has retired from work. Her younger sister is currently unemployed and stays at home. The youngest one studies at university. 

Mrs. Otgonjargal is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 tugriks to buy clothes and rent a counter at the bazaar. She wants to expand her business, which will create a job for her sister, who will sell clothes at the rental counter. The borrower is a very hardworking woman, who strives for a better life.

loans.use: to buy clothes and rent a counter at the bazaar

loans.name: Reggie

texts.en: Reggie works hard to support her family. Reggie is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Reggie has been in this business for 12 years now. She requested a 12,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase additional meat, frozen foods, etc., to sell. In the future, Reggie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat, frozen foods, etc., to sell

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en:
Thavy is a 41-year-old married woman with three teenage daughters, who lives in Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. She is a farmer fattening pigs, and she has been in this work since 2000. All of the children are students. Her husband is 49 years old—also a farmer fattening pigs and crocodiles. Both of them can earn approximately $45 per day. 

Now Thavy would like to request a loan to buy rice and other fodder for her pigs. This loan will help her have enough money to buy fodder for her pigs to earn more income. Her future plans are to expand the pig fattening business and help her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy rice and other fodder for her pigs

loans.name: Chab

texts.en:
Chab, 62 years old, lives in Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. She is a mother of four children; three are single and one is married. She is an active and experienced farmer. By growing rice and selling the crops to local dealers, she can make a decent income to support her family. So far, she has been involved in this career for almost 30 years. 

Chab wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Dilia De Jesús

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio 15 De Abril  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Dilia, tiene 58 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tienen ocho hijos mayores de edad,   una hija estudia en universidad y es quien aun viven en su casa.
Doña Dilia tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa donde vende todo tipo de víveres además de  legumbres, verduras y frutas, ciertas cosas de bazar y papelería, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00. Ella también los fines de semana prepara y vende salchichas, cueritos y carne asada, tiene más de 20 años con sus negocios los cuales les a permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos. 
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que así financia y surte aun más su negocio el cual le permite ganarse la vida. Este crédito lo va a emplear para surtir más su tienda, va a comprar toda clase de víveres. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace  17  años y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día.
texts.en:
The loan group "Jesús de Nazaret" (Jesus of Nazareth) meets every two weeks in the 15th of April neighborhood in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches, which are much visited in every season of the year, and for being a city with an unequaled beauty and many tourist attractions.

Señora Dillia lives in this place. She is 58 years old. She is divorced, and from this relationship she has eight adult children. One daughter studies at the university and is the one who still lives in her house.

Doña Dillia has a grocery store in her house where she sells every type of groceries. In addition to vegetables, greens, and fruits, she sells bazaar items and stationery. She works every day from 6:00h to 20:00h. On weekends, she also prepares and sells sausages, pork skins, and roasted meat. She has had her businesses for more than 20 years, and they have allowed her to raise her children.

She is repeating the loan, since in this way she finances and stocks her business even more, which allows her to earn a living. She is going to use this loan to stock her store more. She is going to buy every type of groceries. She has been in the loan group for 17 years, and she likes it because she has made more friends in the group. Her goals are to continue forward in her business and have her store grow every day.

loans.use: to buy provisions to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a crib for his newborn son.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 34 years old and has two children. Gina is married, and one child is currently in school.

Gina is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Gina requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business.

Gina has been raising livestock for 15 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Gina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 42 years old, married and has three children. Two of her children are in school.

Marites is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Marites requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marites has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she could continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Juanita is 45 years old, and one child is currently in school.

Juanita has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Juanita requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food-production business.

Juanita has been in this business for four years. Juanita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosa de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de billetes de lotería desde hace 16 años, vende de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados y ya tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, Rosa esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas billetes de lotería por mayor para poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Rosa is 62 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. She has worked for 16 years selling lottery tickets. She is a mobile vendor in different markets, and has many customers. With her earnings she has been able to get ahead. Rosa is requesting a loan to buy wholesale lottery tickets so that she can continue with her work, which is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale lottery tickets.

loans.name: Rubie

texts.en:
Rubie is married with three children, and he runs a general store selling goods in the market to make a living. He has been doing this for over six years and earns well for the family. He has successfully repaid his previous loan used to improve his store. 

To increase his sales, Rubie took a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase additional groceries, rice and feed to sell in his store. He still hopes to gain more income to expand his business to ensure better income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries, rice and feed to sell in his store.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jenalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a hollow blocks-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Jenalyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like sand and gravel and cement, etc for her hollow blocks-making business.

Jenalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like sand and gravel and cement, etc

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 52 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, spices and other groceries. 

In the future she would like to save enough money to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en:
Vy, a farmer living in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, is 49 years old and the mother of seven children. She grows rice on two hectares as her main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement this income. She can earn about 36,100 riels per day. 

For Vy, this is her sixth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. She leads a group of four to get a new loan. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay the plowing fees to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get her yield in on time.

loans.use: To pay the plowing fee to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 56 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like snack foods, shampoo, coffee, sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, etc., to sell.

Lucy has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like snack foods, shampoo, coffee, sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.en:
Maria Cecilia is a 39-year-old married woman with three children, who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maria Cecilia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years.

Maria Cecilia requested a 29,500 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, Maria Cecilia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing for the Christmas season to improve his income and be able to improve himself and his family

loans.name: Sophun

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kratie province, Sophun is 32 years old and a mother of five children. To support her family, she grows rice as her main source of income. Moreover, she earns extra income via selling grocery items selling and earns about 30,000 KHR per day. 

This is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She will spend her loan to buy a solar panel. She hopes that she can update her lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Tito

texts.es:
Tito tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a su conviviente, tiene 2 hijos dependientes, vive en casa propia en el caserío de Chaupe, cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. La casa del cliente se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Querocotillo, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza Tito es cultivo de maíz, desde hace 15 años en el caserío de Chaupe, Tito requiere del crédito para invertir en las labores de mantenimiento de su cultivo de maíz, pues desea que invertir en la compra de insumos para suministrar a su cultivo. Con esta inversión logrará incrementar sus rendimientos y con ello lograr mejores ganancias. Tito posee experiencia en el negocio por lo que se espera será una gran cosecha.
texts.en: Tito is 47 years old and lives with his spouse and 2 dependent children. They live in their own home in the hamlet of Chaupe. He has good personal and work references. His house is located in the district of Querocotillo, in the province of Cutervo, in the Cajamarca region of the northern mountains of Peru. His community works mainly in agriculture, livestock and commerce. Tito has worked for 15 years growing corn in Chaupe. He needs a loan to pay for labor to maintain his corn crop, and to buy supplies for his crop. With this investment he will be able to increase his yield, and earn more income. Tito has experience in this business, so he hopes to have a good harvest.

loans.use: to pay for labor to maintain his corn crop.

loans.name: Liengoun

texts.en:
A local resident living in Kampong Thom province, Liengoun is 45 years old. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are in school and one is in university. She struggles for a living via selling vegetables and driving a car to earn more income to improve her family’s living. 

For Liengoun, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan to pay tuition for her son who wants to pursue the bachelor's degree, majoring in accounting. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay tuition for her son who wants to pursue the bachelor's degree, majoring in accounting.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lorena is 42 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lorena requested a PHP 9,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Lorena has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

She requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like spices, noodles, meat, fish, vegetables, etc., for her food production business. Lucita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, noodles, meat, fish, vegetables, etc., for her food production business

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run, a mother of six children, is 52 years old and a villager from Kratie province. Nowadays, she overcomes her family’s hardship via fish-catching. She can earn income about 25,000 KHR per day. 

For Run, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loan completely. She will spend her loan to buy a solar panel. She hopes that she can improve her family's condition, better than before.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda has been growing and harvesting bananas to sell in town and has been farming  for over six years, and with her income, able to put up a retail store to make additional income for the family. She  repaid successfully her previous loan used for her farm. 

She needs additional capital for her grocery store. Because of this, she took a new loan to purchase more varieties of groceries to sell in her store. She is planning to expand her farm and improve her store hoping it will flourish and enable her to improve her children's lives.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Ángela Fabiola

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio 15 De Abril  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 63 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tiene ocho hijos mayores de edad, con ella viven tres de ellos.
Doña Ángela se dedica a la venta de periódicos y revistas en un local en el centro de la ciudad.  En las tardes y noches en su casa vende caldo de salchichas y salchichas con verde asado el cual es la delicia de sus clientes, también prepara meriendas y una de sus hijas le ayuda en su negocio. Tiene más de  10   años sus negocios y siempre le ha ido muy bien.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito porque sus ganancias las utiliza para el sustento diario y cuando recibe los créditos ella los invierte en mejorar su negocio el cual le permite ganarse la vida. Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, salchichas y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva más de 13 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.  Sus metas son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Jesús de Nazaret Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the 15 de Abril neighborhood of the city of Manta.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches that are popular all year long and for being a city of incomparable beauty with a lot of tourist attractions.

Ángela, 63, lives here.  She's separated and has eight children from that relationship; three of the children live with her.

Ángela earns a living selling newspapers and magazines in the center of town.  In the afternoon and at night, she sells sausage soup and sausages with roasted plantain, which her customers love.  She also prepares afternoon snacks, and one of her daughters helps her in the business.  She has more than 10 years of experience in her businesses, and it has always gone very well for her.

She's getting another loan because she uses her profits for daily subsistence, and when she gets a loan she invests it in improving her business that allows her to earn a living.  She's going to use this loan to buy rice, meat, sausages, and other provisions to make her dishes.  She has been with the communal bank for more than 13 years and she likes it because she started her business with one of her loans.

Ángela's goal is to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sausages, and other ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Khristyn

texts.en:
Khristyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending  business in the Philippines. Khristyn has been in this business for 6 years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers. Khristyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Leab's Group

texts.en:
Living a rural area in Kampong Speu province, Leab is 55 years old and a mother of two children. For her family, she grows rice as a single source of income and earns about 35,000 KHR per day. 

This is first time for Leab with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of five members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that her family will have a latrine to use as other families do.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: William Edmundo

texts.es: Edmundo es un joven casado, tiene 23 años de edad y su hija tiene 2 años, el trabaja en una fábrica que elabora quesos, su esposa es quien se dedica a la crianza de animales, Edmundo va  a invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de  chanchos,  la aspiración de Edmundo es ayudarse con este crédito para mejorar su negocio y darle a su hija le necesario en vestido, ropa y alimentación.
texts.en: Edmundo is a married young man; he is 23 years old and his daughter is two years old; he works at a factory that makes cheeses; his wife is the one who raises animals.  Edmundo is going to invest the money from the loan in the purchase of pigs.  Edmundo's hope is to help himself out with this loan to improve his business and to give his daughter what she needs in terms of clothing and food.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Merilona

texts.en:
Merilona works hard to support he family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Merilona has been in this business for 15 years now.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.  In the future, Merilona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Aichurok

texts.ru: Айчурок, 28 лет, замужем, воспитывает сына. В 2009 году, в поисках дохода для своей семьи, она начала заниматься торговлей продуктами питания, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 15,000 сом (KGS). В магазине Айчурок на сегодняшний день есть товар в обороте, на сумму 35,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на закупку товаров для продажи. Расширив ассортимент, Айчурок сможет привлечь новых клиентов и увеличить доходы ее семьи.
texts.en: Aichurok is 28 years old, married, and has a son. In 2009, in order to make additional income for her family, she began to sell food. She started this business with 15,000 KGS. Now, Aichurok's store has inventory worth 35,000 KGS. In order to further develop her business, she turned to the bank Bai -Tushum for a loan of 20,000 KGS to buy goods for sale. By expanding her inventory, Aichurok hopes to attract new customers and increase her family's income.

loans.use: buy products to sell in order to increase her assortment of goods and provide better variety for her clients.

loans.name: Chole

texts.en:
Chole works hard to support her family. She is married and has a baluster and image maker business in the Philippines. Chole has been in this business for 15 years now. 

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like cement, paints, etc . In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like cement, paints, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a perimeter wall to keep moving forward little by little with the improvements to her home, which is a common good for her family.

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio 15 De Abril  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Martha se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y carteras, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, da crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada semana. Los fines de semana prepara y vende deliciosos encebollados en un local que tiene en su casa. Son más de 5  años que se dedica a estos negocios y le va muy bien.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito porque gracias a los créditos ella cada vez aumenta más su negocio y sus ganancias las utiliza para mejorar su hogar. Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, carteras y víveres para preparar los encebollados. Lleva tres ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños mejorar su negocio de comida.
texts.en: The Jesus de Nazaret credit group meets every 15 days in the 15 De Abril neighborhood in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year-round, and for being a city of unequalled beauty with many tourist attractions. Martha lives here. She is 60 years old and married, with four grown children. Her husband is a driver. Martha works selling clothing, shoes and purses door-to-door. She sells to her customers on credit, and collects payment weekly. On weekends she makes and sells delicious onion-seasoned fish from her house. She has done this work for more than 5 years, and enjoys doing it. She is repeating the loan request, because thanks to previous loans she has been able to grow her business each time. She uses her earnings to make improvements to her house. This loan will be used to buy clothing, shoes, purses, and supplies to make the onion-seasoned fish. She has been with the credit group for three loan cycles, and she likes it because the loans allow her to get ahead. Her dream is to improve her food sales business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, handbags and supplies.

loans.name: Norma Mariana

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio 15 De Abril  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Norma, tiene 49 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tuvo tres hijos mayores de edad, uno de sus hijos aun vive con ella.
Doña Norma es una mujer muy luchadora que le ha tocado trabajar muy duro para salir adelante, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo puerta a puerta o en su casa ya que allí tiene un local en el cual vende frutas, embutidos y varios productos más, así ella se gana sus ingresos desde muy joven ya que siempre le ha gustado ganarse la vida por su cuenta y mucho más ahora que está sola.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, embutidos y frutas. Lleva más de 16 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que los créditos le han brindado todo este tiempo. Sus sueños seguir adelante mejorando cada vez más.
texts.en:
Jesús de Nazaret Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the 15 de Abril neighborhood of the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches that are popular all year long and for being a city of incomparable beauty with a lot of tourist attractions.

Norma, 49, lives here.  She's separated and has three adult children from that relationship.  One of her children still lives with her.

Norma's a very determined woman who has worked very hard to get ahead.  She earns a living in commerce, selling all types of clothing door-to-door or in her home.  She has a space there where she sells fruit, cold cuts, and various other products.  She has worked like that from a very young age, because she has always liked to earn a living on her own--and much more so now that she's alone.

This loan is to buy clothing, cold cuts, and fruit.

Norma has been with the communal bank for more than 16 years and she likes it because the loans have helped her all this time.  Her dream is to get ahead, improving more every day.

loans.use: to buy clothing, cold cuts, and fruit

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 51 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Luisa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed.

Luisa has been pig fattening for six years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 50 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Milagros has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, sardines, bread, biscuits and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Isman

texts.ru: Исман, 58 лет, женат, отец 3 детей. У Исмана среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, он занимается животноводством, около 30 лет. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Исмана, на сегодняшний день у него есть 36 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). Исман обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Исман намерен расширить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи.
texts.en: Isman is 58 years old, married, and the father of three children. Isman has a secondary education. The main source of income for the family is his work in animal husbandry, which he has done for about 30 years. Through perseverance, dedication and hard work Ismail's farm now has 36 sheep. His monthly income is about 15,000 KGS. Isman asked the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan of 150,000 KGS to buy sheep for breeding. Isman intends to expand his business, which will inevitably lead to an increase in the net worth of the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep in order to increase his livestock.

loans.name: Risalat

texts.ru: Рисалат, 50 лет, замужем, мать 6 детей, младший- школьного возраста. Образование Рисалат- среднее, уже 14 лет она занимается животноводством, на сегодняшний день в своем хозяйстве Рисалат имеет 5 коров и 10 овец. Рисалат знает технологию ведения сельскохозяйственной деятельности и умеет вкладывать средства по назначению. Ее ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Рисалат намерена увеличить поголовье скота, а доходы от кредита позволят ей накопить средства на обучение детей.
texts.en: Risalat is 50 years old, married, and the mother of six children.  Her youngest child is still in elementary school.  Risalat has the equivalent of a high school education, and she has been involved in animal husbandry for 14 years already.  She currently owns five cows and 10 sheep.  She knows how to use technology to run her farming business and also how to properly invest her money.  She makes a total monthly income of about 25,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy livestock.  She intends to increase her livestock headcount and will use the earnings from her loan to save some money towards her children's education.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her profits.

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en: Vanny, 53, is a farmer who is living in Kampong  Speu Province and is a mother of three children. For her living, she grows rice and sells grocery items to improve her family's condition. She can earn an income of about 20,800 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of ten members, she is a group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family has clean water to use and her family can live in health.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Linat

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Thom province, Linat is 44 years old and a mother of two children, who study in university. She earns an income to support her family by teaching in school and selling grocery items to earn extra income. This is her first time with VisionFund (a Kiva partner). 

Linat will spend her loan to pay tuition fees for her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree in Marketing. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduating.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her daughter.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Asila

texts.ru: Асила, 53 года, вдова, мать 4 детей. У Асилы среднее образование, 10 лет она занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы и 18 овец, также земельный надел мерою 1,02 ГА, где Асила выращивает кукурузу, подсолнечник и картофель. Дети с радостью помогают Асиле в ведении ее бизнеса. Есть все условия для содержания скота. Дополнительно она предоставляет швейные услуги. Ежемесячный доход Асилы от ведения бизнеса около 10,000 сом (KGS). Однако этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, тем более, что Асиле хочется помогать своим детям и внукам, она полна энергии и решила развивать свой бизнес. Поэтому и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Асила планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, что позволит ей улучшить материальное положение ее семьи.
texts.en: Asila is 53 years old, a widow, and the mother of four children. Asila has a secondary education. She has worked in agriculture for ten years. Her farm has two cows and eighteen sheep, and a plot of land measuring 1.02 hectares where Asila grows corn, sunflowers and potatoes. Her children happily assist Asila with her business. She has everything necessary for livestock. Additionally, she works sewing. Asila's monthly income is about 10,000 KGS. However, this income is not enough for a decent life, especially because Asila wants to help her children and grandchildren. She is full of energy and decided to develop their business. Therefore, she appealed to the bank Bai -Tushum for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy cows. Asila plans to invest profits from the loan into further expanding her livestock, enabling her to improve the financial situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional cows in order to increase her livestock and to bolster her income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to reinforce the walls of his home and to change the security system.

loans.name: Jesus Antonio

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa familiar, en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Jesús se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte urbano en su mototaxi, desde hace 03 años, su servicio lo presta en el distrito de Oyotún y alrededores; él solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo; pues desea realizar el mantenimiento de su mototaxi y cambio de carpa para poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes además de captar nuevos cliente. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Jesus is 19 years old and is single, with no children. He lives with his family in a rural area in the district of Oyotun, in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. His community works mainly in agriculture, livestock and commerce. Jesus has worked for 3 years providing urban transportation with his motorcycle taxi, in Oyotun and in surrounding districts. He is requesting a loan to invest in fixed assets, in order to be able to maintain his motorcycle taxi and change the awning. In this way he can provide better service for his customers and attract new customers. In the short term, this will enable him to increase his income and thereby improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to invest in fixed assets, in order to be able to maintain his motorcycle taxi and change the awning.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 39 years old and married.

Flora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Flora has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from running a tricycle transport business. 

Flora aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза, 26 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей. Образование у Наргизы- среднее, она занимается торговлей в собственном магазине, продает продукты питания и товары первой необходимости. Магазин расположен в хорошем, проходимом месте. На сегодняшний день у Наргизы есть товар в обороте на сумму 500,000 сом (KGS). Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). Наргиза обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товаров и расширение ассортимента, что позволит ей привлечь новых покупателей и построить дом для ее семьи.
texts.en: Nargiza is 26 years old, married, and has three children. Nargiza has a middle school education. She sells food and essential commodities in her own shop. The shop is located in a good, place with foot traffic. Currently, Nargiza has 500,000 KGS worth of inventory. Her monthly income is about 20,000 KGS. Nargiza approached the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan of 50,000 KGS to increase and expand her variety of goods to allow her to attract new customers and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to increase the goods in her shop in order to attract new customers.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмира, 50 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей дошкольного и школьного возраста. У Гульмиры среднее образование, с 1994 года в качестве основного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть корова, 10 овец, а также1,23 ГА поливной земли, где она выращивает картофель. Гульмира на ежедневной основе продает молоко, также занимается торговлей в арендованном магазине. Она известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день деятельность Гульмиры приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульмира обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS), который направит на покупку одной дойной коровы. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и намерена дать своим детям хорошее образование.
texts.en: Gulmira is 50 years old, married, and the mother of two children of preschool and school age. Gulmira has a secondary education. Her primary source of income since 1994 has been agriculture. On her farm, she has a cow, ten sheep, and also 1.23 hectares of irrigated land where she grows potatoes. Every day Gulmira sells milk and works in sales in a store she rents. She is known as a principled, honest, decent, and reliable person. Currently, Gulmira's work brings in a monthly income of 25,000 KGS. To further develop her farm, Gulmira approached the bank Bai - Tushum for a loan of 60,000 KGS, with which she will buy a dairy cow. She plans to use profits from the loan to develop her farm, and she intends to give their children a good education.

loans.use: purchase one dairy cow.

loans.name: Clara Cecilia

texts.es: Clara es una señora de 44 años de edad, ella tiene 5 hijos de los mismos que 4 aun viven con ella y también viven 3 nietos, Clara  se dedica a la crianza de animales desde que era una niña ya que sus padres le enseñaban a esta actividad, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para mejorar su negocio, su esposo se dedica al jornal de trabajo en el campo, la aspiración de Clara es seguir trabajando y a futuro comprar un lote de terreno para tener sus chanchitos.
texts.en:
Clara, 44, has five children.  Four of them live with her, as do three grandchildren.

Clara has earned a living raising animals since she was a little girl, because her parents taught her the work.  Her husband works as a day laborer in the fields.

She's going to invest the loan in buying pigs to improve her business.

Clara's goal is to keep on working and in the future buy a plot of land for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Maria Fabiola

texts.es: Desde muy niña Maria Fabiola observaba a su mama en el taller de costura donde ella trabajaba y poco a poco fue creciendo hasta lograr trabajar con su mama en el oficio de modista. Está casada y tiene 33 años de edad. Tiene un pequeño bebe de 9 meses. Hace nueve años que trabaja en la costura de ropa para bebe junto a su mama las dos han trabajado fuerte para sacar el negocio adelante. Aparte de los ingresos que recibe en el oficio de la costura recibe los ingresos de las remesas que le envía su esposo del exterior. Solicita el crédito para comprar telas, cedinas, hilos entre otros. Este crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que anteriormente trabajaba de manera grupal y ahora lo hará de manera individual, otro beneficio que le traerá es que podrá entregar los pedidos de los clientes de manera rápida y sin quedarles mal. Dentro de sus proyectos futuros esta comprar un terreno para construir su propia casa y así dejar de alquilar. Su meta es aprovechar la temporada navideña que se aproxima.
texts.en:
Since she was a little girl, Maria Fabiola watched her mom in the sewing workshop where she worked and little by little she grew until she could work with her mom as a dressmaker. 

She is 33 years old and married. She has a 9 month old baby. She began her work sewing baby clothes together with her mom 9 years ago and the two have worked hard to make their business thrive. 

Apart from the income she gets from sewing, she also receives remittances from her husband who lives abroad.  

She asks for a loan to buy fabric, needles and thread, among other things. This loan will provide great assistance, as she previously worked as part of a group and now does so alone. Another benefit is that the loan will allow her to finish customers’ orders quickly and without doing a poor job. 

Part of her future projects is to buy land to build her own home and thereby stop renting. Her goal is to enjoy the upcoming holiday season.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, thread among other things.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SABOUGNOUMA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Fiyele, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de gâteau et de la galette. Les femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente HAWA, première personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de gâteau. Elle compte acheter du sachet plastique, de l’huile, du sucre et de la farine boulangère sur place puis le transforme en gâteau de qualité. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 11 000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour couvrir les dépenses familiales.
texts.en: The SABOUGNOUMA group is made up of married women, who are on average 41 years old and have on average four children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Fiyele, in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of Mali). They know each other through family, neighbor, and friend connections. They sell grains, cakes, and cookies. The women of the SABOUGNOUMA group are on their second group loan. With the goal of satisfying the enormous demand of their clienteles, they are turning to Soro Yiriwaso. The client, HAWA, sitting to the far right, is illiterate, and she currently sells cakes. She plans to buy plastic bags, oil, sugar, and baking flour on the spot and transform them into quality cakes. The sales are made at retail and for cash from home and at the market to a mixed clientele. She foresees making a monthly profit of 11,000 FCFA, which will be used to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to buy baking flour to make cakes.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda; la socia continua  con el negocio de venta de comida, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua preparando  platos como estofado de pollo, lomo saltado y sopas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, aceite entre otros. 
 La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member belongs to the "SENOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY" communal bank. This bank is located in the Cusco district, in the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Hilda, and she continues to work selling food. She has been doing this for a long time, and it is going well due to the effort that she puts into her business every day. She prepares dishes such as stewed chicken, Peruvian stir fry, and soups. She would like to continue working so that she can support her family. She is requesting a loan to buy rice and oil, among other things. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice and oil, among other things.

loans.name: Doris Beneranda

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Familia Con Suerte se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Miraflores  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Doris, tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 17, 12  y 10 años de edad, los mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Doris realiza el crédito para el negocio de su marido, el en el mercado se dedica a la venta  de pescado, todos los días en la madrugada compra el pescado a los mayoristas para tener su producto fresco para sus clientes que a diario lo visitan. son más de 20 años que él se dedica a esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a su familia de una forma honrada.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito pues de esta forma ellos se ayudan para salir adelante, sus ganancias son para las necesidades del hogar y estudios de sus hijos. Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ella  le ayuda a su marido con los créditos. Sus sueños es tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The Familia Con Suerte Credit Group meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of Miraflores in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited heavily year round, and for being a city whose beauty is unparalleled with many tourist attractions.  

This is where Doris lives; she is 35 years old and is in a relationship that has produced three children who are 17, 12, and 10 years old; the older ones are in high school and the young one is in elementary school.  Her husband is a businessman.  

Doris is requesting this loan for her husband's business; he sells fish at the market.  Every day in the morning he buys fish from the wholesalers to have fresh product for his customers who visit him daily.  He has had this business for over 20 years and it gets his family ahead in an honest way.  

She is getting another loan as this will help them get ahead; their earnings are for the household necessities and for her children's education.  This loan is to buy fish.  She has been with her credit group from the start and she likes it because she is able to help her husband with these loans.  Her dream is to have her own storefront.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гулнара, 43 года, замужем, мать 4 сыновей. Образование- среднее, с 1994 года занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Гулнары, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее развитое хозяйство. В аренде есть 0,20 ГА поливной земли, где Гулнара выращивает чеснок и картофель под реализацию. Также в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы и 2 бычка. Ежедневно она продает экологически чистое, домашнее и очень вкусное молоко. Среднемесячный доход Гульмиры около 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулнара обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной дойной коровы. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса, что позволит улучшить благосостояние семьи и накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Gulnara is 43 years old, married, and the mother of four sons. She has a high school education. Since 1994 she has farmed and raised livestock. Through Gulnara's hard work she now has a well-developed farm. She rents 0.20 hectares of irrigated land where Gulnara grows garlic and potatoes. Her farm also has two cows and two bulls. Every day she sells environmentally friendly, homemade, very tasty milk. Her average monthly income is about 8,000 som KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Gulnara turned to the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase a dairy cow. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further expanding her business, which will then improve her family's living conditions and then she can save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig raising business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feeds, and vitamins for her pigs. Nida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feeds, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 23 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell recycled materials in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of recycled materials to sell.

Ruth has been in this business for five years.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 39 years old and has four children who are in school.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Nilda requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients and additional materials for her business.

She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Nilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and additional materials for her business

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma is 60 years old and married with two children.  She is in agriculture, raising pigs in the Philippines. Thelma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Thelma has been raising pigs for twelve years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nob's Group

texts.en:
A villager living in Kampong Speu province, Nob is 30 years old and a mother of two schoolchildren. To earn a living, she grows rice on a half hectare area and works for others for a fee to support her family. She can earn income about 30,000 KHR per day. 

This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan wisely to improve her living condition in a gradually pace. In a group of three members, she is group leader. She will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family living in good health.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Pao's Group

texts.en:
Pao is 45 years old and a mother of two children living in Kampong Speu province. Nowadays, she grows rice as her main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She earns about 35,000 KHR per day. 

For Pao, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of seven to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can update her family's living in health.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom is a 21-year-old credit officer at a microfinance institution and a second-year university student majoring in management. He is from the Seam Reap province in Cambodia. Being a credit officer, he can earn approximately $5 per day. Because of a shortage of finances, he has decided to apply for a loan to pay his second-year tuition fee. This loan will help Mom to successfully finish the second year. After graduation, he wants to have a better job in a bank so he will be able to help his parents.

loans.use: to pay his second-year tuition fee.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Alicia; la socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the SENOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY Communal Bank; the bank is located in the district of Cusco in Cusco Province, Cusco Department.  

This is Alicia; she still has her grocery store business; she has had her business for a good amount of time and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day.  She is still selling rice, sugar, and milk, among other things.  She wants to be able to keep working to keep supporting her family.  

She is requesting a loan to buy rice and sugar, among other things.  

She is thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar, among other things.
