loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Vilma; la socia continua con su negocio de venta de frutas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo plátanos, naranjas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar naranjas, manzanas, papayas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the SENOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY Communal Bank; the bank is located in the district of Cusco in Cusco Province, Cusco Department.  

This is Vilma; she still has her business selling fruits; she has had her business for a good amount of time and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day.  She is still selling bananas and oranges, among other fruits.  She wants to be able to keep working so she can keep supporting her family.  

She is requesting this loan to buy oranges, apples, and papayas, among other fruits. 

She is thankful for her loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy oranges, apples, and papayas, among other fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to keep her food good

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  Pacita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.  Pacita has been in this business for 48 years.  In the future, Pacita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla is 63 years old and married with three children. Perla works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.  Perla has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items, such as shampoo, detergent soap, hair conditioner, coffee, and sugar.  In the future, Perla would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: AWA  est une femme qui évolue dans la commercialisation des fruits et légumes. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui n’a pas de parent bénéficiaire dans l’institution. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les charges scolaires de ses enfants. Elle a une expérience de plus de 20ans et demande ce crédit de ce montant pour acheter des fruits et légumes qu’elle revend à ses clients. Elle commence sa journée à 10h pour la finir à 18h. Avec le crédit elle pourrait augmenter ses revenus et épargner ses économies. Elle souhaite avoir une étale dans le marché centrale de la commune et acheter une maison.
texts.en: Awa is a woman who sells fruits and vegetables. She is a married mother who does not have a beneficiary in the institution. She helps her husband with the family’s daily expenses and the children’s school tuition. She has more than 20 years of experience and is asking for this loan in the sum to buy fruits and vegetables that she sells to her customers. She works from 10am until 6pm. With this loan, she will be able to increase her revenues and save money. She wishes to have a spread at the commune’s central market and to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Yeni

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Yeni; la socia se dedica actualmente al negocio de venta de rocoto relleno, la socia vende de manera ambulatoria a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, pero ahora se dedica a su nuevo negocio  de venta de rocotos rellenos, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar zanahorias, rocotos, aceite entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member belongs to the "SENOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY" communal bank. This bank is located in the Cusco district, in the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Yeni, and she works selling stuffed peppers on a mobile basis to all customers who request them. Her previous business was a grocery store, but she now works at her new business selling stuffed peppers. She would like to continue doing this work, so that she can continue supporting her family. She is requesting the loan to buy carrots, peppers, and oil, among other things. She is grateful for the loan, and commits to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy carrots, peppers, and oil, among other things.

loans.name: Yohanna Yalile

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Familia Con Suerte se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Miraflores  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Yohanna, tiene 31años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijas de 10 y 1 año, la mayor estudia en escuela. El marido es taxista.
Doña Yohanna realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en su negocio, el tiene un taxi en el cual presta este servicio, como su taxi está un poco deteriorado él con los créditos poco a poco le va realizando ciertos arreglos que necesita. Esta es la fuente de ingresos que él tiene para sacar adelante a su familia y ya son más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito porque con las ganancias que le deja el taxi a su marido pueden solventar los gastos del hogar. Este crédito es para comprar cuatro llantas para el taxi. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ella ayuda a su marido a salir adelante en su hogar. Sus sueños es comprar un taxi nuevo.
texts.en:
The Familia Con Suerte Credit Group meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of Miraflores in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches, which are heavily visited year round, and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions.  

This is where Yohanna lives; she is 31 years old and she is in a relationship that has produced two daughters who are ten and one year old; the eldest is in school.  Her husband is a taxi driver. 

Yohanna is requesting this loan to use for her husband's business; he has a taxi he uses for work, but as his taxi is a little run down he is using loans to fix things it needs little by little.  This is the source of income that he has to get his family ahead and he has been doing this work for over 10 years. 

She is requesting another loan because with the money her husband makes from the taxi they can cover their household expenses.  This loan is to buy four tires for the taxi.  She has been with her credit group from the beginning and she likes it because it allows her to help her husband support their household.  Her dream is to buy a new taxi.

loans.use: to buy four tires.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 46 years old and married with eight children. Six of her children are in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mercy is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mercy has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 56 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her family. She owns a farm and is doing well which makes her earn a good income for the family. She also has a grocery store in their village. 

She took a new loan recently to buy more seedlings to expand the area of her garden to improve her rice farm. She wants to improve her farm and her future plan is to renovate their home to provide safe living for the family.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings to expand the area of her garden.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SABOUGNOUMA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Beleniko, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, du charbon  de bois et d’article divers.
Les femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente AWA, personne au milieu dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de charbon. Elle compte acheter des sacs de charbon sur place.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à Fana à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 18 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The SABOUGNOUMA group is made up of married women, who are on average 41 years old and have on average three children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Beleniko, in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of Mali). They know each other through family, neighbor, and friend connections. They sell seasonings, charcoal, and miscellaneous items.
The women of the SABOUGNOUMA group are on their eighth group loan. With the goal of satisfying the enormous demand of their clienteles, they are turning to Soro Yiriwaso. The client, AWA, seated in the middle, is illiterate, and she currently sells charcoal. She plans to buy sacks of charcoal on the spot. The sales are made at retail and for cash at Fana to a mixed clientele. She foresees making a monthly profit of 18,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Siguitemason Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SIGUITEMASON est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Bababougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales, de tubercules, de poisson fumé, de l’habillement, de savon et d’articles divers. Les femmes du groupe SIGUITEMASON sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente SIRANTOU, première personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’articles divers. Elle compte acheter du sucre, 1 carton de thé, du Lipton et du sachet plastique chez les grossistes à Dioïla. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle dans son étale à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour couvrir les dépenses familiales.
texts.en: The SIGUITEMASON group is made up of married women, who are on average 42 years old and have on average five children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Bababougou, in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of Mali). They know each other through family, neighbor, and friend connections. They sell food, grains, tubers, smoked fish, clothing, soap, and miscellaneous items. The women of the SABOUGNOUMA group are on their second group loan. With the goal of satisfying the enormous demand of their clienteles, they are turning to Soro Yiriwaso. The client, SIRANTOU, seated on the left, is illiterate, and she currently sells miscellaneous items. She plans to buy sugar, a box of Lipton tea, and plastic bags wholesale in Dioïla. The sales are made at retail and for cash at her home from her spread to a mixed clientele. She foresees making a monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, which will be used to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous items

loans.name: Noel

texts.es:
Noel vive en casa propia de material rustico, es soltero, no cuenta con ningún hijo en su poder, Noel tiene 30 años radicando en la zona, tiene muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales en su comunidad, la misma que está ubicada en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad a la que se dedica Noel es a brindar servicios como maestro de obra, de construcción civil a la construcción de casas tanto de adobe como de ladrillo, sus servicios los ofrece en el distrito de Pucará y alrededores, con una experiencia en el rubro de 15 años, el préstamo que se le otorgará es para comprar herramientas y madera los cuales le permitirá mejorar y añadir un valor agregado a su servicio, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Noel lives in his own home made of basic materials. He is single and has no children under his responsibility. Noel has resided in this area for 30 years. He has very good references, both personal and work-related, that come from his community. The area where he lives is in the District of Pucará in Jaén Province, which is part of the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. His community is essentially known for engaging in agriculture, livestock breeding, and trade.

Noel’s business involves offering his services as a master builder. He builds houses out of adobe, as well as bricks. Noel offers his services within the District of Pucará and the surrounding areas. He has 15 years of experience in this trade. The loan that was granted to him will be used to buy tools. This will allow him to improve and add more value to his services. In the short-term, Noel will be able to increase his earnings, improve his income, and eventually improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy tools and wood so that he can improve and add value to his services.

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es:
Juana Rosa tiene 67 años de edad, es conviviente, vive con su esposo e hijos, en casa propia, en una comunidad pequeña en el sector la campiña y goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Juana Rosa se dedica a la actividad de ganado vacuno, los cuales producen leche, cuenta con más de 5 años de antiguedad en el negocio, en su propio domicilio. Ella solicita préstamo para la compra de alimento para su ganado. De esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana Rosa is 67 years old. She is in a relationship and lives with her husband and children in their own home. They live in a small community in the countryside in the district of Cayaltí in the Chiclayo province in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru. The people in her community work in farming, ranching and business.

Juana Rosa boasts good personal and professional references from her neighbors. She raises herds of milk cows. She has been in this business for more than 5 years, which she runs out of her home. 

She requests this loan to purchase food for her cows. By doing this she will grow her business, which will enable her to increase her income and her earnings in the short-term, and in the end to improve her quality of life and the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her cattle.

loans.name: On's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Kampong Speu province, On is 43 years old and a father of four dependent children. To support his family's living conditions, he grows rice on a 1-hectare area and works for others for a fee. He can earn income about 30,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

For On, this is his first loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three, he is a group leader. He will spend his loan portion to build a decent latrine. He hopes that he can improve his family's lives with good health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 42-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her two children. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Kaneez is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.
 
She needs a new sewing machine for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase a new sewing machine. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase a new sewing machine and also be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Kaneez is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new a sewing machine for her stitching business.

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Kampong Speu province, Phalla is 41 years old and a mother of five children. Nowadays, she needs to support three schoolchildren. She struggles for a living via rice cropping. Moreover, her husband works for others for a fee to earn more income to support the family’s needs. She has been involved in this business for ages and it earns her about 20,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

For Phalla, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of four to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that her family has a decent latrine to use as other families do.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Komeza Group

texts.fr:
Félix fait partie du groupe  Komeza  et  habite à Bujumbura. Il  a 44 ans et est marié à Renathe, une  cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 9 à 15 ans, tous étudient.

Il  est photographe depuis 4 ans. 

Il est à son quinzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et payer les photos imprimées des clients,  pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années prochaines, il voudrait acheter des appareils modernes de photographie : Camera, appareils numériques et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Félix is part of the Komeza group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 44 and married to Renathe, a farmer. Together, they have three children, aged 9 to 15, all of whom attend school. 

He has been a photographer for 4 years. 

He is on his fifteenth loan at Turame. With the Kiva loan that he gets, he is going to augment his capital and pay for customer photo prints in order to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to buy modern photography equipment (video cameras, digital cameras) and to see his children attend school.

loans.use: to augment his capital and pay for customer photo prints in order to earn more

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en: Shiela has been engaged in the transportation business for over six years to make a living. It is doing well and she has repaid successfully her previous loan used for this. To make it safe and comfortable for her customers, she took a new loan to buy new spare parts and accessories to repair her tricycle which is used for the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand it in order to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy new spare parts and accessories to repair her tricycle used for the business, to ensure safe services.

loans.name: Suon's Group

texts.en:
An old man living in Kampong Speu province, Suon is 65 years old and a father of nine children. For his living, he grows rice as a single source of his income to improve his family's conditions. He has been involved in his business for ages and it earns him about 20,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

This is his first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of four members, he is a group leader. He will spend his loan portion to buy a water filter. He hopes that his family has enough clean water to drink.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Soknim's Group

texts.en:
Soknim, 24, lives in Kampong Speu province and is a mother of one kid. To tackle her family’s hardships, she grows rice as a single source of income. She has been occupied in this business for ages and it earns her about 25,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

This is her first loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of eight members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family has enough clean water to drink.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Teriya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TERIYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Beleniko, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments, du charbon de bois, de pain et d’articles divers. Les femmes du groupe TERIYA sont à leur onzième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente FANTA NANA, première personne de la droite vers la gauche  le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de pain. Elle compte acheter des sacs de pain chez les grossistes à Tingole.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group TERIYA is composed of married women, who average 38 years of age and three children each. All the women live in traditional families in the village of Beleniko, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in grains, condiments, charcoal, bread, and general merchandise. The women of the group TERIYA are on their 11th solidarity loan.

To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, FANTA NANA, the person sitting first from the right in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of bread. She intends to purchase sacks of bread from wholesalers in Tingole. Her sales are made retail to a mixed customer base paying with cash at her home. She plans on making a monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase bread

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 47 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Beleniko, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, du bois de chauffe, de soumbala et d’articles divers.
Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente NAGNA, deuxième personne de la droite vers la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de soumbala. Elle compte acheter du sachet plastique et 5 sacs de grain de néré sur place puis le transforme en soumbala. Après 3 jours de traitement le produit final est ensaché.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à Tingole à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35.000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group TIESSIRI is composed of married women, who average 47 years of age and four children each. All the women live in traditional families in the village of Beleniko, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, firewood, soumbala, and general merchandise. The women of the group TIESSIRI are on their 8th solidarity loan.

To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, NAGNA, the person second from the right in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of soumbala [a condiment made from pounded and fermented seeds or nuts]. She intends to purchase plastic bags and 5 sacks of néré seeds locally and then process them into soumbala. After three days of treatment, the final product is packaged. Her sales are made retail to a mixed customer base paying with cash in Tingole. She plans on making a monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase néré seeds for making soumbala

loans.name: Efraim

texts.en:
Efraim is a father of four who operates a piggery, growing and selling pigs to earn a living. He has been in this business for over 12 years, and he earns well for his family. By selling pork meat in their villages, he was able to earn more profit than by selling it whole. 

He had repaid successfully his previous loan used for buying feeds. He took a new loan recently from GDMPC microcredit to purchase feeds and piglets to raise. He plans to build another cage for his pigs as an expansion for his piggery in the future

loans.use: to purchase feed and piglets to raise

loans.name: Rosa Virginia

texts.es: Rosa de 53 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa y perfumes, desde hace 5 años ejerce este oficio y cuenta con muchos clientes fijos con lo que puede mantener su negocio a flote, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, ella vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos y esta solicita un crédito para comprar mas mercadería por mayor  y de esta forma contar con más clientes y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 53, sells clothing and perfumes.  She has been in this trade for five years and has many established customers, which has allowed her to keep her business afloat.  With the income she earns from her sales, Rosa is able to cover some of her household expenses.  She lives with her life companion and their two children.  

Rosa is requesting a loan in order to buy more merchandise in bulk.  This will help her gain more customers and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing and perfumes in bulk.

loans.name: Marecil

texts.en:
Marecil is 28 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marecil is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marecil has been farming rice for two years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sarun's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Speu province, Sarun is 47 years old. She is a mother of four children, two of whom are in school, and the other two are too young. For her living, she earns income to support her family via rice cropping, and it earns her about 20,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

For Sarun, this is her first loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of five members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family has clean water to use, and she can improve her family's lives and health.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Parvina

texts.en:
This is Parvina. She is an energetic, hardworking woman at the age of 26 years. Parvina is a seamstress and is engaged in sewing at home. She has sewn national woman's dresses for five years. At the same time, she works as a teacher at a school. 

Parvina is married and has two little children. Her husband is a repairman of houses. They live modestly, but happily. Now Parvina wants to improve conditions at home and buy new furniture. However, for this purchase, she lacks some money. Therefore, Parvina asks for a loan. She will repay the loan at the expense of her sewing activity. Parvina awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for her home

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne 32 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SANTORO I l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de la patte d’arachide.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur 4ème prêt solidaire. DODO, 2ème femme de la droite vers la gauche,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 8 seaux de pâte d’arachide. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group BENKADI average 32 years of age and two children each, all living in traditional extended families in SANTORO I, a district of SAN/SEGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship, and they have businesses buying and selling peanut butter.

After having correctly paid back their previous loans, the women of the group BENKADI are now on their 4th solidarity loan. 

DODO, the woman second from the right in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase 8 pails of peanut butter. She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers. Her sales are made to men and women customers paying with cash and often credit. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and schooling costs. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase peanut butter

loans.name: Yune Mariuxi

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Alfa Y Omega. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Yune, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro  hijos de 21, 19, 17 y 2  años  de edad, dos de  ellos estudian en universidad y uno en colegio. Su esposo trabaja en un almacén  de venta de motos.
Doña Yune  en su casa tiene una pequeña tienda la cual no esta tan surtida pero le da buenos beneficios, allí también vende productos de Avon y Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas) trabaja todos los días y  lleva 7 años dedicada al comercio. 
Ella está repitiendo el crédito, con sus ganancias compro más productos y con esto está logrando tener más clientela. Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería y víveres para surtir más su tienda. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 2 años  y le gusta porque así cada día mejora su negocio. Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank named “Alfa Y Omega” meet every 15 days in the neighborhood known as “Estancia Vieja” in the parish of Colon, which is part of the city of Portoviejo.  The humble people who live in this area engage in agriculture and general trade.  

Sra. Yune lives in this place.  She is 39 years old, married, and has four children (ages 21, 19, 17, and 2).  Two of her children are studying at a university and one child is in high school.  Her husband works at a warehouse where motorcycles are sold.  

Doña Yune has a small store in her home.  It is not overflowing with inventory, but it generates a good profit.  She also sells products made by Avon and Belcorp (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories).  Yune works every day and has been in business for seven years.  

She is requesting another loan.  With her earnings, she will buy more products and this will allow her to attract more customers.  This loan will be used to buy perfumes, trinkets, and provisions so that she can restock her store.  Yune has been with the Communal Bank for two years and enjoys being a member because she can improve her business each day.  Her dreams include seeing her children become successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, trinkets, and provisions for her store.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne 41 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SANTORO II l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des chaussures, des habits, des céréales, d’huile et du savon.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur 4ème prêt solidaire. DJENEBA, 1ère femme assise de la droite vers la gauche ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 pièces de Wax et 5 pièces d’unit Wax. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 12 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group BENKADI average 41 years of age and five children each, all living in traditional extended families in SANTORO II, a district of SAN/SEGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship, and they have businesses buying and selling shoes, clothing, grains, oil, and soap.

After having correctly paid back their previous loans, the women of the group BENKADI are now on their 4th solidarity loan. 

DJENEBA, the woman sitting first from the right in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase 5 pieces of Wax 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa). She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers. Her sales are made to men and women customers paying with cash and often credit. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 12,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and schooling costs. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Justa; la socia tiene 55 años de edad tiene 06 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de  venta de frutas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende plátanos, naranjas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar naranjas, manzanas, papayas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the “Señor de los Temblores-Poroy” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco. 

The borrower’s name is Justa. She is 55 years old. She has six children and she is single. She alternates between doing her daily chores and running her fruit-selling business. She has had the business for a while and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. She sells bananas, oranges, and other things. She wants to be able to continue working so she can continue supporting her family.

Justa is requesting the loan in order to buy oranges, apples, papayas, and other fruit.

She feels grateful for the loan and is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy oranges, apples, papayas, and other fruit.

loans.name: Alliance Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe ALLIANCE ont en moyenne 41 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à BLA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, des céréales et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe ALLIANCE sont à leur 2ème prêt solidaire. KESSA, 1ère femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  10Litres d’huile, 1 panier de tomate, 10Kgs d’oignon, 5Kgs de beurre de karité, 20Kgs de Sel, 5Kgs de piment et 1 demi paquet de Cube Maggi. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 24 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group ALLIANCE average 41 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional extended families in BLA/SEGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship, and they have businesses buying and selling general merchandise, grains, and condiments.

After having correctly paid back their previous loans, the women of the group ALLIANCE are now on their 2nd solidarity loan. 

KESSA, the woman standing first from the left in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase 10 liters of oil, a basket of tomatoes, 10 kg of onions, 5 kg of shea butter, 20 kg of salt, 5 kg of chili peppers, and a half packet of Cube Maggi. She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers. Her sales are made to men and women customers paying with cash and often credit. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 24,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and schooling costs. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as oil, shea butter, salt, and onions.

loans.name: Lelis

texts.es:
Lelis tiene 50 años de edad, es soltero, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa familiar, en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Lelis se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral(patos, cuyes, entre otros), desde hace 08 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, él solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo; compra de cerdos, cuyes, patos, gallinas; el préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor inversión, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes; lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lelis is 50 years old, single, and has no children under his responsibility.  He lives in his family’s home, which is located in a rural area in the District of Oyotún in Chiclayo Province.  This place is within the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.  His community is basically known for agriculture, livestock breeding, and trade.  

Lelis has been raising and selling domesticated animals (ducks, guinea pigs, and other livestock) for eight years.  His business is located in his home.  The loan he is requesting will be used as operating capital for purchasing pigs, guinea pigs, ducks, and hens.  As a result, he will have a greater investment by which he will able to increase his business and satisfy the needs of his customers.  In the short-term, this will increase his earnings, improve his income, and eventually improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs, guinea pigs, ducks, and hens so that he can increase his business.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: Marcos de 44 años de edad se dedica desde hace 15 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en casa propia, Marcos está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Marcos is 44 years old and has been farming for 15 years.  He grows corn and beans.  His products are sold at different markets that are located near his house.  Marcos lives in his own home along with his wife and their two children.  

He is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and other supplies so that he can improve the land that is shown in the photograph.  As a result, he can continue his work and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and other supplies so that he can improve his land.

loans.name: Cusco Sur Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CUSCO SUR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia María Elena tiene 37 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna su actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de flores, la socia vende diferentes tipos de flores a todos sus clientes que le solictan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende de manera ambulatoria, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
  La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de margaritas, rosas entre otros.                                      
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los otros socios  se dedican al  negocio de transporte, artesanía, venta de cosméticos, confección.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
Los socios que salen adjuntos en la foto pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Cusco Sur”, which is located in the District of Cusco in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.  

María Elena is 37 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling flowers.  María Elena sells different types of flowers to all of her customers who request them.  She has been in this business for quite some time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her business.  María Elena sells as a street vendor.  She wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.  

She is requesting a loan in order to buy daisies, roses, and other types of flowers.  María Elena appreciates the loan that has been granted and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.  

The other members engage in businesses such as transportation, crafts, selling cosmetics, and sewing.  

María Elena is grateful to those who have helped her to fulfill her dream in this manner.  She commits to fulfilling her payment obligations as agreed.  

The person whose face has been covered is not part of the Communal Bank.  The members who appear in the attached photos had requested permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work obligations.

loans.use: to buy daisies, roses, and other types of flowers to sell.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Lucinda; la socia tiene 01 hijo y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de  crianza de animales menores como cuyes, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solictan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the “Señor de los Temblores-Poroy” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco. 

The borrower’s name is Lucinda. She has one child and is single. She alternates between doing her daily chores and running her business, which is raising young animals like guinea pigs. She raises these small animals in order to sell them to her clients later. She has had this business for a while and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. She wants to be able to continue working so she can continue supporting her family.

Lucinda is requesting the loan in order to buy guinea pigs.

She feels grateful for the loan and is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Edson

texts.es: Edson es soltero pero ya tiene dos hijos Edson vive con sus padres en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a su madre Edson trabaja como empleado y mensajero Edson quiere un prestamo para invertir en mejoras en la casa de su madre, especificamente los ambientes que ocupa con sus hijos Su madre le ayuda pero no puede cargar con todos los gastos por eso Edson quiere su ayuda
texts.en:
Edson is single, but he already has two children.  He lives at his parents’ house in La Paz.  The house belongs to his mother and it is made of bricks and cement.  Edson is employed as a messenger.  

He wants a loan so that he can invest in improvements to his mother’s house, especially the areas that his children occupy.  His mother helps out, but she is not able to take charge of all of the expenses.  For this reason, Edson is in need of assistance.

loans.use: to invest in improvements to his mother's house.

loans.name: Jesus Flores

texts.es:
Jesus Flores tiene 43 años de edad, es conviviente tiene 03 hijos dependientes. Vive con su cónyugue y sus 03 hijos quienes le ayudan en las labores agrícolas, viven en el caserío de Sondor. El caserío de Sondor es un caserío mediano con aspiraciones a superarse; el cual se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú, en dicho distrito sus actividades principales son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Jesus Flores se dedica a la agricultura cuenta con terreno agrícola, en la cual posee fincas de café variedad Catimor, las cuales se encuentran en buen estado, él cuenta con bastante experiencia en el rubro, Jesus Flore además se dedica a la cría y comercio de ganado vacuno posee invernas, él presenta muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. El destino del crédito es para la compra de abonos y mantenimiento de su finca de café. Invirtiendo en su negocio y podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jesus Flores is 43 years old. He has a partner and has three children that are dependent on him. He lives with his spouse and their three children; they help him with the agricultural work. They live in the village of Sondor. Sondor is a medium-sized village; it is located in the district of Pomahuaca in the province of Jaén, which is in the region of Cajamarca in the north of Peru. The main activities in the district are agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

Jesus Flores makes a living from agriculture. He has farmland, on which he has plantations of Catimor coffee. The coffee is in good health. He has quite a bit of experience. Jesus Flores also raises and sells dairy cattle. He has very good personal and work-related references. The loan is for buying compost and for maintaining his coffee plantation. He is investing in his business and he will be able to obtain a suitable profit so that he can improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost and maintain his coffee plantation

loans.name: Letty Yolanda

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Familia Con Suerte se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Miraflores  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Letty, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 19, 18, 13 y 11  años, los dos menores estudian en colegio. Su esposo es maestro constructor. 
Doña Letty es una muy buena esposa que para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que demandan los estudios de sus hijos se vio en la necesidad de buscar sus propios ingresos, ella  se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, en su casa tiene unas vitrinas en las cuales exhibe sus productos, trabaja todos los días, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada semana. Tiene 3  años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual empezó con uno de los  créditos que recibió.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños es tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The “Familia Con Suerte” communal bank meets every fortnight in Miraflores in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches, which are frequented throughout the year, and for being a city with unequalled beauty and many tourist attractions.

Letty lives in this city. She is 42 years old and married. She has four children from her marriage; they are aged 19, 18, 13, and 11. The two youngest are at school. Her husband is a master builder.

Letty is a very good wife. In order to help her husband with her children’s study expenses, she saw it was necessary to have her own income. She sells all types of clothing. She has some display cabinets in her house where she displays her products. She works every day. She sells to her clients on credit and it is payable every week. She has been doing this work for three years and she began it with one of the loans she received.

She is going to use this loan to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothing. She has been with the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because she began her business with the loans. Her dream is to have a great store.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Patricia es una mujer emprendedora  exitosa tiene la edad de 40 años de edad, acompañada, y madre de un hijo quien es su deseo de superación. Ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace cuatro años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de máquinas de coser, hilos, botones, máquinas para botones, telas variadas  etc. Con el fin de satisfacer la demanda insatisfecha de su localidad, aumentar el capital de trabajo y crecimiento del negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Patricia is an enterprising and successful woman.  She is 40 years old, in a relationship, and is the mother of one child.  This is why she wants to succeed.  Patricia has been producing clothes for four years.  

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a sewing machine, thread, buttons, button press machines, various fabrics, and other supplies.  In the end, she hopes to satisfy the ongoing demand in her community, increase her operating capital, and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, thread, buttons, button press machines, various fabrics, and other supplies so that she can increase her total sales.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es:
Marcos es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante y quiere brindarle lo mejor a su familia, es por ello que trabaja en el área ambiental de un fundo agrícola de su ciudad natal, Santiago. Él se ha esforzado muchísimo en su trabajo y ahora ha sido recompensado con este nuevo puesto. Él está muy contento y agradecido con sus padres quienes desde muy pequeño inculcaron en él muchos valores que le permitieron crecer y formarse como una persona de bien.
Debido a los fuertes deseos que tiene Marcos de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, piensa utilizar el crédito para poder comprar materiales y empezar a construir su casa de material noble. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad porque con ello su familia gozará de mayor bienestar y él continuará luchando para conseguir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Marcos is a young man who really wants to get ahead in life and offer the best to his family; for this reason, he works in the environmental area of a country estate in his native city of Santiago. He has put a lot of effort into his work and now he has been rewarded with this new post. He is very happy and grateful to his parents who instilled many values into him from a young age, which enabled him to grow and become a good person.

Due to the strong desire Marcos has to improve his family’s quality of life, he is thinking of using the loan to buy materials and start to build a house out of good-quality materials. He is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their generosity because his family will enjoy greater well-being and he will continue to fight to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to begin building his house out of good-quality materials so it is safer

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area in Kampong Speu province, Thy is 32 years old and a father of three children. He earns an income to improve his family's conditions via rice cropping. In addition, he is a tailor. He can earn about 20,000 KHR income per day. This is his first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He leads a group of seven members to get a new loan. As the leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. He expects that his family will have a latrine to use so they can live in good health.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: El socio Julio se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte y tambien negocio de panaderia, el socio hace servicio de taxi, el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,el sueño del socio es comprar un carro nuevo. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.
texts.en:
Julio continues to work in the transportation business and also manages a bakery.  He provides taxi services.  Julio works from 7:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M.  His dream is to buy a new car.  

Julio is requesting a loan in order to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Ferry

texts.en: Currently, Ferry is a student at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara (AMN). He wants to learn the science of marine engineering. Ferry lives in a village on the outskirts of the city. The area is not too broad. Ferry wants to be able to complete the program of study, but he was concerned about the cost of his study. Ferry's parents work in open food stalls in the area and their income is not very much, so it is hard to finance his studies. Ferry was the first child of two siblings. With their minimal economic circumstances, Ferry did not want to be a burden on his parents. With the Kiva program in AMN, Ferry applied for student loans so that he can continue his schooling. Ferry desires to be able to work on a ship as a ship's tekniksi professional, because he has had this dream for a long time. Hopefully with a loan from Kiva, Ferry can help ease the burden on parents. He will also be able to finish his studies on time, quickly get a job and be able to help his siblings to help achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 40 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Rebecca works very hard to provide for them.

Rebecca runs a direct selling of personal collection products business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like canned goods, shampoo, soft drinks, detergent soap, juice, sugar, etc. to sell.

Rebecca has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, soft drinks, detergent soap, juice, sugar, etc. 

Rebecca would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like canned goods, shampoo, soft drinks, detergent soap, juice, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Hùng

texts.en:
Mrs. Hùng works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

Hùng is 57 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Dong Son district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province

This is Hùng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hùng faces in her life is not having a clean water syterm and a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom and purchase a water filter system.

With her business profit, Hùng hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom and purchase a water filter systerm .

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rosela requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rosela has been in this business for three years now.

Rosela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Nghim's Group

texts.en: Nghim is 35 years old and a mother of five children living in Kampong Speu province. To support her family's living condition, she grows rice as her main source of income. She can earn an income of about 25,000 KHR per day. For Nghim, this is her first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of eight to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family has clean water to use and she can make her family's life healthy.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en: A villager living in Kampong Speu province, Sokhom is 40 years old and a mother of three school children. For her living conditions, she grows rice as the single main source of income.  She has been involved in her current business for 22 years and earns about 18,000 KHR per day. For Sokhom, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In her group of two, she is the group leader. She will use her entire loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family has clean water to drink.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Paian

texts.en:
This is the story of Paian:

"My name Paian, I come from Muaro Jambi, precisely in the village of Tanjung Sari. Predominantly as a farmer, my father was just an ordinary farmer. Income is uncertain, due to extreme weather conditions. I was the fifth child of seven children; four of my brothers were in school and still cost much. Because the economic situation is very minimal, I have a concern with my school, if I can finish school. Currently, I'm continuing education in the Academy Maritime of Nusantara (AMN) and the courses I took were of Engineering Ship Engineering. With the condition that only a farmer parents, I want to ask a Kiva loan. Hopefully with this loan, I can finish school at AMN, in the town of Cilacap. And can ease the burden on my parents lives. With this loan, my parents very happy, I hope I can repay the loan, after I finish school and work. We are very grateful to the lenders who have helped us, although we do not know you personally."

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years.

loans.name: Andrea Freshian

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Andrea; la socia tiene 21 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de  venta de huevos sancochados, la socia vende de manera ambulatoria a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar huevos, sal entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The group member belongs to the community bank "Senor De Los Temblores-Poroy"; the bank is located in the Cusco district, which is a part of Cusco county in the province of Cusco. The group member is Miss Andrea; she is 21 years old and is a single mother of one son. She alternates her daily activities with her boiled egg selling business. The group member does her selling as a street vendor to all of the customers that come to her. For a considerable period of time she has been in this business and it's going well thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. The group member wants to continue working so she can keep supporting her family. She's requesting a loan to purchase eggs, salt and other things. The group member is grateful for the loan and pledges to comply with the installment payments.

loans.use: To purchase eggs and salt, among other things.

loans.name: Jenny Julieta

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Jenny, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
La socia continua  dedicándose a su negocio de venta de comida, la socia continua vendiendo de forma  ambulatoria, la socia vende la comida a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, arroz, aceite entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member's name is Jenny. She belongs to the communal bank Señor de los Temblores II in the city of Cusco, Peru. She is still running her own business selling food as a street vendor. She sells to the customers that come to her. She is a responsible and driven person, and this business is her means of providing for her family.

Jenny is requesting this loan to buy meat, rice, oil, and other ingredients. She is grateful for her previous loan and promises to comply with her payment terms.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice, oil, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Mercedes, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
 La socia sigue dedicándose a la venta de comida en su restaurante, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, arroz entre otros.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por otorgarle el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: The group member is Mercedes, and she's a part of the "Senor de los Temblores II" bank in the city of Cusco-Peru. She still works in the business of selling food from her restaurant, and she has been in this line of work for a considerable period of time. It's gone well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day, and she wants to continue working so that she can keep on supporting her family. The group member is requesting the loan to purchase oil, rice and other things. She's very grateful to KIVA for the loan that was granted and she's committed to making the stipulated payments.

loans.use: To purchase oil, rice and other things.

loans.name: Rustico

texts.en: Rustico is an entrepreneur farmer who also helps his wife operate a general store to make a living. For over four years in running the business, it was doing well and his previous loan used for the business has been repaid successfully. He took a new loan recently to buy more items to offer to his customers in order to increase his sales. Offering more variety of goods makes your customers loyal to you. Rustico wants to expand his store as well as improve the general living situation of his family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to offer to his customers.

loans.name: Judilyn

texts.en:
As a  parent of two children, Judilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle shop business in the Philippines and earns additional income from making hollow blocks and food vending. Judilyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her motorcycle shop business.

Judilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her motorcycle shop

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosenda is 45 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Rosenda has a selling of ready to wear business in the Philippines. Rosenda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of of dry goods to sell.

Rosenda has been in this business for three years. In the future, Rosenda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Rosy

texts.en:
Rosy is 44 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

Rosy is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosy has been fattening pigs for five years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Pol's Group

texts.en: Pol is 51 years old and a mother of six children living in Kampong Speu province. Her main sources of income are from rice cropping and selling snacks to support her living. She can earn an income of about 30,000 KHR per day. For Pol, this is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that her family has a latrine to use.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marites is 38 years old and has three children who are in school.

Marites has a general store business in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marites has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy tiene 43 años de edad, es conviviente, conocido en el medio, por prestar servicio como carpintero. Vive en casa propia con cónyuge, él tiene 02 hijos de los cuales su hija estudia en Chiclayo y su hijo mayor trabaja y estudia en Lima. Fredy es una persona con buenas referencias laborales y personales, de familia unida. Vive en una comunidad ubicada en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú; habitada por gente respetuosa, amigable y amable, que se dedicadan a la agricultura y ganaderia.

Fredy se dedica a prestar servicios como carpintero en madera, desde hace más de 20 años, Fredy necesita del préstamo para invertir en compra de madera y algunas herramientas, lo que le permitirá ir creciendo en su negocio, además de permitirle captar nuevos clientes; lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Fredy is 43 years old and lives with his partner. He is a well-known carpenter. He lives in his own home with his wife and has two children. His daughter is going to school in Chiclayo and his oldest son works and studies in Lima. Fredy has good references as a worker and as a person, and has a very united family. He lives in a community located in the district of Lagunas, in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the region of Lambayeque, on Peru's northern coast. The residents of this area are respectful, kind, and friendly people, who work mainly farming and raising livestock.

Fredy works providing carpentry services, and has been doing so for twenty years. Fredy needs this loan to invest in purchasing wood and some tools, which will allow his business to grow as well as enable him to attract new customers. This in turn will allow him to improve his income in the long run by increasing his profit as well as his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wood and some tools.

loans.name: Parachichi Group

texts.en:
Almas is in his 40s, married and has two children, one of whom is at school and the other is still small. He supports his family by running a genge selling fruits and vegetables, charcoal and other cooking items. He has been in this business for five years, working from 6 am to 8 pm per working day with the ability to receive a fair monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his sixth loan to be apportioned among Parachichi, his two-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Almas used his previous loan to his genge and buy more fruits and vegetables. He managed to receive extra income, which he used to cover school fees and household expenses. Almas has been blessed to buy a plot of land and build a house, and to buy a local sofa set and cupboard. In the coming years, he would like to improve his genge to the classic level. 

With his new loan, Almas will buy fruits and vegetables for his genge.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for his genge.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Marisol, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
La socia Marisol continua  dedicándose a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria, la socia vende su comida a todos sus clientes que le solictan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz,aceite,menestras entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member's name is Marisol. She belongs to the communal bank Señor de los Temblores II in the city of Cusco, Peru.

Marisol still works selling food as a street vendor. She sells to all the customers that come to her, and this business is her means of providing for her family.  

She is requesting this loan to buy rice, oil, legumes, and other ingredients. This member is grateful for her previous loan and promises to comply with her payment terms.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, legumes, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Norma, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” ,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Norma  continua con su negocio de imprenta el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes,papeles,cartuchos  entre otros.
texts.en:
This borrower is Norma; she is a member of the "Señor de los Temblores II" communal bank, from the district, province and department of Cusco.

Norma continues to run a printing business, which gives her personal satisfaction. Norma is grateful for this loan and promises to make her repayments on time as this is the only way that she can help her family to move forward.

Norma is applying for a loan in order to buy ink, paper, cartridges and other items..

loans.use: to buy ink, paper, cartridges and other items.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Rosa, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
La socia continua dedicándose a brindar el servicio de taxi, la socia Rosa está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar en su actividad económica y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia Rosa en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
texts.en:
This borrower is Rosa; she is a member of the "Señor de los Temblores II" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

Rosa continues to make a living providing taxi services. She is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to continue with her work and promises to make her repayments on time. Rosa wants to keep on working in order to continue supporting her family. 

On this occasion, Rosa needs a loan in order to carry out maintenance on her car.

loans.use: to continue support her family.

loans.name: María Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Familia Con Suerte se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Miraflores  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive a la señora María, tiene 23 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos de 8, 5 y 4 años y un bebé de 8 meses, los tres mayores estudian en escuela. Ella vive con los padres. 
Doña María es una joven que de alguna forma quiere darle lo mejor a sus hijos, ella tiene una panga en la cual la trabaja su papá,  el realiza transporte de personal y carga desde los barcos pesqueros en alta mar a las playas de esta linda ciudad, este medio de transporte es muy utilizado y son pocos los que ofrecen este servicio por lo cual les está yendo muy bien, así ellos se ganan el sustento diario para ella sus hijos y sus padres.
Este crédito es para comprar combustibles y arreglar la panga para ofrecer un mejor servicio. Este es su  segundo ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos para sacar adelante a su familia. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Familia Con Suerte meets biweekly in the Miraflores neighborhood of the city of Manta, a town known for its beautiful beaches, which are highly visited year round. The city is also known for its incomparable beauty and for having many tourist attractions.

This is where María lives. She is 23 years old and a single mother of four. Her children are ages eight, five, and four, and she has an eight-month-old baby. The three older children are in school. She lives with her parents.

María is a young woman looking for a way to give her children the best. She has a small boat that her father uses to work. He transports people and cargo from the fishing boats to the city's nice beaches. This means of transportation is very popular and there are few people offering this service, so business is going very well for them. It allows them to earn their daily living and support her children and her parents.

She will use this loan to buy fuel and repair the boat in order to offer better services. This is her second cycle with her communal bank and she likes it because the help she gets from these loans allows her to provide for her family. Her goal is to provide for her children as best she can.

loans.use: to buy fuel and repair her boat.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio tiene 49 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de sus hijos, vive en casa propia de material rustico de un piso ubicada el Caserio La Granadilla en el distrito Santo Tomas, Eugenio es nacido en el Caserio antes mencionado, el cual pertenece al distrito Santo Tomas, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.
