Eugenio se lleva bien con los miembros de su sector, caserio y pobladores del distrito de Santo Tomas; Eugenio cuenta con buenas referencias personales y comerciales en la zona, vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza Eugenio es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 2 has. Variedad catimor resistente a enfermedades, plantación esta en su segundo año de producción tiene 3 años de edad, cultiva café en el caserio La Granadilla del distrito de Santo Tomas, actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de cafe. Adicionalmente cria animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros), cultivo de productos de pan llevar. Y cria de animales mayores (ganado vacuno) El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento y cultivo de 2 has. De café en fase de brote floral, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2015, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendra mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Eugenio is 49 years old, and has a stable home with his children. He lives in a home that belongs to him, a one-floor home built from rustic materials in the village of La Granadilla in the Santo Tomas district. Eugenio was born in the aforementioned district, and it's located in the Santo Tomas district in the Cutervo province in the region of Cajamarca in Peru's northern mountain range. Eugenio gets along well with the people in his area, in his village, and the inhabitants of the Santo Tomas district. Eugenio has good personal and professional references in the area, and his his house has running water. His community basically works in agriculture, livestock, and business.

The work that Eugenio does is coffee growing, and currently he has 2 hectares. He uses illness-resistant catimor stock, and his 3 year old plantation is in its second year of production. The coffee is grown in the village of La Granadilla in the Santo Tomas district, and he has been in this business for 3 years. He's experienced in the field of coffee growing. Moreover, he breeds small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, hogs, and more), and makes bread products. Also he breeds large animals (cattle).

The purpose of the loan is to maintain and grow 2 hectares of coffee buds, to ensure good production for the 2015 season, which would be reflected in higher sales and thus higher income to be able to improve he and his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To pay for maintaining and growing 2 hectares of coffee buds, to ensure good production for the 2015 season.

loans.name: Robeena

texts.en:
Robeena is 45 years old and a mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession; he sells fruits e.g. apples, bananas, grapes, etc. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Robeena's husband needs to purchase different types of fruit for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn the maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position, he is not in a condition to purchase fruit to sell. Therefore, Robeena has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes. 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn Nataly

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Familia Con Suerte se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Miraflores  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Evelyn, tiene 28 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen dos hijos, uno de 7 años y un bebé de un mes de nacido, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña Evelyn con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale a recorrer la localidad dos o tres veces por semana ya sea en las mañanas o tardes, no tiene horario fijo sino cuando sabe que les encuentra a sus clientes, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Lleva  1 año que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo que le sirven para mejorar su hogar.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, ropa de niño y otras prendas. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Familia Con Suerte meets biweekly in the neighborhood of Miraflores in Manta, a city well-known for its beautiful beaches, which are highly visited year round. It is also known for its incomparable beauty and its many tourist attractions.

This is where Evelyn lives. She is 28 years old and is in a common-law-marriage. She has two children from this relationship: a seven-year-old and a one-month-old baby. Her oldest is going to school. Her husband is a cab driver.

In order to earn some income on her own and contribute to her household, Evelyn works selling all kinds of clothing. She sells door to door and travels through town two to three times per week in the mornings or the afternoons. She doesn't have a fixed schedule and instead goes out when she knows her customers will be at home. She delivers her merchandise on credit and charges her customers weekly or biweekly. She has been in business for a year, and her work allows her to make some money to improve conditions at home.

She will use this loan to buy pants, blouses, children's clothing, and other items. She has belonged to her communal bank from the beginning, and enjoys it because the loans help her a lot. Her goal is to provide for her children as best she can.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, children's clothing, and other items.

loans.name: Liwayway

texts.en:
Liwayway is 25 years old and lives in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children now at their infant and school ages.

Liwayway has been engaged in the hog raising and hog fattening business for almost two years already. At present she has one sow and four piglets. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used to acquire a parcel of cocoland pawned to her. This will add to their family income.

Liwayway has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to expand her hog raising and hog fattening business by establishing additional pig fences and buildings.

loans.use: To acquire a parcel of cocoland.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 33 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Angeline has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Angeline has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Việt

texts.en:
Việt is 41 years old and she is married with one child. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Việt works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. With her business profit, Việt hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

The main hardship that Việt faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet. This is Việt's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Việt

texts.en:
Việt is 44 years old and she is married with four children. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Việt works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet. This is Việt's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

In the future, Việt hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Avelina has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

Avelina has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Mamirasul

texts.ru: Мамирасул 51 год, женат, есть сын. У Мамирасула среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, он занимается животноводством, полеводством, стартовав более 15 лет назад, благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Мамирасула, на сегодняшний день у него есть корова и 20 овец, также он выращивает клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления. На ежедневной основе продает молоко, дополнительно занимается торговлей в своем магазине. Мамирасул обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) для покупки коровы. Мамирасул намерен расширить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала его семьи.
texts.en: Mamirasul is 51 years old, married and has a son. Mamirasul has a secondary education and, to provide the primary source of income for her family, he is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started this business more than 15 years ago. Thanks to Mamirasul's persistence, drive and hard work, today he has a cow and 20 sheep, and also grows clover for his farm use. He sells milk on a daily basis and is additionally involved in sales in his store. Mamirasul requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a cow. Mamirasul intends to expand his business, which will inevitably lead to increasing his family's capital.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to increase his livestock headcount and expand his business

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Serafina, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de planchado y pintura para vehículos motorizados, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pinturas entre otros.
texts.en:
The member is Serafina, who belongs to the "Señor de los Temblores II" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She continues to work in her auto body repair and paint business. She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time. For quite some time she has been in this business which has brought her personal satisfaction.  Serafina wants to continue working to support her family.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy paint and other items.

loans.use: To buy paint and other items.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El socio es el señor  Sergio, él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
El socio Sergio sigue dedicándose a brindar el  servicio de taxi, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su trabajo, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
Sergio agradece a  KIVA por permitirle desarrollarse y mantenerse en su actividad económica.
texts.en:
This is Sergio. He is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Los Temblores II” which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru.  He continues with his business of providing taxi services which he has been doing for quite some time.  It is going well thanks to the hard work he puts into it every day.  He wants to continue working to support his family.. 

The loan he is requesting is for vehicle maintenance.  Sergio is grateful to Kiva for allowing him to develop and maintain his business activity.

loans.use: To pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un joven muy trabajador y con muchos deseos de superación, no pudo estudiar una profesión debido a la baja economía que hay en su casa por eso está trabajando como ayudante de tractor en su ciudad natal, Santiago. Cada día Miguel se levanta muy temprano porque su trabajo queda un poco lejos, sin embargo él está muy motivado y trabaja con gran entusiasmo porque quiere sacar adelante a su familia. en sus tiempos libres le gusta jugar fútbol con sus hermanos y pasar gratos momentos con sus padres.
Miguel está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprarse una motocicleta para poder transportarse de su casa a su trabajo y así ahorrar en pasajes. Más adelante espera poder empezar a estudiar una carrera para poder convertirse en un exitoso profesional.
texts.en:
Miguel is a hard-working young man who is very determined to get ahead.  He was unable to get professional training because of the household's low income, so he is working as a tractor assistant in his native city of Santiago.  Every day Miguel gets up early because his workplace is a bit far away.  But he is very motivated and works enthusiastically to provide for his family.  In his free time he enjoys playing soccer with his siblings and spending great times with his parents.

Miguel is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support he will be able to buy a motorcycle to go to work and be able to save on transportation costs.  In the future he would like to study a career and become a successful professional.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to go to work.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo,  posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, elabora puertas, balcones, rejas entre otros, tiene 8 años de dedicarse a este negocio, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar hierro, metal, herramienta etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: This young man's face is blurred because he is 26 years old and lives in a high risk area.  He has a metal structure workshop and makes doors, railings, grilles, etc.  He has been in business for eight years.  He lives in his own house with his family and is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to buy iron, metal, tools, etc. to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy iron, metal, tools, etc.

loans.name: Alex Felipe

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Villamil se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Miraflores  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive don Alex, tiene 44 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene un hijo que estudia en la escuela. Su esposa es comerciante. 
El señor Alex es un hombre muy trabajador que para ganarse la vida y la de su familia desde hace mas de 11 años adecuo un lugar en su casa en la cual puso un taller de mecánica automotriz, el también allí mismo vende lubricantes y repuestos que les vende a sus clientes, el realiza su labor en su taller y si algún cliente le pide él se desplaza a otras partes a realizar su trabajo. De esta forma el se gana el sustento de su familia y logra que ellos no pasen necesidades.
Este crédito lo va emplear en compra lubricantes y repuestos que necesita. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 3 años  y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho para  su trabajo. Sus sueños son ampliar más su taller.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Villamil" meets every two weeks in the Miraflores neighborhood in the city of Manta.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited all year long and for the unique beauty of the city which attracts many tourists.

This is where Alex, 44, lives.  He has a common-law wife and a son who attends school.  His wife is a merchant.

Alex is a hard-working man who over 11 years ago set up an auto repair workshop in his home to support the family.  He also sells lubricants and spare parts to customers.  He works out of the shop but will travel elswhere when so requested by customers.  Alex is able to provide for his family this way and give them everything they need.

The loan will be used to buy lubricants and spare parts.  Alex has been in the communal bank for three years and he likes how much the loans benefit his job.  His goal is to expand his workshop.

loans.use: To buy lubricants and spare parts.

loans.name: Rogelio Leonel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Villamil se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Miraflores  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive don Rogelio, tiene 52 años de edad, está divorciado y de esta relación tuvo 3 hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con él y estudian en universidad. 
El señor Rogelio  es un hombre que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante y darles lo necesario a sus hijos, el se dedica a realizar trabajos de instalaciones eléctricas en varios lugares, tiene contratos con personas particulares y con instituciones en las cuales les da mantenimiento, aunque lo que más ganancias le da es la construcción de viviendas ya que él realiza todas las instalaciones eléctricas, lleva más de 30 años dedicado a esta actividad con la cual saca a su familia adelante a base de trabajo duro y honesto.
Este crédito es para comprar cables y material eléctrico. Lleva 2 años en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The loan group Villamil meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of Miraflores in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are frequently visited during every season of the year, and for being a city of matchless beauty with many touristic attractions.
In this place lives Rogelio, he is 52 years old, divorced, and from this relationship he has three adult sons. Two of them are still living with him and studying at university. 
Rogelio is a man who likes to work to get ahead and give his children what they need. He makes a living doing electrical installations in several locations. He has contracts with private individuals and with institutions, where he provides maintenance. However, where he gains more profit is in housing construction, because he makes all the electrical installations. He has been doing this activity for more than 30 years, which allows him to support his family with hard and honest work. 
This loan is to buy cables and electrical material. He has been in the loan group for two years, and he likes the help he receives with the loans. His dream is to give his family the best he can.

loans.use: to buy cables and electrical equipment

loans.name: Emy

texts.en:
Emy is 36 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Emy has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from videoke rental.

Emy aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнура, 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей школьного возраста. У Айнуры - высшее образование, с 2010 года в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается торговлей мужской одеждой. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Айнуры на сегодняшний день имеется товар в обороте на сумму 350 000 сом (KGS). В целях расширения бизнеса Айнура обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку мужской одежды для перепродажи, расширение ассортимента позволит привлечь новых покупателей. Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и хочет накопить средства на покупку автомобиля для ее семьи.
texts.en: Ainura is 43 years old, married and raising 3 school-age children together with her husband. Ainura has a higher education and, to provide the primary source of income for her family, is involved in selling men's clothing. Thanks to her hard work, today Ainura's working capital consists of 350,000 som (KGS) worth of merchandise. In order to expand her business, Ainura requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy men's clothing for resale. Expanding her selection will allow her to attract new customers. Ainura plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business and wants to save money to buy a car for her family.

loans.use: to purchase men's clothing for resale in order to expand her merchandise selection

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food products for resale in order to increase her product selection and attract new customers

loans.name: Wadania

texts.en:
Wadania is a 40-year-old woman and a mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller. He sells fruits like apples, bananas and grapes. He is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Wadania's husband needs to purchase different types of fruit for re-selling purposes so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales and earn maximum profits. But due to an unfavorable financial position he is not in a condition to purchase fruit. Therefore Wadania has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so she can help her husband purchase the above items for business purposes. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fruits for her husband's fruit-selling business.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat is a 35-year-old woman and a mother of three sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a restaurant. He sells a variety of delicious dishes during lunch and dinner in the local market. He is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. Farhat's husband needs to purchase different types of food stuffs and other items for his business so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales and earn maximum profit by providing quality food. But due to being in an unfavorable financial position, he is not in a condition to purchase these items. Therefore Farhat has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so she can help her husband purchase the above items for his business. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of ingredients and food stuffs for her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Eduarda, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
 La socia sigue dedicándose a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta  forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas.
texts.en: This is Mrs. Eduarda, she is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Los Temblores II” (Lord of the Earthquakes) in the city of Cusco, Peru. She is still managing her business of selling food as a street vendor.  She's been working with this business for many years and the business is going well thanks to the work she dedicates to it each day.  She hopes to be able to keep working so that she can keep helping her family.  She is asking for this loan to be able to buy rice, oil and other things.  She feels thankful for the loan she's been granted and she is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and other items

loans.name: Teresa Agustina

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Teresa, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
 La socia continua con su negocio de pasamanería, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cintas de colores, telas, agujas, broches entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresa belongs to the Señor de Los Temblores Community Bank in the city of Cusco, Peru. She still has her business selling decorative trimmings, a business she has had for a long time. All is going well thanks to the effort she puts in every day. Teresa wishes to carry on working so she can continue to assist her family.

She is seeking a loan to buy colored ribbons, fabric, needles, fasteners etc. She is grateful for the loan and promises to pay it back according to the schedule.

loans.use: Buy colored ribbon, fabric.needles, fasteners etc.

loans.name: Sandra Maribel

texts.es:
Sandra Maribel reside en el Distrito de Buenos Aires, ella es natural de la zona, vive en casa propia junto a su familia, sin carga familiar. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila y se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, además del comercio. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que dedica Sandra Maribel es a la venta de ropa, repartiendo asu clientela de los caseríos vecinos. A la vez cuenta con una pequeña librería en su domicilio, y venta de plátanos de la cosecha de la parcela de su cónyugue, actividad que realiza desde hace más de 3 años, con buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona, y experiencia en el negocio. Destino del crédito será para la compra de ropa y novedades para las fiestas de noviembre y campaña navideña. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra Maribel lives in the Buenos Aires district of the Morropón province, part of the Piura region on the north coast of Peru. She is a native of the area. 

She lives in her own home with her family and no dependents under her care. Life in the community is quiet, the residents work in agriculture and raising livestock, as well as trade. 

Sandra Maribel sells clothing to clients in the neighboring villages. She also keeps a small stationery store in her house, and for over three years she has been selling bananas grown on her spouse's plot of land.  She has good personal and work references in the zone as well as experience in this business.

This loan is to buy clothing and new trend articles for the November festivities and Christmas season. This will allow her to improve her income in the short term and increase profits, resulting in a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing and new trend articles for the November festivities and Christmas season.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 52-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of six children, and her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Shaheen has also been selling clothes for many years and contributes her income to her husband's to manage the household. She needs to buy different kinds of clothes to resell but due to insufficient financial means she is not in the position to do so. She has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With this loan she can purchase the clothes easily, so that she can earn a more profitable income to support her family and business.

For this financial assistance Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne 33 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à BLA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments, du poisson, des céréales des produits divers et des légumes.           
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur 3ème prêt solidaire. KADIATOU, 1ère femme debout de la gauche vers la droite;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15Kgs d’oignon, 10Kgs de Sel, &0Kgs de piment, 10Litres d’huile, 2 paniers de tomate, 2 boîtes de tomate concentré et 1 paquet de Cube Maggi.  Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi group average 33 years of age with three children each, and they all live in traditional extended families in Bla/Segou (in the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other through family links and have businesses buying and selling condiments, fish, cereals, vegetables and other diverse products. 

Having repaid all their previous loans in full, the women of the Benkadi group are on their third group loan. Kadiatou, who is standing on the far left of the photo, is planning to use her loan to buy 15 kilos of onions, 10 kilos of salt,10 kilos of chili peppers, 10 liters of oil, two baskets of tomatoes, two tins of tomato purée and a packet of Maggi stock cubes. She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers and sells her goods to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and often on credit.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 35,000FCFA, which will be used to cover health expenses, food, clothing and school fees; the remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: YACINE est une promotrice qui évolue dans la commercialisation des pattes d’arachide. Elle n’a pas de parent bénéficiaire. Elle est veuve et mère de famille. Elle demande ce crédit pour aller dans les zones rurales acheter des arachides pour venir les retraiter en pattes et les vendre à ses clients. Elle gère toutes les dépenses et les charges  quotidiennes de ses enfants et les frais de scolarité. Elle a une expérience de plus de 40ans  et commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. Elle souhaite augmenter ses revenus et faire tout pour la bonne réussite de ses enfants. Ainsi elle pourra améliorer les conditions de vie ses enfants et avoir une maison moderne en ville.
texts.en: Yacine is a pioneer who has been building up a business selling groundnut paste. She does not have any relatives who are borrowing from the institution. She is a widow and a mother, and she is asking for this loan so she can go into rural areas and buy groundnut to make up into paste and sell to her customers. She manages all her children's expenses and daily outgoings, as well as their school fees. She has more than 40 years experience and begins her day at eight o'clock in the morning, finishing at six o'clock in the evening. She would like to increase her income and do everything possible to see her children succeed. She will thus be able to improve her children's living conditions and have a modern house in the town.

loans.use: to buy groundnut to make up into paste and resell in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Deme Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DEME ont en moyenne 47 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à BLA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des habits, d’huile, des céréales et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe sont à leur 4ème prêt solidaire. BEBE, 1ère femme de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  25Kgs de riz, 40Kgs de mil, 1 sac de charbon de bois et 20Litres d’huile. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 22 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Deme group average 47 years of age with five children each, and they all live in traditional extended families in Bla/Segou (in the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other through family links and have businesses buying and selling clothing, oil, cereals and condiments. 

Having repaid all their previous loans in full, the women in the group are on their fourth group loan. Bebe, who is standing on the right of the photo, is planning to use her loan to buy 25 kilos of rice, 40 kilos of millet, a sack of charcoal and 20 liters of oil. She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers and sells her goods to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and often on credit.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 22,000FCFA, which will be used to cover health expenses, food, clothing and school fees; the remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 43 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Juliet works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 27,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more stock of canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

Juliet has been in this business for six years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJEKAFO ont en moyenne 39 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à BLA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, du poisson et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur 4ème prêt solidaire. MARIETOU, 1ère femme assise de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  20 poupées, 20 jouets d’enfant, 1 cartons de savon et 1 carton d’eau de javel. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 11 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Djekafo group average 39 years of age with five children each, and they all live in traditional extended families in Bla/Segou (in the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other through family links and have businesses buying and selling fish, condiments and other diverse products. 

Having repaid all their previous loans in full, the women of the Djekafo group are on their fourth group loan. Marietou, who is sitting on the right of the photo, is planning to use her loan to buy 20 dolls, 20 children's toys, a carton of soap and a carton of bleach. She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers and sells her goods to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and often on credit.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 11,000FCFA, which will be used to cover health expenses, food, clothing and school fees; the remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products.

loans.name: Jenilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jenilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Jenilyn is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries to sell for her general store.

Jenilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Bruno

texts.es:
El socio Bruno continua dedicándose  al negocio de venta de ropa, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar casacas.
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bruno continues selling clothes, something he has been doing for a while now. He does very well thanks to his hard work. He wants to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy jackets to sell. He feels happy to receive this loan and promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy jackets to sell.

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosita de Lima” de la Asociación Arariwa.
El socio continua dedicándose al negocio de  venta de veneno para plagas y roedores, antenas entre otros, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de antenas, venenos entre otros.
texts.en:
This is a member of the communal bank “Santa Rosita de Lima”, from Asociación Arariwa.

He continues to sell pesticides, antennas and other things. He appreciates the loan he received and promises to pay the installments according to plan. He is a responsible and persistent person, and this activity helps him to get ahead with his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy antennas and pesticides, among other things.

loans.use: to buy antennas and pesticides, among other things.

loans.name: Mererani 'a' Group

texts.en:
Isabela is a mother of three children, all who are in school. She is 36 years old, married and has been a businesswoman since 2006. She manages a general store selling a variety of items such as rice, maize, baking flour and beans. She works from 7AM to 9PM everyday and is able to realize a fair monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her first credit request to be apportioned among Mererani 'a', a six-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Isabela would like to invest her portion of the credit to buy stock for her shop like sugar, rice, baking flour, beans and cooking oil. In the coming years, she dreams of managing a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy stock for her shop.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
La socia sigue dedicándose a trabajar como barman en una empresa privada, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para sus estudios.
texts.en:
This member continues to work as a bartender for a private company. She wants to thank all of those who share her dream through this means and promises to pay the installments according to plan. She is a responsible and persistent person, and this activity helps her to get ahead with her family.

She is requesting a loan to pay for her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her studies.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie provides for her family from the little income she gains monthly from her transportation services business. Her previous loan was used for renewal of licenses and has successfully been repaid. Recently, she took a new loan to buy tires and spare parts for maintenance and repair of her husband's moto taxi. She wants to see her children be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy tires and spare parts for maintenance and repair of her husband's moto taxi

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cheryl is 38 years old and her four children are in school.

Cheryl has a food vending business in the Philippines. Cheryl requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Cheryl has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Cheryl would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 49 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, canned goods and spices.

Ma. Luisa has borrowed and paid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ma. Luisa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, canned goods and spices.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her business. Perlita has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from food vending.

Perlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to buy more farmland in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida, 37, is a married woman and a mother of four children from Leyte, Philippines. Her husband operates a tricycle which he uses to transport passengers from one place to another. Adelaida also raises pigs which provides her with additional income. 
Adelaida is asking for a loan to pay for the repair of the tricycle and to buy additional piglets to raise. This loan will help them in improving their business as well as their income.
In the future, Adelaida hopes of making their business profitable and sustainable. She also wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of her husband's tricycle and to buy additional piglets for her farm

loans.name: Lorry

texts.en:
Lorry is 46 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Lorry works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more coffee, milk, sugar, eggs, candies and other items to sell. 

Lorry has been in this business for 8 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy coffee, milk, sugar, eggs, candies and other food to sell

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie is 32 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar and coffee.

Gerlie has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 34 years old and has four children who are in school.

Evelyn has a general store in the Philippines. She has requested an amount of  PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, coffee, cereals, sugar and detergent to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Evelyn has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, coffee and cereal to sell.

loans.name: Mylaine

texts.en:
Mylaine works hard to support her family. Mylaine is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like an ice box and a net. Mylaine has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like an ice box and a net.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pants, shirts for men, blouses, clothing for children, and cosmetics to tackle a new business

loans.name: Madelin

texts.en:
Madelin is a vendor from Dulag, Leyte. She is a 48-year-old, married woman with six children. Three of her children are still attending school. She engages in buying and selling vegetables and root crops like taro, sweet potato and cassava. Her husband is a farmer. To augment income, she raises and sells hogs. She has been engaged in this business for 20 years. 

Madelin has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase more root crops, vegetables, feed for the pigs and a side car for the motorcycle. This will help Madelin and her family improve their daily yield and hopefully create higher earnings. She could also transport her stocks with ease with the help of the motorcycle. 

Madelin is trying her best to expand both businesses to continue to send her children to school for better a future.

loans.use: to purchase more root crops, vegetables, feed for the pigs and a side car for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Karina Marianela

texts.es: Karina es una joven que esta empezando a trabajar en su negocio de comercializar chanchos, ella vive con su madre y su hermana en una casa  por la que pagan arriendo, Karina tiene 19 años de edad y estudia a distancia, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para incrementar su negocio, la aspiración mas grande de Karina es mejorar su negocio y que por medio de este poder pagar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Karina is a young lady who is beginning to work in the business of marketing pigs. 

She lives with her mother and her sister in a rented house. 

Karina is nineteen years old and studies some distance away. She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of pigs in order to increase her business. 

Karina’s biggest dream is to improve her business in order to pay her school fees.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Maura Oliva

texts.es: Maura tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de los mismos que 3 están estudiando, ella se dedica 8 años a la crianza de y comercialización de chanchos, su esposo es albañil, el crédito lo solicita para comprar chanchos y seguir en su negocio, lo que Maura aspira es seguir en la comercialización de estos animalitos y que sus ingresos le permitan darles lo necesario para que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Maura is 37 years old. She is married and has four children. Three of them are students. 

She has been raising and marketing pigs for eight years. Her husband is a bricklayer. 

She is asking for a loan to buy pigs to continue in her business. 

Maura hopes to continue marketing these animals so that her earnings permit her to give her children what they need in order to study.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is a businesswoman who was born in 1972. Prisca is not married; she has two kids who are at school. For five years now, she has run a local restaurant known as Mamalishe, cooking varieties of food. She cooks rice, snacks (chapati and mandazi), ugali with meat, beans, vegetables, and sometimes with fruits. She really works hard to supports her family. She works from 06am to 10pm per working day and is able to realize a good profit per month.



This is her seventh credit request from Kiva's partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She managed to use the previous loans, since repaid, to buy sodas, juices and water, cooking ingredients such as rice, baking and maize flour, sugar, and some kilos of beans. She is really happy and thankful with lender's supports to her business. Prisca used the extra income to cover school fees and household expenses. She bought a plot of land where she plans to build a family house.



With her new credit request, she will buy more cooking ingredients; cooking oil, rice, beans, maize and baking flour, etc. She dreams that one day she will be able to build a house for her family. Prisca will be held accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients for her business: cooking oil, rice, beans, maize, and baking flour.

loans.name: Magaly Milady

texts.es:
Magaly es una mujer de 26 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad, y su negocio es una tienda de comestibles de primera necesidad.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, responsable, carismática y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el populoso barrio ‘plan 3000’ un lugar caracterizado por el comercio y la manufactura realizada por inmigrantes de las etnias del lugar como los ‘Ayoreos’ y mineros relocalizados de occidente. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura ambiente de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Magaly es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español por el comercio. su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y su pequeño hijo que este año entrará a la escuela, la familia vive en una casa propia de ladrillo que cuenta con agua y electricidad. Su negocio es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como; pan, azúcar, leche, arroz, fideo, aceite, refrescos, etc., en una tienda de barrio ubicada en su casa; ‘mi negocio es bueno porque en el barrio dónde estoy es única y tengo bastante clientela’. Su sueño es tener un negocio estable y desea realizar la refacción de la habitación dónde duerme para evitar la entrada de insectos como ‘la vinchuca’ portadora del mal de Chagas una enfermedad muy común en el lugar. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en dos años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Magaly solicita un préstamo para la refacción de su vivienda para evitar la entrada de insectos como la ‘vinchuca’ portadora de la enfermedad del mal de Chagas.
texts.en:
Magaly is a 26 year old woman. She lives with her partner. She has a five year old son and she has a primary needs grocery store. She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, responsible, charismatic and hardworking. 

She works in the populous neighborhood of Plan 3000, a place characterized by trade and manufacturing by immigrants from the local ethnic groups such as Ayoreos and miners relocated from the west. It is warm, tropical, and humid with an ambient temperature of 30 degrees Celsius throughout the year.

Magaly has a dark complexion, has a medium build, and long black hair. Her mother language is Guarani and she speaks Spanish for business. 

Her life consists of her partner who works in construction and her small son who begins school this year. The family lives in their own brick home with water and electricity. Her business is selling staples such as bread, sugar, milk, rice, noodles, oil, soft drinks, etc., in a neighborhood store located in her house. “My business is good because I am the only store in the neighborhood and I have enough customers.” 

Her dream is to have a stable business and she wants to renovate her bedroom in order to prevent the entry of insects such as “la vinchuca” which is a carrier of Chagas, a very common local disease. 

This is the second cycle of loans with the institution in two years doing this activity.

It is for these reasons that Magaly is asking for a loan to renovate her home in order to prevent entry of insects such as the carrier of “la vinchuca” the carrier of Chagas disease.

loans.use: to rennovate her home to prevent the entrance of insects such as "la vinchuca" which is a carrier of the Chagas disease

loans.name: Fredeswinda

texts.en:
Fredeswinda works hard to support her family. Fredeswinda is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines.



Fredeswinda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, needles, zippers, etc. for her business.



Fredeswinda has been in this business for 20 years now.



Fredeswinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, needles, zippers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Lotis

texts.en: Lotis owns and operates a grocery store to earn a living. She is eager to have a profitable store and get a higher capital. After purchasing goods with her previous loan from GDMPC, it helped to increase her sales and she had plans to expand her offering. Her previous loan was repaid successfully due to her better income. She took a new loan recently to purchase rice and corn grits to add to her stocks.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to renovate her house for safer and more comfortable living with her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits to add to her stock.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 55 years old, married, and has seven children, one of whom is still in school



Genara is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Genara requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.



Genara has been in pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.



In the future, Genara would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa works hard to support her family. Marisa is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.



She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed like an ice box and fishing net..



Marisa has been in this business for 3 years now.



In the future, Marisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like an ice box and fishing net

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 56 years old, married and has three children living with her in Ozamiz City. 

She operates an eatery business, serving costumers in their village to make a living. Her previous loan was used for buying ingredients and has been repaid successfully. 

Thinking for business improvement, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more raw ingredients and new pots for her cafeteria.

She is hoping to expand her business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients and new pots for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor was born in 1976. She lives with her husband and three children in the south part of the country. She loves her children very much and does all her best for their well being. 

She works in a café as a waitress. She has worked there more than four years. Gulbahor does her job well and she is a very hardworking woman. 

Gulbahor needs financial support because her mother is ill and she must buy medicines for her treatment. Gulbahor is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy medicines. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment of her mother.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet, 48, is a married woman with five children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Janet has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Janet requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

In the future, Janet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 41 years old and widowed with four children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

In the future Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Good Work Group

texts.en:
Yunis is 44 years old and is not married but is blessed with four children, who are in school. She supports her family by running a business selling chips with fried chicken, soda, beers and water. She has been in this business for three years, working from 6 a.m. to midnight with the ability to receive a fair profit. 

This is her fourth credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned among the four members of Good Work group. She used the previous credits, all of which she paid back successfully, to buy Irish potatoes, chickens, frying oil, and drinks. Yunis managed to receive extra income, which she used to cover school fees and household expenses for her family. 

In the coming years, she would like to manage a full grocery selling all drinks. 

With her new credit, Yunis will buy sacks of Irish potatoes and cooking oil for frying chips and chickens. The group member will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of Irish potatoes and cooking oil for frying chips and chicken.

loans.name: Zarnura

texts.en:
Zarnura was born in 1986. She is not married and lives with her parents in South Tajikistan. Zarnura is a higher educated woman. She works in a local school but her salary is small. 

Zarnura is going to start a new business deal in animal husbandry.  She studied at the course "To Get Ahead" of a women's organization and got a certificate. She will buy a cow, feed it for some months, and sell it in a local market.

She is asking for a loan 3,000 Somoni buy a cow for organizing the new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a cow for organizing a new business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from gasoline retailing and e-loading businesses. 

Evelyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell to customers.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Harlene

texts.en:
Harlene works hard to support her family. 

Harlene is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Harlene requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
La socia Eliana, continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de ceviche, la socia vende su ceviche a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pescado, limón, sal entre otros.
texts.en:
Eliana is still running her ceviche business.  She sells her ceviche to all her customers who order it.  She's grateful for the loan granted and promises to make her payments punctually, because this is how she gets her family ahead.

Eliana's requesting the loan to buy fish, limes, salt, and other ingredients.

loans.use: to buy fish, limes, salt, and other ingredients

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a 67-year-old married woman from Dulag, Leyte. She is a mother of three grown children. 

She engages in making and selling puto (rice cake) and lidgid, made from the mixture of cassava, coconut milk and sugar. It has a filling made from sugar and coconut milk called latik. She has been engaged in this kind for business for ten years. She also raises and sells hogs for supplemental income.
 
Nenita has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy additional supplies for the food vending as well as pig feed. With these, she could cater to more customers and raise and sell healthy pigs in the coming months, thus providing nutritious diets for her two grandchildren, who are staying with her.

Nenita is hoping that by maximizing all these materials she would definitely help improve their status of living.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for her food-vending business as well as pig feed.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is operating her grocery store with her loan from GDMPC as capital. The business runs well and she had repaid successfully her previous loan used for buying goods for sale. 

She took a new loan recently to purchase additional grocery goods and livestock feeds in addition to her stocks in order to increase her sales. 

In the future, she is planning to expand her business or perhaps buy another set of sewing machines.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods and livestock feeds.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 25-year-old single man who lives in Southern Ghour in Jordan. 

Hasan's dad passed away when he was a young, but Hasan has dreams and ambitions. He has always been fascinated by mechanic work and car parts, and he used to practise mechanics after school at car workshops, until he finished middle school. Then he started to work at one to get real experience. Later he decided to partner up with a more experienced mechanic and they opened a small workshop. This has expanded over time and has employed more people. 

Hasan is very proud of what he has accomplished so far, but he still wants to open more branches and to employ more people. 

Now he is applying for a loan to buy some original car parts, and better quality ones, to maintain the good reputation his workshop has with its clients.

loans.use: to buy some original car parts, and better quality ones, to maintain the good reputation his workshop has with its clients.

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa is a 29-year-old married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jessa has a vehicle painting business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials and equipment for her business. She has been in this business for 5 years. 

Jessa would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more materials and equipment for her business

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years now, and she works hard to support her family.

She has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets. 

In the future, Merla would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for 5 years now.

She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Jessie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Nhanh's Group

texts.en:
A famer living in Kampong Speu province, Nhanh is 45 years old and a mother of one school-age child. 

She is working to improve her family living conditions through rice cropping. She can earn income of about 25,000 KHR per day to support her family’s needs. 

This is Nhanh's first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of nine, she is the group leader, and she will spend her loan portion on buying a water filter. She wants her family to have clean water to use, like other families.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de zapastos ortipedicos,por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de zapatos ortopedicos.El socio solicita el credito para comprar zapatos ortopedicos.


El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to manage his business of selling orthopedic shoes.  Through his business, he wants to get ahead.  He dreams of expanding his business of selling orthopedic shoes.  

The borrower is requesting a loan in order to buy orthopedic shoes.  He is pleased with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy orthopedic shoes to sell.

loans.name: Siria Judith

texts.es: Siria, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos, reside en un sector del Progreso, Yoro junto a dos de sus hijos. Ella ha sacado a delante a sus hijos gracias a su negocio, lleva 14 años dedicándose a la elaboración y venta de pan casero, vende tortas, quesadillas, pastelitos con piña, semitas, pan de banano, pan de coco y otros. Las ventas las realiza en un puesto del mercado local a orilla de la calle. Y para mantener activa esta actividad ha invertido varios prestamos solicitados a ODEF, actualmente solicita el sexto ciclo y es por 13,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar la materia prima como ser harina, manteca, huevos, levadura, leche, margarina, jalea, leña para hornear y unos moldes para pan. Su idea es hacer variedad de pan para incrementar las ventas y los ingresos y seguir ayudando a sus hijos con el estudio. Tiene como meta lograr la compra de un vehículo ya que gasta mucho en transporte de bus.
texts.en:
Siria is 39 years old and a single mother of four children. She resides in a sector of Progreso, Yoro with two of her children. Siria is able to help her children get ahead thanks to her business. For the past 14 years, she has been preparing and selling homemade bread. She sells cakes, pound cakes, pineapple pastries, sweet bread, banana bread, coconut bread, and other products. Her sales are conducted from a market stand that is located on the edge of the street.

Siria has been able to maintain her business by investing several loans she has received from ODEF. She is currently requesting her sixth loan in the amount of 13,000 HNL. Siria will purchase supplies such as flour, shortening, eggs, yeast, milk, margarine, jelly, firewood for baking, and a few bread tins. Her plan is to produce a variety of bread so that she can increase her sales and her earnings. As a result, she can continue to help her children with her studies. Siria’s goal is to purchase a vehicle since riding the bus can become a large expense.

loans.use: to buy flour, shortening, eggs, yeast, milk, margarine, jelly, firewood for baking, and a few bread tins.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra, who lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, is 41 years old and married with three adult children. 

She has ventured into the hog raising business to sustain the needs of her family. Because she wants to buy bags of feeds and vitamins for her pigs, she has borrowed money from PMPC. This money helps Myra a lot, and she hopes to see all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy bags of feeds and vitamins for her pigs, in order to sustain income for the family

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.en:
Dilafruz is a young and hardworking woman. She is a married mother of two children. Her husband is Erkin; he is a migrant in Russia. 

Dilafruz has always dreamed of applying to the university to get a higher education, but she did not have the opportunity to realize her dream. She started own business deal, sewing national women's dresses. She has a rental store in an atelier. Dilafruz works hard to earn a living, and to offer her children good living conditions. 

Dilafruz is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy an embroidery machine for increasing working capital. 

She awaits your mercy, and in advance thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine for increasing working capital

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.es:
Adelfa es una mujer de 56 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 18 años de edad, y su negocio es la confección de sábanas.
Ella es independiente, responsable, constante, buena madre y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el populoso barrio ‘plan 3000’ que es el más poblado de la ciudad, en este lugar fue dónde se ubicaron los damnificados de la riada del rio Piraí del año 1983, que arrasó a cientos de viviendas; dejándolos sin nada. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura promedio de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año. 
Adelfa es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el Quechua (que ya no utiliza) y habla español por el comercio. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que terminó la escuela y quiere continuar con estudios superiores en enfermería o similares, viven en una casa propia que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es la confección de ropa de cama como; sábanas, edredones, cubrecamas, cubre almohadas, etc., debido a la temporada de verano, se dedica enteramente a la confección de sábanas; de una plaza, plaza y media y dos plazas, también las realiza con diseños infantiles; ‘los clientes traen ideas nuevas y me hacen pedidos, yo me encargo de encontrar las telas y confecciono para la venta por mayor, así mi negocio es rentable…’ La oferta que propone es variada porque le gusta mucho su trabajo. Su sueño es tener un taller más grande y desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de tela por mayor y una máquina de coser recta. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Adelfa solicita un préstamo para la compra de tela por mayor y una máquina de coser recta para cumplir con los pedidos de fin de año.
texts.en:
Adelfa is a 56 year old single woman who has an 18 year old son. Her business is sewing sheets. She is independent, responsible, consistent, a good mother and hard-working. She does her business in the busy neighborhood of “Plan 3000” which has the biggest population in the city. It is where the victims of the flash flood of the Piraí River which took the homes of hundreds of people in 1983 where settled. It has a hot climate, tropical and humid. The average temperature is 30 degrees Celsius all year long.

Adelfa is dark-skinned, short and has long black hair. Her native language is Quechua (which she no longer uses) and she speaks Spanish for her business. She shares her life with her son who completed school and wants to continue to study nursing or something similar. She lives in her own house which has running water and electricity.

Her business is making bed clothing such as sheets, quilts, bed covers, pillow cases etc. And since it is summer she is only making sheets, single, double, twin, queen. She also makes children's sizes. “Clients bring new ideas and make an order. I take care of finding the material, make the sheets and sell them wholesale. My business is profitable. The offers they propose are varied as they like my work”

Her dream is to have a larger workshop and she wants to expand her business by buying fabric wholesale and an over-lock sewing machine. This is her first loan from the institution in the 4 years she has been in this business. For these reasons Adelfa is requesting a loan to buy wholesale fabric and an over-lock sewing machine to fill her orders for the end of the year.
.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale and an over-lock sewing machine to fill her orders for the end of the year.

loans.name: Fredelyn

texts.en:
Fredelyn is married and has three children living with her in Clarin. 

She owns and operates farm land, and she plants and harvests corn to make a living. She also does under-cropping on her farm and it raises more farm products to sell. 

Her previous loan, also used for farming, has been repaid successfully. To help her farm to restore nutrients and to be more productive, she has taken out a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer.

In the future, Fredelyn wants to make improvements to her house and to the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to have a more productive farm

loans.name: Absolom's Group

texts.en:
Absolom is 58 years old and the proud father of 5 children. He is a group leader and is often described as a very hardworking individual. He is representing his group of 15 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Absolom has noticed that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Absolom described his harvest last year as good, but he believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited also to be purchasing a solar light, as well as the fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during the dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Absolom’s Group will be able to plant a total of 9 acres of land and purchase a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos un hombre de 41 años de edad, sonriente, alegre, efusivo que disfrutas esos detalles de la vida, tiene un negocio de venta de comidas en un local que con esfuerzo y sudor pudo montar. 
Separado de su esposa y actualmente soltero que busca a través de un crédito mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, incrementar su utilidad, dar sostenibilidad al negocio, ser más competitivo en el mercado, diversificar la oferta a los clientes, mejorar su punto de venta y lo hará invirtiendo en adecuaciones al local, y con capital de trabajo que usara para traer nuevos productos para sus clientes. 
Su sueño personal es poder comprar una vivienda y sus sueños para su negocio son abrir un nuevo local, generar empleo.
Puedes ayudar a que este humilde micro-empresario cumpla sus sueños y darle la oportunidad de mejorar su negocio para tener una vida más digna.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 41, is a smiling, happy, and effusive man who enjoys life.  He has a business selling food at a place that, with effort and sweat, he was able to establish.

He is separated from his wife and is currently single.  He is looking to, through a loan, improve his sales, increase his customers, increase his profits, for his business to be sustainable, to be more competitive in the market, to diversify his offerings to his customers, and to improve his point of sales.  He will do this by investing in making adjustments to his place and by using work capital to bring new products to his customers.

His personal dream is to be able to buy a house.  His dreams for his business are to open a new place and to generate employment.

You can help this humble small businessman to fulfill his dreams and give him the opportunity to improve his business in order to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy stock and to make changes to his place.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a mattress and bedroom furnishings.

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS FLORES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Liliana Sulema ella es soltera y tiene 25 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos,la socia tambien trabaja para pagar sus estudios universitarios y vendiendo ropa sale adelante, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.
