Los socios que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pideieron permiso pro motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de restaurant, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “LAS FLORES” communal bank which is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of the same name.

Liliana Sulema is 25 years old and single. She works in her business selling clothing. She sells pants, blouses and shirts. She also works to pay for her university studies and sells clothing to get ahead. She has been in this business for several years and feels that things are going well for her. Her dream is to have a store. She is requesting a loan to buy shoes, shirts, sweaters and blouses.

The members with the attached photos had their photos taken after the meeting as they asked for leave due to their work. The other members work in a restaurant business, selling clothing, a grocery store, and food sales. The member thanks all those who form part of this dream through this loan and promises to pay her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy shoes, shirts, sweaters and blouses.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. Violeta has been in this business for eight years now.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables

loans.name: Sharlene Margie

texts.en:
Sharlene Margie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

NWTF is relisting Sharlene Margie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es:
Jairo un hombre que un día le cambio la vida, su esposa, su negocio sus hijos muchos acontecimientos que hicieron a este hombre sonreír, tener un motivo por el cual trabaja, esforzarse, salir adelante y nunca detenerse. 
Hablando un poco del negocio, Jairo tiene un almacén donde vende tenis, zapatos para hombre y dama y diferentes acontecimientos han mermado las ventas, como lo son las fuertes lluvias que hacen que los clientes no salgan de su casa, las bajas ventas pues es consciente de que no ha actualizado su surtido pues no dispone de capital.
Estas razones han llevado a Jairo a solicitar un crédito que usara para comprar surtido variado en zapatos para hombre y dama. 
El crédito le ayuda a este hombre a motivar a los clientes a que le compren, mejorara sus ventas y tú puedes apoyar a este cliente que busca darle a sus dos hijos un estudio universitario, a su esposa mejorar las condiciones de vivienda y para él superación personal.
texts.en:
Jairo is a man who changed his life one day. His wife, his business, his children, and many events have made this man smile and have a reason to work, strive, and get ahead never stopping.

Speaking a little of the business, Jairo has a store selling tennis shoes, and shoes for men and women. Various events have diminished sales such as some of the heavy rains that prevent customers from leaving home. Poor sales have prevented him from updating his supply for lack of capital.

These reasons have led Jairo to ask for a loan to use to buy a varied assortment of shoes for men and women.

The loan will help this man to motivate customers to buy, improving sales. You can support this client that wants to give his two children a university education while he progresses personally and provides better living conditions for his wife.

loans.use: to buy a varied supply of shoes for men and women

loans.name: Him's Group

texts.en:
Him, a local resident of Kampong Speu province, is 51 years old and a mother of six children. She does rice cropping as her single source of income to support her family. She can earn about 25,000 KHR per day. 

This is Him's first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of four members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that she can update her family's living in good health.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Stella Del Socorro

texts.es:
A sus 56 años de edad la señora Stella se rebusca su sustento diario gracias a su negocio de venta de mercancía por catálogo, vende ropa, cosméticos en general, que comenzó por iniciativa propia y pro necesidad pues es separa de su esposo. 
Trabaja diariamente lo que deba trabajar para poder llevar un bocado de comida a su familia y buscando mejorar su calidad de vida, mejorar sus ventas y aumentar su rentabilidad, solicitara un crédito para comprar directamente la mercancía ya que le sale más económico y venderla al precio que traen los catálogos.
Su sueño es poder montar un negocio ya que la edad pesa y quiere algo más tranquilo que pueda atenderlo en un punto fijo.
texts.en:
At 56 years old, Stella is able to support herself from day to day thanks to her business of selling merchandise by catalogue. She sells clothing and general cosmetics. She started the business through her own initiative and because she needed to after separating from her husband. 

She works hard every day in order to feed her family, improve her quality of life, improve sales and increase profits. She is asking for a loan to purchase merchandise directly as it works out more economical that way. She will then sell the merchandise at catalogue prices.

Her dream is to be able to set up a business as she is feeling her age and wants something quieter that she can do from fixed location.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as clothing and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.en:
Parvina works as a cook in the cafeteria of her district Gonchi. She is 34 years old, married, and has children. 

Parvina has a barn in the yard of the house. She decided to use it and start a business in animal husbandry. Her family support her in this decision and will help her in the new business.

Parvina has already purchased feed for livestock out of their savings. However, to purchase calves they do not have enough money. For this reason Pavrina requested a loan. She hopes soon to start the new business and bring into the house an additional source of income in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase calves to start a business fattening and selling cattle

loans.name: Solidaridad Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia Olga tiene 31 años de edad es soltera y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia vende lo que son arroz, azucar, leche entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz  y leche.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, salón de belleza, restaurante.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank Solidaridad. The bank is located in the province of Cusco.

Olga is 31 years old, single, with one child. She alternates her daily activities with the grocery store business. The business is going well thanks to the effort she puts in each day. She sells rice, sugar, milk, and other items. She wants to continue working as this is the way she supports her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy rice and milk.

She is grateful for the offered loan and she agrees to complete her payments according to plan.

The other members work in the business of grocery stores, beauty salon, and the restaurant business.

loans.use: to buy rice and milk

loans.name: Margarito Jr.

texts.en:
Margarito Jr. is from Pangabuan, Tangub. He is 35 years old and married. He has a small time business, operating a specialized retail store selling books in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2013, Margarito Jr. joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. 

Margarito Jr. wants to live in a safe and decent house, so he is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for construction materials for house renovation. This loan will be his 2nd loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials for house renovation.

loans.name: Joanne

texts.en:
Joanne is 39 years old, and married with five children. With three children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Joanne runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Joanne has been in this business for 15 years, and sells a variety of items such as noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, coffee, etc. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

NWTF is presenting Jocelyn's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Lady Lyn

texts.en:
Lady Lyn is 31 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Lady Lyn has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc

loans.name: Maryeling Teresa

texts.es:
Maryeling es una joven emprendedora, responsable y esforzada, estudia Contaduría Pública y Finanzas, ya que siempre le apasionaron los números, además de ayudarle a su mama con las cuentas del negocio y ahora está cumpliendo una meta que desde pequeña se propuso, ser profesional y ejercer su profesión, Maryeling a su corta edad trabaja y ha podido costear sus estudios, así también como ayudarle a sus padres en la economía de la familia, sin embargo espera firmemente poder culminar sus estudios para buscar una plaza de acuerdo a su profesión y habilidades de esa manera podrá mejorar su economía.
Maryeling espera orgullecer a sus padres quienes siempre la han apoyado en sus estudios y decisiones, de esa manera Maryeling solicita el crédito para el pago de los módulos de su carrera que le ayudaran a graduarse, este crédito le ayudara a crecer como persona y profesionalmente. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento para culminar sus estudios, sin embargo Maryeling afirma que como metas próximas es realizar un posgrado en administración financiera.
texts.en:
Maryeling is a young woman who is enterprising, responsible and hard-working. She is studying Public Accounting and Finance, since she has always had a passion for numbers. In addition to helping her mother with her business accounting, she is now fulfilling a goal she set for herself when she was a little girl: to become a professional and pursue her profession. At her young age, Maryeling is working and has been able to pay for her studies, as well as helping her parents with the family's finances. However, she strongly hopes to be able to finish her studies so that she can find a job that suits her profession and skills, and in this way she will be able to improve her finances. 

Maryeling hopes to make her parents proud; they have always supported her in her studies and her decisions. Thus, Maryeling is requesting the loan to pay for the modules of her degree program that will help her to graduate. This loan will help her grow personally and professionally. She is placing her confidence in the loan to finish her studies; however, Maryeling affirms that one of her goals for the near future is to pursue a graduate degree in financial administration.

loans.use: to pay for the modules of her degree program in Public Accounting and Finance.

loans.name: Olga Irene

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer de 42 años de edad, soltera, tiene tres hijos de 12, 21 y 26 años y su negocio es la venta de fruta a detalle.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, responsable, buena madre y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, un área caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas en galerías y tiendas de buen gusto. De clima cálido y seco con una temperatura constante de 21 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Olga es de tez morena, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el aymará y habla español por el comercio (en la foto al lado de su pareja actual). Su vida la realiza con sus tres hijos, los dos mayores trabajan en construcción y su hijo menor estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia de adobe que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es la venta de fruta; ella realiza la compra de fruta por mayor y la transporta en cajas en el taxi de su pareja, hasta la calle ‘21’ (la calle más comercial de la zona), para ofertarla en la calle y a la vista de sus clientes. Su labor es diaria porque los clientes son diarios, el comercio que realiza es a detalle, no lleva grandes cantidades de fruta, sólo lo que cabe en una caja y en el taxi. Su sueño es tener un camión y traer fruta de manera personal directo del productor al consumidor. Ella desea realizar la compra de fruta por mayor para aprovechar las ventas de fin de año y generar mejores recursos.
Es por esos motivos que Olga solicita un préstamo para la compra de fruta por mayor para venderla a fin de año.
texts.en:
Olga is 42 years old, single and has 3 children aged 12, 21 and 26. Her business is selling fruit retail. She is enterprising, independent, responsible, a good mother and hard-working. She does her business in the Southern part of the city an area of commerce all over, galleries and nice stores. It has a hot and dry with a constant temperature of 21 degrees Celsius all year long.

Olga is dark-skinned, short and robust. Her native language is Aymara and she speaks Spanish for her business, (She is beside her partner in the photo). She lives her life with her three children. The two oldest work in construction and the youngest studies at school. She lives in her own abode house which has running water and electricity.

Her business is selling fruit. She buys the fruit wholesale and transports it in cases in the taxi of her partner to Calle 21 (the most commercial street of the area) to offer it on the street in view of her clients. She doesn't carry great quantities of fruit, only what fits in a box in the taxi.

Her dream is to have a truck and bring fruit directly in person to the consumer from the distributor. She wants to buy fruit wholesale to take advantage of the end of the year sales and generate more profits. for these reasons Olga is requesting a loan to buy fruit wholesale to sell for the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy fruit wholesale to sell at the end of the year.

loans.name: San Isidro De Compone Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE”; Este banco se ubica en la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Luz Marina tiene 37 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna su actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
  La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de golosinas, aceite, arroz entre otros.                           
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los otros socios  se dedican a brindar servicio de taxi, agricultura, ganadería, venta de leche, venta de yogurt.

La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank belong to the “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE” group. This bank is located in Anta province, Cusco department.

Luz Marina, a member of the group, is 37 years old, married, and has 2 children. She alternates her daily chores with her grocery store business, where she sells rice, sugar, milk and other items that her customers seek. Her business is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day. She wishes to continue working in order to support her family.

She seeks a loan to buy candy, oil, rice and other items. Luz Marina is thankful for the awarded loan and promises to make the established payments. The other members of the bank provide taxi service, farm, raise livestock, sell milk, sell yogurt. The member inset in the photo had permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work.

loans.use: to buy candy, oil, rice and other items.

loans.name: Maria Lita

texts.en: Maria Lita is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, and she owns an upholstery business. She is 45 years old, and married with three children. She has had this business venture for a while. It helps her family a lot, however, she needs financial assistance to buy fabric materials for her upholstery business. Maria Lita is very thankful for this help, because it can sufficiently support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy materials for her upholstery business to support the needs of the family.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is 44 years old, married, and has five children living with him in Clarin. He has a transportation services business aside from his farm. His income helps him in improving and expanding his farm. 

Mario earns well and yet, he still needs more financial assistance to supply bananas in town. He took a new loan to buy new banana planting materials and organic fertilizer to have a productive farm.He plans to use the profit from his loan to purchase an additional motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy new banana planting materials and organic fertilizer to have a productive farm

loans.name: Scarleth Carolina

texts.es:
Todas las mañanas es un nuevo comienzo para Scarleth quién estudia ingeniería en sistemas en Managua y cursa el último año de su carrera, espera poder graduarse y ser una excelente profesional, para Scarleth estudiar ingeniería es un gran reto y define la ingeniera en sistemas como la aplicación de las ciencias matemáticas y físicas para desarrollar sistemas que utilicen económicamente los materiales y fuerzas de la naturaleza para el beneficio de la humanidad. A Scarleth estudiar ingeniería le ha permitido comprender la realidad y espera implementar todo este conocimiento en su trabajo que le ayudara a optimizar sistemas complejos. 
Además Scarleth siempre ha contado con el apoyo de sus padres, su madre, tiene una pequeña pulpería y su papa es docente en una universidad, Scarleth a sus 26 años está a punto de cumplir su sueño pero para que esto suceda solicita un crédito para el pago de su título, deposita su confianza en la facilidad que le puedan brindar para poder culminar sus estudios y de esa manera se podrá graduar, también este prestamo le ayudara a encontrar un trabajo donde se desarrollara como profesional, como planes a futuros Scarleth quiere seguir especializándose en su carrera y espera sacar una maestría en seguridad informática.
texts.en:
Every morning is a new start for Scarleth, who is studying systems engineering in Managua and is currently in the final year of her degree program. She hopes to be able to graduate and become a successful professional. For Scarleth, studying engineering is an outstanding challenge. She defines systems engineering as the application of mathematical and physical sciences to develop systems that use the materials and forces of nature economically to benefit humanity. To Scarleth, studying engineering has allowed her to understand reality, and she hopes to use all of this knowledge in her work, which will help her to optimize complex systems. 
 
In addition, Scarleth has always enjoyed support from her parents. Her mother has a small neighborhood store, and her dad is a teacher at a university. At the age of 26, Scarleth is about to fulfill her dream, but for this to happen, she is requesting a loan to pay the final costs for her degree. She is placing her confidence in the facilitation provided to her to finish her studies, and in this manner she will be able to graduate. This loan will also help her find a job where she can develop herself as a professional. As for her plans for the future, Scarleth wants to continue pursuing a specialty in her field, and she hopes to earn a master's in information security.

loans.use: to pay the final costs for her degree in Systems Engineering.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fertilize and maintain his cocoa crop

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is a 22-year-old student. He is a single man, and lives in Irbid with his family. 

Murad is majoring in accounting, and in his fourth year at the university. His father works two jobs, one as a restaurant manager, the other as a taxi driver, to be able to support his family. 

Murad’s purpose in applying for the loan is to help him pay for his university fees.

loans.use: to help him pay for his university fees.

loans.name: Chanthoeun's Group

texts.en: A local farmer living in Kampong Speu Province, Chanthoeun is 33 years old and a mother of four children.  She can earn income to support her family’s living condition via rice cropping. She has been involved this business for ages and earns her about 20,000 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund, (Kiva’s partner). In a group of seven members, she is a leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that she can improve her family’s healthy living.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Bisoliha

texts.en:
Bisoliha is one of the hardworking national Tajik women who is always searching for a source of income. She has two children who are the center of her life. She works hard to provide them with a good education. She is widowed, so she is only feed keeper of her children. 

Bisoliha has own her business. She has been busy buying and selling crops in a local market more than 11 years. She has a selling place in a local market. Bisoliha manages with business alone. 

She is going to increase her working capital and maximize profit. Bisoliha is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni to buy crops for increasing working capital. 

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy crops for increasing working capital

loans.name: Picol Orccompugio Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PICOL ORCCOMPUGIO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yajaira ella es conviviente y tiene 29 años y tiene 1 hijos; La socia trabaja en su  negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de hotel, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de hotel.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “PICOL ORCCOMPUGIO”. This group is located in Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

One member of the group is Yajaira. She is married, 29 years old, and has one son. She has a business selling food. She makes different dishes such as baked chicken, soup, and roasted meat. She works from 8:00 AM until 6:00 PM. She has had this business for 8 years and it is going very well. She dreams of having a restaurant.

Yajaira seeks a loan to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, vegetables and chicken. The other members of the group have business such as a hotel, selling clothing, and grocery store. The member is thankful for those who are part of her dream through their support and she promses to make the payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La socia Rosario pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco.
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de golosinas, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia vende su mercadería  a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia continua vendiendo chupetines, galletas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar galletas, gaseosas entre otros.
texts.en:
This borrower, Rosario, belongs to the “Patrón de San Sebastián” communal bank in the city of Cusco.

She continues to dedicate herself to her business selling snacks. She feels grateful for the loan, and she is committed to making her loan payments on schedule. She sells her merchandise to all customers who request it from her. She is continuing to sell lollipops and cookies, among other items. She would like to be able to continue with her work, and in this way she will continue supporting her family. 

The borrower is requesting the loan to buy cookies and soft drinks, among other items.

loans.use: to buy cookies, soft drinks and other items to sell.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally, 47 years old, is from Barangay 1, Tangub City. She is married and has 3 children. Sally remembers that her family used to rely only on the low income of her husband, where he received minimum payment but no regular earnings. From her desire to help the family, Sally was inspired by the microfinance program extended by PMPC. Sally firmly believed that PMPC could help her with her capital needs. She applied for a loan to start her chicken lechon (Philippine-style roasted pig) business. She has been in the business for two years now, supporting her family's needs. 

Sally is reapplying for another loan to pay for her dressed chicken stock to maintain her inventory and serve her customers well. She deeply wishes to maintain her membership in good standing and live comfortably with adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to pay for her dressed chicken stock to maintain her inventory and serve her customers well

loans.name: Jephry

texts.en:
Jephry, 31, is happily married with two school-age children who lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. 

He has had a hog raising business for many years.  He needs money to buy bags of feeds and vitamins for his growing hogs, to sustain his family's needs. 

It is a great help for him to sufficiently support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for his hogs.

loans.name: Arvin

texts.en:
Arvin is 19 years old from Cabanatuan City. His father died so his mother is the only one working. 

Because they lack in financial source, he wants to avail an education loan of P15,000 from the KIVA lenders.  He will use the loan to continue his studies. 

He wants to finish his schooling to find a stable job and help his mother and send his younger sibling to school.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fee.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 60 years old and lives in Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children now at their adult age. 
Lilia has been engaged in the coconut buying and selling business for 5 years. She earns approximately Php 5,000 each month doing this type of business activity, which helps support her family's financial needs. She has requested a loan to be used to buy more coconuts for copra (coconut meat) processing and resale to copra traders. 
Lilia has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, Lilia hopes to expand her coconut buying and selling business by directly delivering the copra to the nearest oil mill company in the area.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts for copra (coconunt meat) processing and resale

loans.name: Ma. Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Ma. Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ma. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Ma. Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 49 years old and single. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase groceries like diapers, sanitary pads, bath soap, noodles, cereals, etc. to sell.

Liza has been in business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as diapers, sanitary pads, bath soap, noodles, cereals, etc. 

In the future, Liza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items such as diapers, sanitary pads, bath soap, noodles, cereals, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en: A famer living in Kampong Speu province, Thy is 48 years old and a father of two school-going children. He grows rice as his main source of income, earning an income of about 25,000 KHR per day. This is Thy's first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and he is the leader of this two-member group. Thy will spend his loan portion to build a decent latrine. He hopes that his family lives in good health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Chhorn's Group

texts.en:
A farmer from Kampong Speu province, Chhorn is 46 years old and a father of five children. 

To support his family, he grows rice on two hectares area as main source of his income. Chhorn has been involved in this business for 30 years.  He can earn income of about 20,000 KHR per day. 

Chhorn leads a group of nine that have teamed up to get this loan. As a group leader, he will spend his loan portion to buy a water filter. 

He hopes his family will be healthy.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.en:
Mahfirat was born in 1968. She is married and has three children. They live together.

Mahfirat began her business seven years ago because she needs the income.  Mahfirat sells children shoes in a local market.  She started with a small amount of working capital, thanks to her supportive husband. 

Little by little Mahfirat increased her working capital. She uses the profit from her business to provide necessary things for her family.  

She is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy children shoes and increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy children shoes and increase her working capital.

loans.name: Chanpheakdey

texts.en:
Chanpheakdey is a 20-year-old student at an institute. He is from Kratie province of Cambodia. His major is rural development. 

Because he is short of finances to pay his tuition fees, Chanpheakdey has decided to secure a loan.  This loan will help him graduate successfully and provide him with a skill to build his future. 

After graduation, Chanpheakdey wants to work in any NGO or public institution so he will be able to help his parents.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en: Saodat is 24 years old. She is married and has a little child. Her husband is a business man. She is starting her own business to help her family earn a living. They live together in the south Tajikistan. Saodat is going to start an animal husbandry business. She will buy cows, feed them for several months and sell them in a local market. Saodat studied at the course ‘To Get Ahead’ at a woman organization and got a certificate. She got useful information for herself. Saodat is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy cow for starting her business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a cow for feeding and selling

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is single and has run a buy and sell butane business in the Philippines for seven years.

Lolita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of butane to sell.

In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy butane to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn, 39 years old, is married and has three children, all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 20 years, Jocelyn has operated a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Isaiah's Group

texts.en:
Isaiah is 38 years old and is often described as a very resourceful person. He has three children and is married. As a group leader, Isaiah is representing his group of 15 farmers in Kakamega North District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Isaiah's desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to save more money for the future.

Isaiah and his group will receive a total of 17 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Kampong Speu province, Heng is 52 years old and a mother of seven children. She earns income to improve her family's condition via rice cropping. 

Heng has been involved her business for 32 years and earns her about 18,000 KHR per day. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She leads a group of five members to get this loan. 

As the leader, Heng will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She wants her family to live with good health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Orly

texts.en:
Orly is 20 years old and is from Cabanatuan City. His father earns a living from farming and that is their only source of income. This is hard for them especially now that Orly is attending college. 

Orly is taking up a course in Mechatronics. He is hopeful that he will finish this course so he can help his parents and also help himself broaden his knowledge. 

Because their family is struggling financially, he is seeking PHP 15,000 in financial assistance from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.name: Mercury Group

texts.en:
Emanuel, who is in his mid 30s is single.  He has been selling chips for three years and works from 9:00am to midnight daily and he makes a small monthly profit.

This will be Emanuel first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He will use it to buy Irish potatoes, eggs, meat, chicken, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking chips.  He dreams of owning a hotel.

Emanuel will share this loan with his loan group, "MERCURY" which consist of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, eggs, meat, chicken, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking chips.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a 36-year-old married woman, and a mother of five children. The eldest is 17, and the youngest is 4. Miriam lives with her family in Leyte, Philippines. She raises pigs to earn an income. 

Miriam is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise, and animal feed. This loan will help her improve the productivity of her business. 

In the future, Miriam hopes of making her business sustainable and profitable. She also wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise, and animal feed

loans.name: Lenelita

texts.en:
Lenelita, age 43, is a merchant residing in the town of Dulag, Leyte. She is married, and has four children, ages 22, 21, 17 and 13 years old. Her husband is a farmer. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic commodities like powdered milk, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks and beverages. 

Because of the limited amount of money to sustain her livelihood, Lenelita  has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy assorted stock for the store, and pigs for the start-up of her hog raising business. These are essential tools that help improve her sales, and hopefully she can raise and sell more pigs in the coming months.

In the future, Lenelita would expand her both businesses to be productive, as well to finance the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy assorted stock for the store, and pigs for the start-up of her hog raising bisiness

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 61 years old, and a widow. 

Fe has a snack vending business in Plaridel. This is how she supports her needs, with a meager income of PHP 5,000 per month. 

Recently, Fe availed a loan to purchase Nipa thatch for roofing. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase Nipa thatch for roofing

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen has a business buying and selling bananas, peanuts, and root crops like sweet potatoes and cassava. She is married and has six children. Together with her family, she lives in Dulag, Leyte. Her youngest child is 9 year old. Her husband is a farmer. She has been engaged in this kind of business for four years now. In addition to that, Helen also engages in a meat vending business, as supplemental income.

Helen has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy a variety stock of root crops, bananas and to add capital for her meat vending business. Helen can sell more root crops and help improve her daily earnings, so she can provide her family with nutritious food and better living conditions. Helen hopes to have a stable income that will help her send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a variety stock of root crops, bananas and to add capital for her meat vending business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 58 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lourdes has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lourdes has been in this business for 38 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Desde muy temprano don Teodoro se levanta a sacar la leche de sus vacas y realizar los derivados de la leche que luego se convierten en el desayuno de su familia, además de ordeñar sus vacas también cuida su cultivo, el maíz, frijol y trigo. Don Teodoro afirma que el crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar su producción, así como la compra de dos vacas quienes ahora acaban de reproducirse lo que le genera a su negocio más ingresos, agradece el apoyo y la facilidad de los créditos estos le han ayudado a solventar las necesidades de su hogar. 
Don Teodoro satisfecho con el buen funcionamiento de MiCrédito y la oportunidad de trabajar con pequeños  productores, como lo es él, solicita su tercer crédito para la compra de tres terneras de desarrollo para crianza ya que de esa manera le ayudara a sacar buena siembra de postrera el cual desea aprovechar al máximo y así aumentar el número de su ganado. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento ya que este le ayudara a incrementar sus ganancias y al mismo tiempo aumentar su ganado, ordeñará más leche y hará más cuajadas.
texts.en:
Very early in the morning, Teodoro gets up to milk his cows and prepare the dairy products from his milk that later become his family's breakfast. In addition to milking his cows, he also takes care of his corn, bean and wheat crops. Teodoro affirms that the previous loan helped him to increase his production, as well as buying two cows which are now about to give birth, generating more income for his business. He is grateful for the support and the facilitation of the loans, which have helped him to supply the needs of his household. 

Teodoro is satisfied with the good operation of MiCrédito and its willingness to work with small producers such as himself. He is requesting his third loan to buy three calves to raise. This will help him to have a good result later, of which he wants to take maximum advantage and thus increase the number of his livestock. He is placing his confidence in the loan, since this will help him increase his earnings and at the same time expand his livestock, produce more milk and make more cheese.

loans.use: to buy three calves to raise.

loans.name: Phillip's Group

texts.en:
Phillip has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 13 farmers in Kakamega North District. He is 56 years old, married and has eight children.

Phillip likes to think of himself as a very experienced farmer. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community.  Phillip says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. 

Phillip plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Phillip’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 8.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and lights.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase home appliances.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
As a farmer from Batheay District Kampong Cham Province, Sophal, 34, is working very hard on the rice field which is located near her house. 

She has four dependent children. Her husband, Ny, 45, is also a farmer in the same field. This couple can earn approximately USD 5.00 a day, on average. Being as a farmer is the main task that she has done since 1998.

Sophal is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from KIVA to buy fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. Sophal is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN FRANCISCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Edith ella es soltera y tiene 39 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de ganderia, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de ropa.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to San Francisco Communal Bank, located in the Urcos district of the province of Quispicanchis in the department of Cusco.

The member, Edith, 39, is single and has two children.  She works in her animal husbandry business raising and fattening guinea pigs and hens for sale at the different markets.  She gets her children ahead with her small business.  Her dream is to have a retail space for selling guinea pigs and hens.

Edith's requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs, hens, and animal feed.  She's grateful to those who are part of her dream through this loan, and she promises to make her payments punctually.

The other members work in ranching, animal sales, a grocery store, and clothing sales.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, hens, and animal feed

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is 68 years old and married.  She lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental,Philippines. 

Bernardita vends from her little sari-sari store business where she generates income for her family. 

However, the demands of the customers need to sustain customer demands. She borrows money amounting to Php 25,000.00. Bernardita is very happy with all the financial help that PMPC has extended to her.

loans.use: to buy sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, etc., to sustain the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Argee

texts.en:
Argee is 19 years old and from Talavera, Nueva Ecija. His father works as a company driver, while his mother is a housewife.

What his father earns is sometimes not enough for their daily expenditures. That’s why he wants to avail himself of an education loan of PHP 15,000 from the Kiva lenders to aid in his schooling.

Argee is taking a mechatronics course in Laguna, away from his family. But there is nothing he won’t endure, for he knows that this is for the betterment of their life.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is 51 years old and married with eleven children. With five children still in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Ludivina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as sanitary pads, shampoo, hair conditioners, noodles, cooking oil, juice, beers, etc. 

Ludivina successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to grow her business.

In the future, Ludivina would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 46 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school, Felisa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Felisa has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Felisa would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Maresa

texts.en:
Maresa is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and has five children who are currently in school. Maresa has a native basket and tray weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her business.

Maresa has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Julia Ines

texts.es:
Julia es una madre de 43 años de edad que entrego gran parte de su vida a la crianza de sus hijos, a través de ese tiempo montó un negocio en su hogar de venta de alimentos como almuerzos y desayunos por encargo, pues con este negocio obtiene el sustento para su hogar.

Es madre de 2 hijos de 15 y 20 años de edad que viven con ella y depende en su totalidad de este negocio y de su esposo.

Su mayor inconveniente es la falta de capital para trabajar por ello solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido en grano, verduras, frutas, carne, lácteos, entre otros y de esta forma tener los ingredientes necesario para continuar con la preparacion de sus recetas
texts.en:
Julia is a 43-year-old mother who has invested a great part of her life in raising her children. During this time, she set up a business in her home, selling foods such as breakfasts and lunches to order. With this business, she has been able to obtain the resources to support her household. 

She is the mother of two children, ages 15 and 20, who live with her and depend fully on this business and on her husband. 

Her greatest inconvenience is the lack of working capital, and for that reason she is requesting a loan to stock up on grains, vegetables, fruits, meat and dairy products, among other items. In this way she will have the necessary ingredients to continue preparing her recipes.

loans.use: to stock up on grains, vegetables, fruits, meat and dairy products to prepare the meals she sells.

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en:
Rawan is a 20-year-old student. Rawan is a single woman and she lives in Ajloun. 

Rawan is studying geography and is in her third year in the university. Her family are living on her father's retirement salary from the military, but that is not enough for her education. For that Rawan is applying for this loan to help her pay for the university fees.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 61 years old and a widow with two children.

Juanita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retailing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Juanita has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice retailing for eleven years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Juanita aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Ngeth's Group

texts.en:
A villager living in Kampong Speu province, Ngeth is 43 years old and a mother of five children. 

Nowadays, she needs to support on two school children. She overcomes her family’s hardship via rice cropping and earns her about 18,000 KHR per day. 

For Ngeth, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of four members. 

As the leader, Ngeth will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes to sustain and improve her family's health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME ont en moyenne 39 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à BLA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, du poisson, des habits, des boissons et des calebasses. 
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leur 4ème prêt solidaire. FANTA, 1ère femme debout de la droite vers la gauche,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 6 casiers de COCACOLA, 5 casiers de SPRINT, 5 casiers de Bière, 4 casiers de FANTA et 3 casiers de ORANGE. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 70 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Djiguisseme Group live within large traditional families in Bla in Ségou, the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The average age of each member is 39 and on average each member has three children. These women know each other through the bonds of family and earn a living through selling various products, such as fish, clothing, beverages and gourds. After paying back their previous loans in full, the members of the Djiguisseme Group are now requesting their fourth group loan.

Fanta, the woman standing to the far right of the photo, plans on using this loan to purchase six crates of Coca Cola, five crates of Sprint, five crates of beer, four crates of Fanta and three crates of Orange. She gets her supplies from the wholesalers. She then sells her stock to a customer base made up of both men and women in exchange for cash and very often for credit.

She plans on making an average monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay for health-related expenses, food, clothing and her children's school fees. The rest will be reinvested back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase beverages

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es:
La socia Yeny sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de Cds y Dvds, la socia vende su mercadería  a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia  agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de Dvds entre otros.
texts.en:
Yeny's still running her business selling CDs and DVDs.  She sells her merchandise to all the customers who request it from her.  She has earned a living in this business for years and it gives her personal satisfaction because it's how she get her family ahead.

Yeny's requesting the loan to buy DVDs and other merchandise.  She's grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy DVDs and other merchandise

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La socia Patricia pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco.
La socia Patricia sigue  dedicándose a realizar diseños publicitarios también la socia continua dedicándose a la elaboración de tortas, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, siendo de esta manera que la socia sale adelante.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos como harina, azúcar, chocolates entre otros.
texts.en:
The borrower, Patricia, belongs to the “Patrón de San Sebastián” communal bank in the city of Cusco.

Patricia continues to work creating advertising designs. She is also still dedicating herself to preparing cakes. She feels grateful for the loan, and she is committed to making her loan payments on schedule. In this way, she will be able to get ahead in life. 

The borrower is requesting the loan to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar and chocolate, among others.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make her cakes, such as flour, sugar, chocolate and others.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is juggling a retailing business and supervising the renovation of her home. 

Alice hopes to live comfortably with a house that has a good roof, supported by her loan of Php 5,000. 

She intends to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record with Paglaum MPC. 

This is what she is thankful for.

loans.use: to pay for labor on house renovation.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a married entrepreneur with three children, living in Tudela, Misamis Occidental.  She has operated her transport service business for over three years, and is doing well. She had repaid her previous loan used for buying tires and accessories. She has a farm, which is their main source of income and consumption. She needs financial capital for this second cropping.  She took a new loan to purchase organic pesticides and fertilizer to have a productive farm. She wants to buy a vehicle for their transportation.

loans.use: to purchase organic pesticides and fertilizer to have a productive farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy appliances for her business selling food

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Imelda requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc.  She has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Ahamed

texts.en:
Ahamed is a 42-year-old married man with six children, all attending different schools. He is a farmer who grows coffee. He works for seven days a week and ten hours a day. He started farming way back in 2010 and was motivated by the fact that the business was profitable.

He also owns a retail shop from which he gets an extra income to support his family.

He hopes to use the loan to buy manure and pesticides for his plantations. He usually sells his goods to the local community and neighboring trading centres. His hopes and dreams are to start up a retail business in town so that he expands his sources of income.

He is described as an honest and hardworking man in business. He appreciates the services offered by lenders.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Serah's Group

texts.en:
Serah's Group is formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Serah, who is the group leader, pictured above. She is 32 years old, married and has four children. Serah has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Serah isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to save more money. This year, Serah will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Serah's Group will purchase a total of 11 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Ma. Evelyn

texts.en:
Ma. Evelyn, age 42, is a married woman with two school going children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma. Evelyn has a sewing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her sewing business.  She has been in business for 20 years. 

In the future, Ma. Evelyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her sewing business.

loans.name: Moneef

texts.en:
Moneef is a 23-year-old student. He is a single man and lives in Ajloun.

Moneef is studying in his third year at the university, majoring in genetics engineering and biological technology.

Moneef is applying for this education loan to help him pay for his university fees.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJIGUIYA ont en moyenne 30 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à BLA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers des condiments, du poisson, des fruits et des légumes. 
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJIGUIYA sont à leur 4ème prêt solidaire. CHATA,  femme assise au milieu ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 paniers de papaye, 20Kg de banane, 40Kg de banane Plantain, 10Kg d’orange et 30Kg de pomme de terre. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Djiguiya Group live within large traditional families in Bla in Ségou, the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The average age of each member is 30 and on average each member has two children. These women know each other through the bonds of family and earn a living through selling various products, such as condiments, fish, fruits and vegetables. After paying back their previous loans in full, the members of the Djiguiya Group are now requesting their fourth group loan.

Chata, the woman sitting in the middle of the first row in the photo, plans on using this loan to purchase two baskets of papayas, 20 kg of bananas, 40 kg of plantains, 10 kg of oranges and 30 kg of potatoes. She gets her supplies from the wholesalers. She then sells her stock to a customer base made up of both men and women in exchange for cash and very often for credit.

She plans on making an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay for health-related expenses, food, clothing and her children's school fees. The rest will be reinvested back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and tubers

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia Vilma sigue dedicándose a la artesanía, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo chompas, polos entre otros, la socia  se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia vende su mercadería a todos sus clientes que le solictan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de chompas entre otros.
texts.en:
The member, Vilma, is still working with handcrafted items.  She sells sweaters, t-shirts, and other merchandise to all her customers who request it from her, because this is how she gets her family ahead.

Vilma's a responsible and hardworking person.  She's grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments punctually.  

She requested the loan to buy sweaters and other clothing.

loans.use: to buy sweaters and other clothing

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
La socia Maria Victoria la socia continua con su negocio de venta de jugos y ceviche, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pescados, limón entre otros.
La socia Maria Victoria se siente muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con sus pagos de sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member, María Victoria, still has her business selling juice and ceviche.  She's a responsible and hardworking person.  She has had her business for a long time and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She wants to be able to keep on working so she can support her family.

She's requesting the loan to buy fish, limes, and other ingredients.

María Victoria's very grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy fish, limes, and other ingredients

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia Luz Marina continua dedicándose al negocio de agricultura y crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes.
La socia está feliz con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luz Marina continues to work in business of agriculture and raising small animals like guinea pigs and hens. She has done so for quite awhile, which has gone well thanks to the effort she puts in every day. She wishes to keep up her work to support her family. 

She asks for this loan to buy guinea pigs.

She is happy with the loan and promises to make the loan payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a fifty-two-year old vendor selling camote (sweet potatoes) and vegetables as well. She hails from Dulag, Leyte. She is a mother of six children. Her youngest child is 14. Her husband is a carpenter.

Aside from that, she also raises and sells hogs, to augment her income.

Elizabeth has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy a variety of stock of root crops and pig feed. She could now offer her customers a wide array of stock and help produce and sell healthy pigs.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to maximize all these tools that would expand her business, and at the same time, send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a variety of stock of root crops and pig feed.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is 46 years old and has four children living with her in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She operates their farm to make a living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. She took a new loan recently to purchase organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients to have a more productive farm. She plans to build a warehouse to stock her farm products safely.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients to have a more productive farm.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 48 years old and married with two children, who are both in school.

She earns a living by selling livestock in the Philippines. Lolita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell to customers.

Lolita has been selling livestock for 13 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell

loans.name: Eduardo Enrique

texts.es:
Eduardo un hombre de 60 años de edad, trabajador, responsable, amable, entusiasta y soñador, tiene una familia conformada por su pareja y dos hijos ambos mayores de edad y pude darles el sustento con su negocio de billar, un lugar donde pueden disfrutar un agradable juego y compartir una bebida con amigos y conocidos que inicio con el sueño de mejorar su situación económica.
Eduardo viene con la idea de solicitar un crédito que le permita mejorar sus ventas aumentar sus clientes, incrementar su utilidad, ser más competitivo y lo quiere hacer comprando una mesa de billar donde puede jugar otro grupo de clientes sin tener que esperar mucho rato pro un turno. 
Este crédito le permitirá a este humilde hombre seguir buscando un bienestar a su familia, llevarles el sustento y darle un servicio a una comunidad trabajadora que encuentran en este billar un lugar de esparcimiento y relajación.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a 60-year-old man. He is a hard-working, responsible, friendly, and enthusiastic dreamer. His family includes his spouse and his two children, who are both adults. He is able to give them their daily sustenance with his billiard business, a place where people can enjoy a nice game and share a drink with friends and acquaintances. He started this business with dreams of improving his financial situation.

Eduardo wishes to request a loan that will help him improve his sales, expand his customer base, increase his usefulness, and be more competitive. He wants to do this by purchasing a billiard table where another group of customers can play without having to wait a long time for a turn. This loan will allow this humble man to continue caring for the well-being of his family, giving them their daily sustenance, and providing a service to a hard-working community that finds recreation and relaxation at his billiard business.

loans.use: to buy a billiard table for his business.

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth has six children and is always described as a very hardworking individual.  This is why she was selected to become the group's leader. 

The group of nine farmers, in Kakamega North District and they are happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Ruth has been a farmer for 20 years and in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund. 

Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting, as that means she will now have light during dark hours so her children will be able to study.  With the profits from this coming season, Ruth is plans to invest in a business.

A total of 2.5 acres will be planted by Ruth's Group, and between them they will receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and solar lights.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase iron steels, cement, and sand to make roof for her house.

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Residing in Kampong Chhnang Province, Min is 54 years old and a mother of four children. She has overcome her family’s hardships via rice cropping and selling firewood to earn more income. She can earn income about 22,400 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund  (Kiva’s partner). She will use her entire loan portion to buy a solar panel. She hopes that she can improve her family condition with electricity to use after she gets the solar panel.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang province, Tek Phos district

loans.name: Sreymao's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Kampong Speu province. 

Sreymao is 45 years old and a mother of three schoolchildren. She grows rice as the single source of income for her family. She has been involved the business for ages and it earns her about 20,000 KHR per day. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of seven to get a new loan. 

As the leader, she will spend her loan to build a decent latrine. She hopes that her family will live in healthy conditions.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Sameer

texts.en:
Sameer is a 23-year-old, single man from Nablus City. He lives with his old parents in a small house. His father was an employee in the public sector, but he retired recently. Sameer's mother is very sick and she needs a lot of medicines and healthcare, which is very expensive. 

Three years ago, Sameer started his own business, which is a barbershop in the neighborhood. It is a good business and supports the family for a good part of their expenses.  Sameer took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to improve the barbershop and to buy some hair products he uses daily. This will help him to increase his income. By taking this loan, Sameer will be able to provide the health and medical care for his mom.  Sameer appears in the photo in his barbershop.

loans.use: to buy some hair products to improve his barbershop.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en: Arnold is 24 years old from Talavera, Nueva Ecija.  He is taking a Mechatronics course. Their family’s income is from his father who is an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker). As the sole provider, his father can’t compensate for all their expenses. That’s why Arnold wants to avail an education loan of PHP 15,000 to be used for his school expenses.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.name: Phearak

texts.en:
A farmer from Kampong Cham Province, Phearak, 29 years old, works very hard on the soy-bean field which is located near his house. He is a father of five dependent children. His wife, Chanthan, is also a farmer in the same field. This couple can earn approximately USD 10.00 a day. Farming is the main task that he has done for nearly ten years.

In this farming season, he is lacking money to buy farm supplies. To continue his farming, he would like to borrow money through Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  He is thankful to lenders for the financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shampoo, processing caps, shaving cream, gel, etc., haircare products for men and women.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: A local farmer living in Kampong Chhnang Province, Rin is 41 years old and a mother of two schoolchildren. To support her family, she grows rice as her main source of income. Moreover, she earns extra income selling firewood and earns about 33,300 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to buy a solar panel. She hopes that her family has electricity to use.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang province, Tek Phos district

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
A farmer living in Kampong Chhnang province, Rom is 44 years old and a mother of five children. To support her family, she grows rice as her main source of income and sells firewood to supplement her income. This business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day. 

This is Rom's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to buy a solar panel.  She hopes that her family can have electricity to use.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang province, Tek Phos district

loans.name: Jackton's Group

texts.en:
Jackton is a 57-year-old proud father of six children. He is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing his group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Jackton has noticed that he has had more profits from his harvest.

Jackton described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during the night in order to feel safer. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Jackton’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sơn

texts.en:
Sơn works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. He is 32 years old and married with two children. Sơn lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa Province.

This is his first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Sơn has been involved in this business for eight years. The main hardship that Sơn faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Sơn hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for his kids, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Hiền

texts.en:
Hiền operates a food stall/restaurant selling shrimp. She is 46 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hiền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hiền has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.The main hardship that Hiền faces in her life is not having a hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Hiền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her business to remain successful.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Mercilita

texts.en:
Mercilita, a 58-year-old widow, has four children and  lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her family. She owns a farm and is doing well; that makes her earn good income for the family. She had successfully repaid  her previous loan used for fertilization of her farm. With her investment, she was able to generate more income than before and support her children's education. 

Mercilita took out a new loan recently to purchase fertilizer and pesticide to improve her banana farm. She wants to improve her farm and her future plan is to renovate their home for safe living for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide to improve her banana farm

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia is married with 10 children. A 44-year-old woman, she owns and operates a grocery store to earn a living. She is eager to have a profitable store and earn more capital. After purchasing goods with her previous loan from GDMPC, she increased her sales and she had a plan to expand her offerings. Her previous loan was repaid successfully for she earned better income from this. She took out a new loan recently to purchase rice and corn grits in addition to her current stock.
