She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to renovate her house for a safer and more comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits to add to her stock.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 50 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like spices, eggs, canned goods, soap, etc.

Leonisa has borrowed and repaid 36 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like spices, eggs, canned goods, soap, etc.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is 40 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by selling livestock in the Philippines. Rhodora is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell. She has been selling livestock for three years.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Señor De Huanca De Cusco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE HUANCA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia ella es casadas y tiene 52 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de frazadas, negocio de crianza de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Señor de Huanca Communal Bank, located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.

The member, Julia, is 52 years old and married, and she has four children.  She works in her business selling food from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m.  She makes a variety of dishes such as baked chicken, soup, and meat "saltados" [stir fry].  She has eight years of experience in the business and it's going very well for her.  Her dream is to have a restaurant.

Julia's requesting the loan to buy cooking products such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.  She's grateful to those who are part of her dream through this loan, and she promises to make her payments punctually.

The businesses of the other members are blanket sales, raising animals, a grocery store, and food sales.

loans.use: to buy cooking products such as rice, vegetables, and chicken

loans.name: Thơm

texts.en:
Thơm has a service business cutting hair. Thơm is 28 years old and married with two children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa Province.

In 2013, Thơm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thơm has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for six years.
The main hardship that Thơm faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Thơm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Concipcion

texts.en: Concipcion works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net. Concipcion has been in this business for three years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net.

loans.name: Bonswend Songre Koulgorin Group

texts.fr:
Mme LAMOUSSA est responsable du groupe BONSWEND SONGRE KOULGORIN. Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. 05 vont à l’école.
Mme vend du dolo (bière de mil) et des céréales depuis plus de 25ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Elle veut s’acheter 02 sac de mil germé, 01sac d’haricot et un sac d’arachide.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut aider à l'épanouissement des enfants. Elle ambitionne devenir une grande commerçante de céréales (grossiste).
texts.en:
Mme Lamoussa is the leader of the group called Bonswend Songre Koulgorin. Married, she is the mother of five children. The oldest is 20 years old, and the youngest six years old. All five go to school. 

Mme Lamoussa has been selling dolo (millet beer) and cereals for more than 25 years. She buys her supplies in the surrounding markets. She wants to buy two sacks of sprouted millet, one sack of beans, and one sack of peanuts. 

With her profit, she wants to further the well-being of her children. Her ambition is to become an large-scale seller of cereals (wholesaler).

loans.use: to buy two sacks of sprouted millet, one sack of beans, and one sack of peanuts

loans.name: Nancy Goya

texts.es:
La socia Nancy pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia Nancy es docente de profesión, la  socia sigue realizando su negocio de tejidos hechos a mano, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia vende sus tejidos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de lanas,hilpos,cierres entre otros.
texts.en:
The borrower, Nancy, belongs to the communal bank "Patron de San Sebastián" from the city of Cusco. She is a teacher by profession.

Nancy continues with her business of making hand-knitted items. She sells to clients that request her products. She would like to continue working in this manner to support her family. 

She is requesting this loan to buy wool, thread, and zippers, among other items. 

She is grateful for the loan and committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy wool, thread, and zippers, among other items.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 45 years old and the proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual.  She is representing her group of 15 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Elizabeth has noticed that she has learned a lot from farming trainings.

Elizabeth described her harvest as good last year, but she believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited also to be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize.  She will be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Elizabeth’s group will be able to plant a total of 8.5 acres of land and buy a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Agano Group

texts.en:
Gisela, who is in her early 30s, is single, with one son who is still in school. She has been a food vendor for one and a half years now.  She works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.
 
This will be Gisela's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to restock items in her food store.  She dreams of building her own house.

Gisela will share this loan with her loan group, Agano, which consist of six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock items in her food store.

loans.name: Fasso Kanou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe FASSO KANOU ont en moyenne 38 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à BLA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des habits, des céréales et des condiments. 
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe FASSO KANOU sont à leur 3ème prêt solidaire. SAFI, 1ère femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  20 robes, 15 chemises, 10 foulards, 5 pantalons et 3 pièces d’unit Wax. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group called Fasso Kanou have an average age of 38, on average three children, and all live in extended traditional families in Bla/Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women met through being related to each other and they buy and sell clothing, cereals, and condiments. 

After having correctly reimbursed their preceding loans, the women of the group called  Fasso Kanou are on their third solidarity loan. Safi, the first woman from left to right in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy 20 robes, 15 shirts, 10 scarves, 5 pairs of pants, and three outfits made of African print cloth. She buys her wares right there, from wholesalers. She makes her sales to a clientele composed of women and men, for cash and often for credit. 

Safi expects to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 F CFA which will be used for expenses related to healthcare, food, and clothing and for school fees, with the remainder reinvested  in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Khương

texts.en:
Mrs. Khương operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Khương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. In 2013, Khương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Khương has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Khương is 38 years old, and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. The main hardship that Khương faces in her life is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Khương hopes for her children to find a good job, for her children to do well in school, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel works hard to support her family. Maribel is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Maribel requested a 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Maribel has been in this business for 10 years now.

Maribel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
Sorn, a local resident living in Kampong Speu province, is 43 years old.  She is a widowed mother blessed with two children. 

To improve her family condition, she grows rice and raises chickens and ducks. She can earn income about 15,000 KHR per day to support her living. 

This is first time for Sorn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of five members to get new loan. 

As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that her family will have a new latrine to use.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Hồng

texts.en:
Mrs. Hồng operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Hồng has been involved in this business for four years.

Hồng is 21 years old, and she is married with one child. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hồng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

The main hardship that Hồng faces in her life is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Hồng hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a piano and a drum set to meet the demand for classes in these instruments.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en: Genoveva lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. She owns and operates a business, selling a variety of dresses and ready-to-wear products in the market. She earns well  from her business. Genoveva has successfully repaid her previous loan used for this business. She recently took out a new loan to buy new children's wear and sandals for sale in her store. Positively, she simply hopes for business improvements in order to have savings for her future.

loans.use: to buy new children's wear and sandals for sale in her store

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn, who is 37 years old, is married, with six children, four of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marilyn has a business selling food in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials for preparing her food.

Marilyn has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials for preparing food to sell.

loans.name: Janepher's Group

texts.en:
Janepher is 36 years old and the proud mother of seven children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual. She is representing her group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Janepher has noticed that she has been able to save more money.

Janepher described her harvest as excellent last year, but she believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited also to be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Janepher’s group will be able to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land and purchase a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to buy a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Dora Lilia

texts.es:
Desde el año 1997 Dora comenzó a administrar el negocio familiar, una finca que le dio su padre y gracias a él tiene todos los conocimientos para administrarla y hacerla rentable pues de ella depende su familia, sus dos hijos y quiere algún día poder dejarle este hermoso terreno a alguno de sus hijos. 

La señora Dora se enfrenta en estos tiempos una dificultad y son las fuertes lluvias que afectan sus cosechas y los altos costos de los insumos agrícolas y al ver que se encuentra en una emergencia quiere solicitar un crédito que necesita urgentemente para la compra de abonos y cuidar lo que la lluvia le dejo ya que de esta cosecha depende toda su familia. 

Sus propósitos para la vida son mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, darle sostenibilidad a su negocio y hacer que sus cultivos sean más productivos.
texts.en:
Since 1997, Dora has been running the family business; her father passed the farm on to her and, thanks to her dad, she has all of the necessary knowledge to manage the fields and make them profitable. Dora, together with her two children, depend on the farm for income. She would like to leave these beautiful fields to one of her children one day.

Dora is facing challenging times. The strong rains have affected her harvests and she is also facing high costs of agricultural supplies. She finds herself in an emergency. She has an urgent need for a loan to help her pay for fertilizer and take care of the effects of the heavy rains. Her entire family depends on this harvest.

She hopes to improve the quality of life of both herself and family, and to make her family business more sustainable through more productive crops and harvests.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and irrigation for her lands.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey, 51 years old, lives in Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. She has four children in total; one is married and three are single. To earn a living, she manages and operates a farming business by growing rice and selling her agricultural product to the local dealers. So far, she has been in this field of business for around 30 years, with the daily salary of USD 10.00, on average. 

Srey wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Carpinteria Group

texts.es: Grupo Carpintería está formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxito, una de ellas es Carmen de 59 años de edad, soltera, y su negocio es venta de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos desde hace seis años, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra pantalones, camisas, camisetas, chores, sandalias, zapatos para damas y caballeros, perfumes, cremas corporales, cremas de cabello, desodorantes etc. La segunda socia es la señora Teresa de 58 años de edad y su negocio es la comercialización de ropa en su domicilio; Y la tercera socia es Juana de 41 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de frijoles y ropa usada en su domicilio.
texts.en:
The Carpinteria Group is made up of three successful entrepreneurs. One of them is Carmen who is a 59 year old single woman. For the last six years, her business has been the selling of clothing, shoes and cosmetics. She will invest this loan in the purchase of pants, shirts, shorts, sandals, women's and men's shoes, perfumes, body creams, hair creams, deodorants, etc.

The second member is 58 year old Theresa whose business is the sale of clothing from her home. And, the third member is 41 year old Juana whose business is the sale of beans and used clothing from her home.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, shorts, sandals, women's and men's shoes, perfumes, body creams, hair creams, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Huệ

texts.en:
Mrs. Huệ, 49 years old, has worked in agriculture for more than 10 years, farming food. She is married and has 2 children. Huệ lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Huệ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main harship that Huệ faces in her life is not having a clean water cistern and a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet. In the future, Huệ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an assortment of clothes to supply during the holiday season.

loans.name: Rizvalda

texts.en:
Rizvalda is a member of the ethnically vulnerable Egyptian community of Albania. She is 26 years old and married.  She has two children, 10 and 7 years old; she is in the photograph with them. 

Rizvalda and her family live in a village.  They do agriculture/livestock, unlike most other members of their community who live in the suburbs; the businesses they pursue are mostly buying/selling or new items.

Rizvalda plants and sells animal fodder, beans, and corn.  Currently she’s got only one dairy cow; she sells a bit of raw milk to a nearby dairy farm. 

Rizvalda wants to buy another dairy cow.  Your help will improve considerably her family’s living conditions, which now include poor food and sanitation.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра  женщина 49 лет. Она разведена. Живет с сыном и дочерью. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина, любит свою семью и старается для благополучия семьи. Она занимается куплей продажей фруктов и овощей на местном рынке.Её сын находится в миграции в России. Он также помогает своей матери присылая ей денежные переводы. Гулчехра сотрудничает с МДО Арванд с 2011 года. На этот раз она хочет получить потребительский кредит для покупки одежды и мебели для дома. Заранее благодарит МДО Арванд и говорит «Спасибо за поддержку и доверие!»
texts.en: Gulchehra is a 49-year-old woman. She is divorced. She lives with her son and daughter. She is a very hardworking woman, loves her family and strives for the well-being of the family. She buys and sells fruits and vegetables at the local market. Her son has migrated to Russia. He still helps his mother by sending her money transfers. Gulchehra has been collaborating with MDO Arvand since 2011. This time she wants to receive a consumer loan to purchase clothing and furniture for her home. She thanks MDO Arvand in advance and says "Thank you for the support and trust!»

loans.use: to buy children's clothing and furniture.

loans.name: Gadoyboy

texts.ru:
Гадойбой  живет в Ганчинском районе. Ему 58 лет. Он женат и имеет 4х детей. У Гадойбоя среднее образование. Он занимается животноводством  более 33 лет. Для дополнительного дохода он также занимается земледелием. Он занимается животноводством с детства, теперь как семьянин это источник  дохода  для его семьи , семья помогает ему в его работе. Для своей семьи он старается трудится и зарабатывать,   чтобы у них было всё в достатке .  Он  хочет купить скот для выкармливания и продажи. Из-за нехватки своего собственного капитала он обратился в МДО Арванд за кредитом.  
	Заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие МДО Арванд.
texts.en:
Gadoyboy lives in the Ganchinski region. He is 58 years old. He is married and has four children. Gadoyboy has a secondary education. He has been raising livestock for more than 33 years. As an additional source of income, he also is involved in agriculture. He has been involved in raising livestock since childhood, and now since it is the family's source of income his family helps him in his work. For the sake of his family, he strives to work and make a living so they have everything in abundance. He wants to purchase cattle for fattening and resale. Because he has insufficient working capital, he applied to MDO Arvand for a loan.

He thanks MDO Arvand in advance for their support and trust.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Kanykei

texts.ru: Каныкей, 28 лет, в разводе, есть годовалый сын, присматривать за ним помогает мама Каныкей. У Каныкей среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода, она занимается сельским хозяйством. На 1,40 Га собственной земельной доли Каныкей выращивает кукурузу и клевер. В хозяйстве также есть 1 жеребенок, 1 корова, 1 теленок и 5 овец. Ее родители с радостью помогает в ведении бизнеса. Ежемесячная прибыль Каныкей составляет около 7,000 сом (KGS), однако этих средств чрезвычайно не хватает на достойную жизнь и воспитание сына. Поэтому Каныкей и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья телят. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, что позволит увеличить доходы ее семьи.
texts.en:
Kanykei is 28 years old, is divorced, has a one-year-old son, and her mother helps look after him. Kanykei has a secondary education. As a main source of income, she is involved in agriculture. On 1.40 hectares of her own land, Kanykei grows cucumbers and clover. On her homestead she also has one colt, one cow, one calf and five sheep. Her parents with joy helps her in running the business. Kanykei's monthly profit amounts to about 7,000 som (KGS), however these funds are extremely insufficient for a decent life and for the education of her son. Therefore, Kanykei also applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) for expanding her headcount of calves.

She plans to invest profits from the loan in further propagating the quantity of domestic animals in order to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional calves in order to increase the headcount of livestock and grow her income.

loans.name: Lọc

texts.en:
Mrs. Lọc works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Lọc has been involved in this business for eight years.

Lọc is 31 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Lọc's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

The main hardship that Lọc faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Lọc hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Waldo

texts.es:
Waldo es un joven hombre de 19 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es la producción y venta de Queso.
Él es independiente, emprendedor, responsable, activo, constante y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad de ‘Karapata’ ubicado a orillas del lago Titicaca, a una altura promedio de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar, de clima frio y seco, donde los rayos solares golpean con gran fuerza la superficie.
Waldo es de tez morena, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el aymará y habla español por el comercio. Vive en casa de sus padres; que esta construida de adobe y cuenta con electricidad. Su negocio lo heredó de sus familiares y es la producción y venta de queso, actividad que realiza durante todos los días de la semana y también se encarga de realizar la venta; transportando todos sus productos hasta la ciudad más cercana para dejarlo en tiendas de barrio. La producción de queso varía de acuerdo a la cantidad de leche, como  buen productor, él se encarga de viajar hasta las granjas de otros productores y comprar leche; ‘muchas veces mi ganado no produce la suficiente leche, debido al frío y al escaso forraje, es por eso que me movilizo a otras comunidades y compro leche, trayéndola en grandes bidones…’. Su deseo es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una movilidad, para poder realizar la compra y transporte de leche de otras comunidades y también para transportar su producción de queso hasta la ciudad. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en tres años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Waldo solicita un préstamo para la compra de una movilidad para viajar a otras comunidades y comprar leche y vender queso.
texts.en:
Waldo is a young man who is 19 years old, single, and without children. His business is making and selling cheese.

He is independent, entrepreneurial, responsible, active, persevering, and very hardworking. He does his work in a community called Karapata, located on the shore of Lake Titicaca at an altitude of 3800 meters above sea level. The community has a cold, dry climate, and the sun’s rays hit the ground very strongly here.

Waldo is dark-skinned and short statured. His native language is Aymará, and he also speaks Spanish for business. He lives in his parents’ house, which is made of adobe and has electricity. He inherited his business – making and selling cheese – from his relatives. He works on this activity every day of the week, and he also is in charge of carrying out sales. He transports all of his products to the closest city to leave them in the neighborhood stores. 

Cheese production varies depending on the amount of milk. As a good producer, he travels to other producers’ farms to buy milk. He says, “Many times my cattle do not produce enough milk, due to the cold and scarce fodder. Because of this, I go to other communities to buy milk, bringing it back in large cans.” 

His wish is to improve his family’s quality of life, and to expand his business by buying a vehicle. This will allow him to buy and transport milk from other communities, and also to transport his cheese products to the city. This is the first loan that he has requested with the institution in the three years that he has been in this occupation.

For these reasons, Waldo is requesting a loan to buy a vehicle to travel to other communities to buy milk and sell cheese.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle to travel to other communities to buy milk and sell cheese.

loans.name: Herman

texts.es:
Herman tiene 57 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Nanchoc, provincia de San Miguel, región Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Herman se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que esta ubicado en su domicilio, él solicita préstamo para mejoramiento de infraestructura donde se encuentran sus animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones a sus animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; Herman piensa mejorar productividad de los animales para poder atender las diversas necesidades y gustos de los clientes de la zona. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Herman is 57 years old, married, and he has a child. He lives with his family in a rural area of the Nanchoc district, province of San Miguel, in the region of Cajamarca on Peru's northern mountain range. His community works mainly in agriculture, ranching, and trade.

Herman makes a living raising and selling animals. He has over ten years of experience with this business which is located at his own home.

He's requesting a loan to improve the infrastructure where he keeps his animals. Such an investment will help to raise the animals in better conditions, with major influence on the business. 

He plans to improve productivity in order to meet the needs and tastes of his customers in the area. This will allow him to improve his income in the short term, increase profits, and consequently improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure where he keeps his animals.

loans.name: Lâm

texts.en:
Lâm, 26 years old, has operated a retail business selling stationery items for 4 years. She is married and has 1 child. Lâm lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Lâm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a clean water cistern and a hygienic latrine.She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet. In the future, Lâm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Samarth's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Kampong Speu province, Samarth, 30, is a father of two dependent children, both in school. He cultivates paddy rice as his single source of income, earning about 16,000 KHR per day. 

This is Samarth's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He leads a group of six to get new loan. Samarth will spend his entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. He hopes that he can improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es:
Martha junto con su esposo lograron montar un restaurante un negocio que montaron por vocación y gusto al trabajo independiente y con conocimientos empíricos de cocina iniciaron este reto buscando un negocio que les diera los ingresos pues por su avanzada edad no podían emplearse en otro negocio. 

Una de las principales dificultades que presenta es el largo desplazamiento de su hogar al sitio de trabajo pero sin embargo madrugan todos los días a preparar un rico desayuno, unos exquisitos almuerzos y unos sabrosos pasa bocas. 

Con la clara intención de comprar una casa que les quede cerca del trabajo la señora Martha le gustaría solicitar un crédito para invertir en materia prima que sería carnes, verduras, frutas, bebidas, granos, víveres etc. 
Un proyecto a corto plazo es poder emplear personas en su restaurante.
texts.en:
Martha, together with her husband, managed to establish a restaurant, a business that they established due to their vocation and their enjoyment of self-employment along with their empirical knowledge of cooking. They began this challenge by seeking a business that would provide them with income given that due to their advanced age they could not employ themselves in any other business.

One of the main difficulties they face is the long distance from their home to their workplace. However, they get up early every day to prepare delicious breakfast, exquisite lunches and tasty appetizers.

With the clear intention of buying a house closer to her work, Martha would like to request this loan to invest in raw materials such as meats, vegetables, fruits, drinks, grains, provisions, etc. A short term project is to be able to employ people in her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business like meat, vegetables and dairy products, among other things.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 38 years old and has four children. She is married and all of her children are in school.

Mary Grace is in the agricultural business, selling livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell. She has been selling livestock for four years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mary Grace would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Toktobubu

texts.ru: Токтобубу 54 года, замужем, воспитала 3 детей. Токтобубу в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 2002 года начала заниматься полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день Токтобубу на арендованной земле мерою 2,50 Га выращивает фасоль, горох, картофель для реализации. Вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 16,500 сом (KGS). Сделав вывод, что данный бизнес рентабелен, так как экологичекски чистая, вкусная продукция пользуется большим спросом, Токтобубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и семян картофеля элитных сортов. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и накопить средства на свадьбу ее сына.
texts.en:
Toktobubu is 54 years old, married, and raising three children. As a main source of income for her family, Toktobubu since 2002 began to raise crops. Thanks to her hard work, Toktobubu currently on 2.50 hectares of rented land grows beans, peas, potatoes for sale. All this activity brings monthly profits of 16,500 som (KGS).

Having concluded that the business is profitable since ecologically clean, delicious products are in high demand, Toktobubu applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase fertilizers and seed potatoes of an elite variety.

She plans to invest profits from the loan in further developing her business and to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seed potatoes in order to grow organic vegetables.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz junto con su esposo corren en una carrera contra reloj pues quieren que en el mes de diciembre poder ofrecerles a su hijo de 11 años y su hija de 16 años una buena navidad, con un humilde regalo y una prenda de vestir nueva para que gocen junto con sus amigos de estas celebraciones y no se sientan opacados.

Beatriz es una mujer dedicada a la confección a terceros, su negocio lo heredo de su madre quien le enseño todos los secretos de la profesión y que trabaja diariamente hasta terminar laborales 10 o 12 horas.

Beatriz para poder aumentar su utilidad y ventas realizo un diagnostico a su negocio donde vio que tiene una carencia y es que necesita de urgencia una maquina recubridora razón por la cual solicita un crédito para la compra de este.

Beatriz espera que esta máquina le ayude a en todo lo que necesita mejorando su forma de trabajar para ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y pro que no, en un futuro comprar una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Beatriz along with her husband is running a race against time as in the month of December she wants to provide her 11 year old son and 16 year old daughter a Merry Christmas. A humble gift , a new set of clothing so that they can celebrate the festival together with their friends not feeling gloomy.

Beatriz works sewing for third parties, She inherited her business from her mother who taught her all the secrets of the profession. She works daily 10 to 12 hours until she finishes her labors. Beatriz made a study of her business in order to increase her profits and sales. She saw what is lacking and needs at once, a over-lock sewing machine. So she is requesting a loan to buy one. Beatriz hopes that this machine will help her to do what is needed to improve how she works. Then she can offer her family a higher quality of living and why not, buy her own home in the future.

loans.use: to buy a serger for her workshop.

loans.name: Rosa Esmeralda

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer laboriosa a sus 37 años de edad y casada es propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace ocho años con ayuda financiera de su esposo, es el quinto ciclo que solicita a ADIM el financiamiento para su negocio, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de arroz, azúcar, papel higiénico, gaseosas, detergente, maruchan, pan, jabón de baño, sardinas, etc., por medio de los financiamientos ha logrado la diversificación de los productos, además que le ha permitido impulsar otro negocio como es el destace de cerdo y venta de ropa de segunda en menor cantidad, una de las ventajas es que tiene una pequeña finca que le proporciona frutas que las comercializa en su domicilio.
texts.en: Rosa is a hardworking 37 year-old woman.  She is married, and she's had a grocery store business in her home for 8 years with the financial support of her husband.  This is her 5th loan cycle with ADIM.  She will use this loan for her business, purchasing rice, sugar, toilet paper, soft drinks, detergent, instant noodles, bread, bath soap, sardines, etc.  Through these loans, she has managed to diversify her products and has also launched two other businesses: butchering hogs and selling small quantities of used clothing.  One of the advantages she has is that she has a small farm that provides her with fruit that she sells from her home.

loans.use: to buy consumer staples for her grocery store

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 32-year-old married father of four children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low financial and social situations of Palestinian refugees in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, he left school at an early age and started working 22 years ago as a mechanic to cover his needs and expenses. With his ambitions and hard work, he succeeded in opening his own mechanic shop, which helped him later in satisfying the needs of his wife and four beloved kids. 

Today, Hassan is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to expand his business through buying a necessary generator, which will facilitate his work by keeping the electricity in his shop stable so he can provide his customers with better and quick service.

Hassan hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a necessary generator to keep the electricity in his shop stable.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan works in agriculture farming, poultry and cattle.

Lan is 40 years old and she is married with 3 children. She lives inDong Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Lan has been involved in this business for 9 years. The main hardship that she faces in her life is not having a clean water system. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipments to make a clean water system.



With her business profit, Lan hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for a clean water system.

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoa works in agriculture farming, poultry and cattle. Thoa is 29 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Dong Son district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province

This is Thoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Thoa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Thoa faces in her life is not having a clean water system.She is requesting a loan to purchase equipments to make a clean water system.

With her business profit, Thoa hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase equipments to make a clean water system.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites, 43, is a married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marites has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marites has requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marites has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en: Andresa is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 6 years, she has operated a fishing business in the Philippines. Andresa has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy gasoline, fishing nets, wood, etc. for her business. In the future, Andresa would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, fishing nets, wood, etc. for her fishing business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 53 years old and married with four children, one of whom in school, Evangeline works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, egg, etc.

Evangeline has been in this business for 5 years. In the future Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lucilla

texts.en:
As the widowed mother of seven children, Lucila works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and she also earns income from the cafeteria she runs and from selling gasoline.  She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Lucila has sustained her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell at her store

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Lai, who is 29 years old, is a villager who lives in Kompong Chhnang province. To overcome her family’s hardship, she sells grocery items and grows rice to earn more income to support her family’s needs. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use her loan portion to buy a solar panel. 

She hopes that her family can have electricity to use so it can update its lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: To buy solar panel and improve her family's life

location.town: Kampong Chhnang province, Tek Phos district

loans.name: Nurunsa

texts.ru: Нурунса, 52 года, имеет 3 детей и 4 внуков, замужем. Нурунса в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и выращиванием хлопка, начав свой бизнес с 1993 года. Благодаря упорному труду Нурунсы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 7 коров, 7 овец, также есть 1,08 ГА поливной земли. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нурунса обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Нурунса планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также хочет накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Nurunsa is 52 years old, has three children and four grandchildren, and is married. As a main source of income for her family, Nurunsa raises livestock and grows cotton, having begun her business in 1993. Thanks to the hard work of Nurunsa, she currently has on her homestead seven cows and seven sheep, and also has 1.08 hectares of land.

With the aim of further developing her business, Nurunsa applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to increase the livestock count.

Nurunsa plans to invest profits from the loan in further propagating the count of domestic animals, and also wants to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to purchase livestock in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Joel's Group

texts.en:
Joel's Group is formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Joel, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 35 years old, is married, and has 4 children. Joel has been a farmer for 15 years and is often referred to as a very experienced farmer.

Joel isn’t new to One Acre Fund, he actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed his life has changed; especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year, Joel will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Joel's Group will purchase a total of 7 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Xoan

texts.en:
Xoan works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Xoan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Xoan is 49 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Xoan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
 
The main hardship that  Xoan faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick, and equipment for a toilet to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Xoan hopes to maintain a successful business, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment for a toilet to build a toilet

loans.name: Hương

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.

Hương is 37 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Dong Son district, a rural area in the Thanh Hoa province

This is Hương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Hương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Hương faces in her life is not having a clean water syterm . She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to make clean water system .

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to make a clean water system.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en:
Artemio is 58 years old and is married. He is from Ozamiz City, Philippines.

In 2012 Artemio had his first loan in PMPC. He and his wife worked together in raising their family; they were stretching their resources to sustain the family needs--especially the education of his children. Artemio was playing with the idea to start a bakery business, since he and his wife have the baking skills but has no starting capital. He joined PMPC, after hearing that he can avail financial assistance, Artemio applied a loan to start his bakery business and it's doing well for over 30 years.

Recently, he requested a loan to purchase additional bags of flour and other raw ingredients to increase his production to provide for more customers. He has planned to roll up his additional revenue for the fast approaching holiday season. Artemio is thankful for the financing of his capital needs. In addition, he wanted to expand and improve his business and hopes to live a happy and healthy life.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of flour and other raw ingredients to increase his production and  provide for more customers.

loans.name: Jovelene

texts.en:
Aside from her transportation services business, Jovelene also had a farm that she operates with her husband to make a living. Her previous loan was used for buying tires and has been repaid successfully.

She requested a new loan recently to purchase banana-planting materials and organic fertilizer for her farm. She is hoping that through these business activities her child's future will be secure.

loans.use: to purchase new banana-planting materials and organic fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth is 56 years old and the proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hard-working individual.  She is representing her group of 11 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Ruth has noticed that she has been able to save more money.

Ruth described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited also to be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize.  Now she will be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Ruth’s group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Chúc

texts.en:
Chúc operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.

She is 51 years old and married, with four children.  The family lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2007, Chúc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business.  She has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She has been involved in her business for 7 years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build toilet.

In the future, Chúc hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Thúy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thúy works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is 26 years old and is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thúy first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Thúy has been involved in this business for 3 years.

The main harship that Thúy faces in her life is not having a hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick, and other equipment to build a toilet .

In the future, Thúy hopes to maintain a successful business, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick, and other equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Libardo De Jesus

texts.es:
Por vocación o por amor el trabajo son dos ideales muy diferentes que el señor Libardo tuvo en cuenta para iniciar su negocio.
Ejerce la profesión de cerrajero para las personas que no estén familiarizadas con el termino es una profesión donde trabaja con metales para crear puertas, ventanas, soportes y en general trabajos con metal.
Libardo aprendió dicha profesión en una institución acreditándose para ejercer su profesión y gracias a ella ha podido darle un hogar a su esposa y 4 hijos de 16, 19, 18, 23 años de edad que dependen en su totalidad de él.
Solicita un crédito con las aspiraciones de expandir su local, generar empleo, aumentar su inventario y tener un negocio sostenible en el tiempo  y el crédito lo invertirá en materiales de acero y compra de una maquina pulidora buscando un objetivo mejorar las condiciones de su hogar, dándoles una calidad de vida y estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
His vocation and his love for his work are two very different ideals that Libardo kept in mind when starting his business. 

He works as a metalworker. For those who are not familiar with the term, it is a profession where one works with metals to create doors, windows, supports, and metal works in general. 

Libardo learned this profession in an institution, where he became accredited to exercise this profession. Thanks to this, he has been able to give a home to his wife and 4 children of ages 16, 19, 18, and 23, who depend on him completely.

He is requesting a loan with dreams of expanding his shop, generating employment, increasing his inventory, and having a business that is sustainable over time. He will invest the loan in steel materials and to buy a polishing machine. His objective is to improve the conditions of his home and to give his children a good quality of life and education.

loans.use: to buy a metal polishing machine for his business.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie finds pleasure in doing her gardening. Not only is she doing her hobby, but she is also earning an income as well. 

At the age of 54 and married, she busies herself to provide enough for her family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for providing her capital to supporting her gardening activities. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to buy gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Tessie wishes to become the supplier of flowers to neighboring towns.

loans.use: to buy gardening tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Adriana Patricia

texts.es:
Adriana una mujer de 46 años de edad que ha sabido salir de dificultades, que se levantó del suelo una vez que se separó de su esposo quedando con dos hijos y pro su emprendimiento y creatividad logro criarlos, alimentar y ofrecerles estudio con el negocio de confección directa, para las personas que no saben los que realizan confección directa son aquellos que confeccionan sus propias prendas y las venden en el mercado. 

 Gracias a unas clases que tomo aprendió todo del negocio y hoy quiere un impulso para seguir adelante y mejorar, pensando en al temporada de diciembre, le gustaría solicitar un préstamo para comprar materiales trextiles, básicamente telas, y accesorios para decorar las prendas pues innovara el mercado con diseños atrevidos que retan y rompen la rutina de lo comúnmente visto en el mercado.
texts.en:
Adriana is a 46 year-old woman who has known how to get through difficult times.  She picked herself up after separating from her husband, who left her with 2 children, and through her entrepreneurship and creativity she managed to raise and educate her children with her dressmaking business. She designs and makes her own garments and sells them in the market.  She learned this trade thanks to some classes that she took, and now she wants to give her business a boost so that she can improve it and move forward.  

For the month of December, she is planning to take a loan to buy textiles, basic fabrics, and accessories to decorate garments, so that she can update the market with bold designs that challenge and interrupt the routine of what is commonly seen there.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking supplies for her business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca es una mujer exitosa en su vida laboral, a sus 66 años de edad y casada, es propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio además elabora canastos artesanales, su negocio lo impulso hace cuatro años, fueron sus hijos que le dieron el capital para que iniciara su negocio y desde entonces lo ha sabido administrar, el crédito los solicita para la compra de palmas de bambú y productos químicos, es el cuarto ciclo que ADIM le brinda los financiamientos para su negocio y ha demostrado ser una persona responsable, asegura que uno de sus logros es la mejora de su negocio.
texts.en: Francisca is a woman who has been successful in her work life.  She is 66 years old and is married. She has a grocery store in her home, and she also works making handcrafted baskets.  She launched her business 4 years ago.  Her children gave her the capital to start the business, and ever since she has known how to manage it.  She is now requesting a loan to buy bamboo and chemical products.  This is her 4th loan cycle with ADIM, which is providing her with loans for her business.  She has shown herself to be a responsible person, and she states that one of her achievements has been to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business making baskets

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a 33-year-old married woman from Dulag, Leyte. She engages in making and selling tuba (coconut) wine. She has been in the food-vending business for 11 years. She has five children. Her oldest child is 11, and the youngest is 5. Her husband is a carpenter.

Paulina has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy supplies for making coconut wine like tungog (as it gives tuba its bitter taste and maroon color) and containers for wine storage. This will help Paulina make and sell more coconut wine and distribute it to the locals in the community. This will also create higher earnings.

Paulina is hoping that, with the capital she has requested, she will be productive in operating her business in a way that will help improve their way of living and also finance the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making coconut wine like tungog (as it gives tuba its bitter taste and maroon color) and containers for wine storage

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: A farmer from Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, this is none other than Anita. She is 39 years old and happily married with three children. She has been in the business for many years, and she generates income for the survival of her family. For it, she borrows money from PMPC amounting to 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). This is a big help for her, especially for the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farm to sustain the needs of the family

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Rolando se desempeña como mototaxista, con más de 10 años de experiencia brindando este servicio, sus servicios los brinda dentro la zona geográfica de Oyotún, él solicita préstamo para mantenimiento de su mototaxi, dicha inversión le servirá para poder brindar un mejor servicio, con gran influencia en el negocio; Rolando piensa en tener en mejores condiciones su mototaxi para poder seguir satisfaciendo de la mejor manera la demanda de dicho servicio en la zona. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rolando, 35, is married and has 2 children.  He lives with his family in a rural area in the Oyotun district of Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Peru.  In his community the people work mainly in agriculture, livestock production, and commerce.

Rolando works as a moto-taxi driver.  He has more than 10 years of experience in this line of work.  He provides transportation inside the geographic area of Oyotun.  He is requesting a loan to do maintenance work on his moto-taxi.  This investment will enable him to provide better service, and will greatly influence his business.  Rolando is planning to improve the condition of his moto-taxi so that he can continue to satisfy the demand for transportation services in his area.  In the short run this will enable him to increase his income and earnings, and thereby improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to do maintenance work on his moto-taxi

loans.name: Nora Maria

texts.es:
Nora una mujer cabeza de familia, madre de dos hijos de 19 y 21 años de edad, que paso por diferentes dificultades como separarse de su esposo quedando a cargo no solo de sus hijos si no de un negocio que es venta de leche el cual aprendió de este. 

Nora enfrenta un grave problema que es los bajos precios de venta el litro lo pagan muy mal pero es lo que sabe hacer y con lo que quiere continuar.

Para contrarrestar esta dificultad Nora quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de una vaca y un ternero, contrario al precio de leche estos animales tienen un alto costo que  el cual Nora no cuenta, por tal razón el monto es elevado.

Su meta es poder mantener a sus hijos, desplazarlos a Medellín para que estudien una carrera universitaria, comprar una vivienda.

Gracias al crédito podrá mejorar sus ventas pues tendrá una vaca adicional que le producirá leche.
texts.en:
Nora is the head of her household. She is the mother of two children aged 19 and 21. She has been going through difficult times, including separating from her husband which has left her in charge of not only their children but of a milk-selling business.

Nora faces a serious problem due to the the low selling price per litre of milk. The income is very low, but it is what she knows how to do and she wants to continue.

To counter this difficulty Nora wants to apply for a loan to buy a cow and a calf. In contrast to the price of milk, these animals are very expensive and Nora cannot afford the price because the amount is too high.

Her goal is to support her children, enable them to move to Medellín to study at university and to buy a home.

Thanks to the loan, she will be able to increase her sales as she will have an additional cow which will produce milk for her.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a calf for milk production

loans.name: Maria Adilia

texts.es: Maria Adilia es una mujer trabajadora de 56 años de edad, acompañada y propietaria de un puesto de comida en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulso hace dos años por medio del salario percibido de su trabajo anterior, tiene tres ciclos brindándole financiamiento la institución ADIM y ha logrado el crecimiento del mismo mediante inversión de productos y mejoramiento de la vivienda, el cual el crédito lo solicita para la inversión principalmente en granos básicos como es arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, pan, gaseosas, jugos, utensilios de cocina etc.
texts.en: Maria Adilia is a hardworking 56 year-old woman.  She lives with a partner, and owns a food stall in her home.  She launched this business 2 years ago with earnings from her previous job.  She has been through 3 loan cycles with ADIM, and she has managed to grow her business by investing in products and making improvements to her house.  She is requesting a loan to invest mainly in basic supplies such as: rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, bread, soft drinks, kitchen utensils, etc.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.en:
Eusebia finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 60 and married, she busies herself enough to sufficiently provide for the family. 

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of Paglaum MPC. She gives credit to the cooperative for providing capital in supporting her gardening activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

In the future, Eusebia wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

loans.name: Shirley Maritza

texts.es:
Shirley una madre de 33 años de edad, trabajadora, sonriente, muy pujante, luchadora y que ve siempre una oportunidad de progresar y darlo todo por sus dos hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad.

Shirley trabaja como independiente en una venta de mercancía, vende relojes, tenis, lociones siendo estos sus productos más vendidos, recorre puertas, casas, universidades, visita amigos en verdad se esfuerza mucho por vender un producto y vale la pena ya que sus hijos pueden comer un plato de comida. 

Shirley a través de un crédito quiere potenciar su negocio invirtiendo en surtido de tenis, lociones y relojes por lo que explica el monto del crédito dado que son productos que tienen un considerable costo. 

El prestamos va pensado en mejorar sus ventas, llegar a más personas, seguir dándole rentabilidad a su negocio y crecer como empresa.
texts.en:
Shirley is a 33 year-old mother who is hardworking, cheerful, feisty, and tenacious.  She is always seeking an opportunity to make progress and give everything to her children, aged 8 and 2.  

Shirley works independently selling merchandise.  She sells watches, sneakers, and lotions, as these are the best-selling items.  She sells door-to-door at homes and universities, and she also visits friends.  She truly works hard to sell products, and it is worth it because her children are able to eat.  

Through this loan, Shirley wants to empower her business by investing in new stocks of tennis shoes, lotions, and watches.  This is why she is requesting this sum, because these are products that are costly.

Through these loans, she plans to increase her sales, reach more people, keep her business profitable, and grow her business.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise to sell

loans.name: Róger Rubén

texts.es: Roger es un hombre trabajador de 47 años de edad, acompañado y propietario de una pulpería en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulso hace seis años por medio del salario percibido de su trabajo anterior, es primera vez que ADIM le está brindando el financiamiento para su negocio, el cual lo invertirá principalmente en granos básicos como es arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, pan, gaseosas, chiverías, etc.
texts.en:
Róger, 47, is a hardworking man.  He's in a relationship and is the owner of a grocery store in his home.  He started this business six years ago with the salary he earned from his previous job.

This is the first time ADIM is giving Róger a business loan.  He's going to invest it mainly in rice, beans, oil, sugar, bread, soda, snacks, and other basic staples.

loans.use: to buy basic staples to diversify the products he sells

loans.name: Hòa

texts.en:
Mrs. Hòa operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.
t
She 55 years old and married with three children. Hòa lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2006, Hòa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hòa has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. 

The main hardship that Hòa faces in her life is not having latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Hòa hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 58 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda does business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for 12 years. In the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ma. Nancy

texts.en:
Ma. Nancy is a married woman with one child, who is in school. She is 45 years old and is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ma. Nancy has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, buttons, etc. for her business.

Ma. Nancy has been in this business for seven years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, buttons, etc. for her business

loans.name: Elena Patricia

texts.es:
Gracias a su hermana la señora Elena hoy puede trabajar en un negocio de venta de arepas pues fue ella quien le enseño todo lo que sabe respecto al negocio y hoy en día quiere mejorarlo pero la falta de capital no le permite progresar y buscar mejores ingresos que le den para algo más que solo cubrir las necesidades básicas. 

Elena necesita una mesa en acero inoxidable pues por normas tiene que tener esta mesa, de lo contrario estaría expuesta a que le cierren el negocio, necesita un molino eléctrico pues la masa de maíz tiene que molerla para darle forma a las arepas y materia prima que sería maíz. 

Elena es una madre cabeza de familia soltera que solo tiene su negocio y tu puedes ayudarla a mejorar, este crédito no solo la hará cumplir la norma para operar con tranquilidad, si no que le generara mayores ventas, más clientes, sostenibilidad del negocio, mejorar su punto de venta, anímate ayuda a mantener una tradición antioqueña que poco a poco se ha ido perdiendo.
texts.en:
Thanks to her sister, Elena can today work in a business selling corn tortillas because it was she who taught Elena everything she knows about the business. 

Elena now wants to improve the business, but a lack of capital prevents her from making progress and seeking better income to allow her to do more than just cover her basic needs.

Elena needs a stainless steel table in order to comply with regulations, otherwise she would possibly be forced to close the business. She also needs an electric mill, because the corn dough has to be ground to give shape to the corn tortillas; and raw material, i.e. corn.

Elena is a single mother and head of her household. She only has her business. You can help her to improve her life. This loan will not only satisfy the law, so that she can operate her business without fear, but it will generate more sales, more customers, business sustainability and improve her point of sale. 

Help maintain an Antiochian tradition that is gradually being lost.

loans.use: to buy a work table for the preparation of her corn tortillas

loans.name: Nasser

texts.en:
Nasser is a 45-year-old married father of three children and a Palestinian refugee. He has worked as a painter for twenty-five years to cover the needs and expenses of his beloved family.

Nasser is trying hard to satisfy his family's increasing living costs and at the same time expand his business; thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car which will facilitate his work by allowing him to shift between the workshops and transport his equipment in an easy way.

Nasser hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.en:
Guldasta is a very hardworking woman. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a businessman. Guldasta has always wanted to start her own business to get ahead in this way. She took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ of a women's organization and got a certificate. She plans to start business with animal husbandry. 

Guldasta will buy milk cows and sell local people milk and milk products. Guldasta is a very hardworking woman and she hopes her business  will do well. Guldasta is asking for a loan of 2,000 USD to buy cows for organizing her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cows for organizing a new business

loans.name: Toàn

texts.en:
Mrs. Toàn works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Toàn is 36 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Toàn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Toàn has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that Toàn faces in her life is not having a  hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Toàn hopes to maintain  a successful business, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita raises and sells hogs to earn a living. She is married and has one grown child. She is a 61-year-old residing in Dulag, Leyte. She has been raising hogs since six year ago. Her husband's occupation is a driver.

Because of financial problems, Teresita has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase additional piglets and pig feed. These will help improve the way she raises and produces healthy pigs in the coming few months.

In the future, Teresita is hoping that she would expand her hog-raising business for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 56 years old and married. She lives in Mauswagon, Calamba, Misamis Occidental.

For the past two years, Antonia has been busy as a farmer. She earns 2,500 PHP each month and has been a member of Paglaum MPC for 2 years.

Antonia is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to afford maintenance and fertilizer for his plots of land to improve his yield

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall for her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy is a married woman with four children all attending different schools. She owns a retail business in a trading centre close to her home and she works seven days a week.

She started her businesses way back and was motivated by the fact that the business required less capital and was profitable. She is also an agriculturalist from which she gets extra income to support her family.

She hopes to use the loan to restock her retail shop. She usually sells her goods to traders and homesteads from neighboring trading centres and the community. Her hopes and dreams are to construct more rentals.

However, she faces a challenge of limited capital and customers who take goods on credit and delay payments, which affects her business. She is described as an honest and hardworking woman in business. She appreciates the services offered by lenders.

loans.use: To buy retail stock

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en:
Sultan is a 26-year-old single man who lives in Madaba. He has 6 family members whom he is working to support since his father can't, because he is too old to work. 

Sultan started his project by selling fruits and vegetables between neighborhoods from a pick up. With what he makes from the business he is paying for his siblings' schooling fees, as he wants them to have the opportunities he couldn't have, which was to continue to get a university degree.  

He is applying for the loan to rent a store where he can open a fruits and vegetables shop instead of driving around the neighborhood to sell.

loans.use: To rent a store where he can open a fruits and vegetables shop instead of driving around the neighborhood to sell.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
A local resident living in Kampong Chhnang province, Yen is 40 years old and a mother of three children. She overcomes her family’s hardship via rice cropping. Moreover, she sells firewood to earn more income. She can earn about 33,500 KHR per day. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend the loan to buy a solar panel. She hopes that her house can have electricity to use.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang province, Tek Phos district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Ca

texts.en: Mrs. Ca  has a manufacturing business in which she makes wood furniture. She is 55 years old, married, has two children and lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area of Thanh Hoa province. She has bas been involved in her current business for more than 10 years and is requesting her first loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main hardship that Ca faces in her life is the lack of a hygenic latrine. She is requesting a loan to buy sand, cement and bricks to build toilet.
