Her goals for the future are to maintain a successful business and to be able to buy the supplies and equipment she needs to run it well.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a toilet.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 34 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with 2 dependents who are now at their school age. 

Armen has been engaged for 4 years in a business of buying and selling dried fish and longganisa (Filipino cured sausages). He is also engaged in auto parts and body building as his part time jobs. He earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month from doing this type of work.

He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing 1 box of dried fish and 500 pcs.of longganisa for retail sales. Armen became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, he hopes to expand his dried fish and longganisa retailing business to other nearby towns in this province.

loans.use: To purchase 1 box of dried fish and 500 pcs.of longganisa (cured sausages).

loans.name: Zablon's Group

texts.en:
Zablon is 60 years old and has nine children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Zablon has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to earn enough to feed his family and, although he described his last harvest as very good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Zablon also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have an overall improved quality of life.

Obtaining this loan means that Zablon's Group will be able to receive a total of nine solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of eight acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Mellen

texts.en:
Hello, lenders, meet Mellen. She is a smallholder farmer from the Emenwa location in the Kisii region of Kenya. Mellen enjoys the support her mixed-farming business gets from her husband of 32 years, Fred. She is looking to expand by leveraging her business.

Mellen is seeking a loan to purchase more heads of poultry to increase the number from the 12 she already has on the farm. This will ensure that she cuts costs, reduce wastage and increases egg production. She also makes supplementary income from a dairy cow named Nyabarati (meaning brown in colour). Besides livestock farming, Mellen grows food crops such as maize and bananas and trees. 

Her plan is to invest this loan in a way that will give her enough income to take care of her six children's basic and educational needs.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Ánh

texts.en:
Mr. Ánh has a service business laying bricks. Ánh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Ánh is 48 years old, and he is married with two children. He lives and works in Bim Son town, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

The main hardship that Ánh faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

This is Ánh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With his business profit, Ánh hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, for his business to do well, and for his children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is a 60 year old, married woman and the mother of eleven children. She lives with her family in Leyte, Philippines. Diosdada runs a small sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. 

Diosdada is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell like biscuits, snack foods, noodles, canned goods, soda. beverages, soap, toiletries and condiments among other things. Through this, Diosdada will be able to improve her inventory thus attracting more buyers to her store. 

Diosdada hopes of making her business more profitable and stable.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like biscuits, snacks, noodles, canned goods. soda, beverages, soap, toiletries and condiments among other things.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a 60-year-old married woman and mother of two grown up children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This is the source of her income.
 
Cristina would like to avail a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries and ready to wear clothing. This loan will enable her to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store.
 
In the future, Cristina hopes to expand her store so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries and ready to wear clothing

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a widowed mother of five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosie is 37 years old and has five children who are in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Rosie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
As a parent of three children, Divina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Divina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  buy fishing materials like netting, gasoline, etc. for her fishing business.

Divina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like netting, gasoline, etc

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en: As the married mother of two children, Ma. Teresa works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from timber sales. She is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 from NWTF to buy equipment. Ma. Teresa has sustained her business with help from ten prior loans from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her earn enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy hardwood, nails, paint and other supplies to make a fishing boat

loans.name: Anacita

texts.en:
Anacita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy-and-sell charcoal business.

Anacita has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Anacita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Cheun's Group

texts.en:
Cheun, 59, is a father of nine children, living in Kampong Speu Province. He earns income via rice cropping, which earns him about 18,000 KHR per day to support his family's living condition.

This is Cheun's first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He leads a group of four members to get a new loan. As the group leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. He hopes that his family will live in good health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Soy is 45 years old and a mother of five children living in Kampong Thom province. To improve her family, she can earn income via rice cropping as a single source of income. This is the first time for Soy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

She will spend her entire loan portion to pay school fees for her son who wants to pursue a skill, majoring in Motorbike Repairing. She hopes that her son can have a good job after graduating.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son who wants to pursue a skill, majoring in Motorbike Repairing.

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene's Group is formed by 14 farmers in Kakamega South District and is being represented by Irene, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 25 years old, is married and has 2 children. Irene has been a farmer for 4 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Irene isn’t new to One Acre Fund, as she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has learned a lot from farming trainings ever since. 

This year, Irene will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Irene's Group will purchase a total of 7 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 8 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Andrew's Group

texts.en:
Andrew's Group is formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Andrew, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 36 years old, is married and has 4 children. Andrew has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Andrew isn’t new to One Acre Fund, as he actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed his life has changed; especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. 

This year, Andrew will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Andrew's Group will purchase a total of 13 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
La socia Pamela pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia sigue  dedicándose al negocio de alquilar carros, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia. La socia solicito el crédito para comprar llantas.
texts.en:
The member, Pamela, belongs to Patrón de San Sebastián Communal Bank in the city of Cusco.

She still works in her car rental business.  She has worked in this business for a long time and it gives her personal satisfaction.  She wants to keep working so she can support her family.

Pamela requested the loan to buy tires.  She's grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Baraka - Kibaha Group

texts.en:
Silvia, who is in her early 40s is married with one child who is still in school. She has been running a beauty salon for one year now. She works from 8am to 7pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Silvia's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy up-to-date salon products to meet her customers' requirement. She dreams of opening a grocery store.

Silvia will share this loan with her loan group "Baraka - Kibaha" which consists of eleven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon products to meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Xuân

texts.en:
Xuân is 50 years old and is married with three children. Xuân lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Xuân works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Xuân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

This is Xuân's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main hardship that Xuân faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick, to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Xuân hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Phượng

texts.en:
Phượng is 31 years old and married with two children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Phượng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Phượng has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phượng has been involved in her business for five years. The main hardship that Phượng faces in her life is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Phượng hopes to maintain a successful business, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 43-year-old married woman, and a mother of four children, from Leyte, Philippines. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than five years. This is the source of her income.

Imelda is requesting a loan to buy additional piglets and animal feed. With this, she will be able to improve her hog-raising business, as well as her income.

In the future, Imelda dreams of expanding this business so that it will augment her income. Furthermore, she wants to save money for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Duvan Antonio

texts.es:
Fredonia tierra de campesinos, lugar de personas pujantes, luchadoras, honradas y trabajadoras como el señor Duvan quien trabajo con ganado porcino y cría de aves.

Es un padre de un pequeño bebe de 3.5 años de edad y solo los padres saben ese amor que sienten pro los hijos un sentimiento inexplicable que te hace trabajar y superarse así mismo para darle todo a ese hijo o por lo menos así lo siente Duvan que buscando una mejor calidad de vida para su familia quiere solicitar un apoyo monetario para la compra de 4 cerdos y concentrado para ellos y sus aves.

El negocio de Duvan es la fuente del sustento para su familia por eso pide el apoyo para que este sea sostenible en el tiempo.
texts.en:
Fredonia's a land of farmers and a place of thriving, persevering, honest, and hardworking people like Duvan, who works with pigs and fowl.

He's the father of a little three-and-a-half-year-old baby.  Only parents know that love for children, an inexplicable feeling that makes one work and improve, as well as give everything for that child--or at least that's the way Duvan feels.

Duvan's looking for a better quality of life for his family.  He wants to request financial support to buy four pigs and concentrated feed for his pigs and his fowl.  His business is his source of income for his family, so he's requesting support for his business to be sustainable over time.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal feed

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.en:
Maria Concepcion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Maria Concepcion has been in this business for 10 years and earns more income from food vending.

Maria Concepcion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her business
